Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service staff made stay enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Harvestsewn
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise to find this hotel one of the best experiences of our long weekend trip to Chicago. The service staff was wonderful, especially Tracee at the front desk (so personable and went above and beyond for us even when she was very busy) and Brandon at the entrance in the evenings. Every need attended to quickly and without any fuss. Even a door closure problem was promptly and efficiently handled by the hotel repairman right after we reported it. Their free breakfast was also remarkable with so many items, including fresh fruit, sectioned grapefruit, mixed fruit, yogurt, belgian waffles, eggs, breakfast potatoes, biscuits and gravy----too many things to mention here. The breakfast table seating area was very large and attendants were present to assist with anything we needed as well as keep items well stocked. I did not find the downtown noise to cause any sleep problem but 2 others in our group did use the free earplugs which worked well for them. We had good advice from the service staff on a great pizza restaurant plus a coupon for a free dessert there. Our suite was cleaned well each morning---they even washed our dirty dishes. We will definitely stay again when in Chicago. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “10 Days of Bliss.”
Reviews.Author: TimStephens
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to type a quick note on what a great time I had at your Hotel. I also wanted to single out some young people that staff your front desk... Jamica, Tracee and Brandon. I was there for 10 VERY busy days at your hotel and they were always helpful, friendly and attentive. Great attitudes EVERY day, even under pressure. Refreshing to see young people that are obviously enjoying what they do. Give them all a bonus and a raise. :) I highly recommend the Downtown Hampton Inn! Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cellini03
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for two nights last week during a business trip to Chicago. The hotel was recommended by a colleague and we were very happy with the choice. The hotel is situated easy walking distance from the magnificant mile - so easy to access many shops and restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful and I liked that they had signs up warning about the change over to daylight saving. Also, there were signs about the noise from the surrounding streets and the hotel offered free earplugs which were very useful. I had a street facing room and with the earplugs it was no problem getting a good night's sleep. The room was large, good bathroom, tv, comfortable bed, everything you could need. I would definitely stay here again when I'm back in Chicago again for work.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, service, clean, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: 13JLE
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly, helpful, clean, comfortable bed, no noisey heater/airconditioner, temperature controled, great breakfast, well stocked and serviced, best ever stay in a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: jane f
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the week-end at this hotel for my daughters 14th birtday with three other teen-age girls, and I couldn't have asked for a better place to spend it. There was a little mix-up with our check in simply because of a miscommunication, but within less than 20 minutets it was taken care of and off we went to our suite. We had a king size suite which was very nice...clean with nice furnishings. And the bed...well let's just say that I slept very well that week-end. The central location was great...close to great eating places, and great Chicago attractions. Did I mention the staff? Amazing, wonderful, kind, and all kinds of helpful. We had gotten a taxi over the the Hancock building (which the hotel staff graciously got for us)...well it's not so easy to get a van taxi so we started walking back and were going to hail a taxo on our way back if we found one. We got lost and I called the hotel for directions...the directions were great, although we found a taxi and skipped the walking. We asked for reccomendations as to were to eat and were given a great place to get some great deep dish Chicago pizza that wsa within walking distance of the hotel. I just can't say enough about the staff and how great they were. The breakfast was great both morning that we were there, and the fact that "breakfast room" was open 24 hours to sit and "hang out" in with free coffee was great. My teenage girls sat in that room for hours eating popcorn and enjoying the free wifi. All in all I have zero complaints about this hotel...I will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Views, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JD G
Reviews.Content: Staff was very quick and helpful. Rooms were clean, and felt homey. The breakfast was dope and the view was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business when I'm in Chicago and I always have a great experience. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. If you are able to get a room upgrade, the 2 room suites are very spacious. The rooms are very modern and clean and of course the beds are super comfortable. (I love the Hampton Inn beds).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: We had the most pleasurable experience at the Hampton Inn Chicago Downtown, it was wonderful. You could not ask for a better staff and management team. They were very knowledgeable and fun! The recommendations for eateries, places to see as well as bus and train information was spot on. The hotel was very clean. Our room was very clean, pretty quiet and very comfortable. We had breakfast every morning and it was good and fresh. I work for American Express Business Travel and will be recommending the hotel to our business travelers, as well as my friends and family. Don't let the "next to fire station" comments scare you. It's not bad at all, and it's not all day, everyday. The location of the hotel is perfect. You can walk to allot of tourist places and awesome eateries! We will definitely being staying here during our next Chicago visit. Thank you! KLH Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Research-R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an awesome, impromptu family weekend trip to Chicago. We ended up staying at the Hampton Inn by default, since we try to stay at Hilton properties and the Chicago Hilton and Embassy Suites were booked. We got a great deal for a huge, one bedroom family suite with full-size fridge, microwave and dining room table. Although it was no-frills, it was very clean, spacious and comfortable for our family with little ones. The kids loved the pool (which was a little heavily chlorinated-which is good and bad for various reasons) and the adults were able to sit and relax and watch the kids swim without it being too crowded. The service was really excellent and all of the staff members were more than friendly and helpful. From the front desk to the bellmen to the servers at the (free) breakfast-everyone had a big smile and a kind word to share. We ate at Rosebud's, which is attached to the hotel, and it was very nice and the food was delicious (almost a little fancier than we expected, tho.) As mentioned by many, the hotel is right next to the fire station (somehow I missed that when I was reading previous reviews) so there were lots of sirens at all hours of the day...however, it didn't really impact our stay/sleep because we were expecting city-noise, and it was more of a drone. The kids actually thought it was cool "city experience" to see all of the trucks and hear the sirens:) Another "good to know" is that the hotel is a few blocks from Michigan Avenue, so although you probably could walk, we opted for a cab since it was cold and we had children with us. A $7 cab ride took us back and forth to American Girl/Water Tower. Overall, a great stay. Would definitely return. Hope this is helpful:)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ErinMarieP
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay here was perfect. Janita Walton and Tracee Moore were the friendliest, most helpful people ever. The valet guy even let me use his personal phone charger since I had forgotten mine at home! I would highly recommend choosing the Hampton in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn Ever”
Reviews.Author: KatieCT045
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Chicago, you should seriously consider staying at this Hampton Inn. It's location is perfect - one stop away from the subway with easy access to all Chicago has to offer. This is our second time staying here (2/18 to 2/21) while visiting Chicago and I expect to stay here again when we visit in May. The rooms are very clean and large compared to what I am use to when visiting a large city (i.e. New York). Many of the rooms with king beds have a fridge and microwave which is very handy for storing drinks and snacks. The staff is always helpful - happy to bring extra linens or arrange for a cab. They always have smiles on their faces and seem pleased to be at your service. I do want to mention on our last stay that one of the desk clerks (Brandon) provided service to us that is usually found in a five star hotel. I spoke to him on the phone the night before I arrived and was surprised that he remembered me when I checked in. Every evening upon return to the hotel he greeted my friend and I by name. He assisted us with our take out order for our first dinner in town (late arrival) and with some other small tasks which made our visit that much smoother. Clearly the hotel management at this Hampton Inn location is doing something right by emphasizing customer service. I do hope that the parent corporation notices their successes and lets them share what they've learned with their other employees.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: kathy s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a theater overnight and it was great. The staff was the best. They are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: trbyo
Reviews.Content: We spent on night here on a multi-generational "girls" trip to Chicago with the highlight being visiting the American Girl Store for my daughter! There were 4 adults and my 8 year old so this room was perfect. There were 2 beds in the bedroom and a pullout sofa in the LR area so all 5 of us could stay in one room. The room was large, even had small kitchen area. It was very nice. The bathroom area was separated (which I prefer) so the toilet/shower closed off from the vanity/mirror area which helps when you have several women getting ready in the morning. The free breakfast buffet was fantastic! It was huge and had everything you could imagine. The only downside was it was very crowded so there was no place to sit, even with them opening up a conference room for overflow. They had trays so we just took up to our room. While not perfect scenario, it was by no means a deal breaker and it was a Saturday morning of Thanksgiving weekend. Location seemed to be pretty good. (I had never been to Chicago) It was about a 10 min taxi ride from the train station and we walked everywhere else. Didn't seem like that far of a walk to the Water Tower area or Millenium Park and we even walked to Rainforest Cafe. Some walks were longer than others but we expected that and at no time did we feel unsafe, etc. Hotel staff was pleasant and they held our bags for us upon arrival as it was early morning and our room was not ready yet. (which turned into all day as we didn't get back to hotel until evening) They also held them for us all day on Saturday as our train was not until later in the evening. There was a small snack shop off the lobby which we purchased some snacks. I would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Water0x
Reviews.Content: We've gone to this hotel to spend weekends and visit different Chicago attractions. We find it to be clean, comfortable, in a great spot (very close to subway station and the "Magnificent Mile"), not too expensive, and with free breakfast! We've made reservations on-line, and even though we have gone earlier than the official check-in hour, the room has always been ready for us. Breakfast is not some sort of "amazing experience", but it is free, you serve yourself the quantities you want/need and there is a lot to choose from: eggs, waffles, fruit, juices, breads, yoghurts, coffee, cereals, etcetera. There is a fire station just a block away, so you will hear sirens often. Some might find this annoying, but for us it hasn't been a big deal. For us it is a highly recommendable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel as always...”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood68
Reviews.Content: The Hampton inn & suites have never disappointed me. I was not disappointed with my stay in the downtown Chicago location. It was convenient to many local tourist spots. It's within walking distance to shopping and fine dining. My stay was for pleasure- visiting home after many years away. However there were many business travelers here as well. The decor is beautiful and the service was friendly. The breakfast was hot and abundant and the breakfast area was clean and bright. The only think I didnâ€™t like was paying for parking but that's life in the big city. I'm just not used to it anymore. The parking was close and it was gated so it worked out. I intend to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Value”
Reviews.Author: erster
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the downtown Hampton Inn & Suites but it won't be my last. Have been a guest at many Chicago hotels and experienced something wrong with every one of them -- even some that were way upscale. But this place was just right. My room, a King with wet bar, was modern, spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. And it was blessedly quiet. Complimentary breakfast was unusually sumptuous. Location second to none. And the rate was a fabulous bargain. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: taedaly
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here and LOVED it. The staff were over the top friendly and helpful. Clean and elegant common areas and rooms. The breakfast was great and a nice perk. The sirens can be annoying, but didn't at all diminish the quality of our stay- but you need to be aware going in- we packed earplugs and had no issues. The location was perfect for walking to all the downtown attractions. - Would certianly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home base for Michigan Avenue Shopping”
Reviews.Author: HerschelChester
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Chicago between Thanksgiving and Christmas for years, enjoying the shopping and decorations of Michigan Avenue and steak dinners. The Hampton Inn and Suites is as reasonably priced as any during this season now that we're not on a business expense account, with large clean suites, free WiFi and plenty of elbow room to store purchases. Michigan Avenue is just a few blocks away. One of our favorite restaurant groups is the Rosebud. The Rosebud Trattoria adjoins the hotel. Ruth's Chris steakhouse is also on the same block. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful which complement the convenient location. We plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: spikeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, free Internet, free hot breakfast, within walking distance from sights such as river cruises, Millenium Park, Museums, Michigan Ave, wonderful restaurants. Easy to get to by train from either airport. Don't rent a car. $40 a day for parking. Use public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Five Days”
Reviews.Author: LStone13
Reviews.Content: Wife and I and two grandchildren had a super Chicago city experience. The Hampton had great staff, super breakfast, nice pool and great location. Clean room and great beds.

Reviews.Title: “Location-that's it”
Reviews.Author: tulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated and the rooms show it somewhat. There is a firestation nearby which caused interrupted sleep. Front desk people were smiling all the time! A fun hotel at a good location if you're in town to have a good time. If it's for business, you may lose sleep because of internal and external noise.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: melrock
Reviews.Content: This large downtown hotel is in an excellent, central location, and is well run and warmly midwestern. Staff was expertly trained and uniformly welcoming, rooms were clean, and the service desk responded so quickly to a problem with our shower that I barely had time to get dressed before the workman arrived! Breakfast was excellent, stocked continuously and served in a spacious, well-lit room; there were even staffers wandering around offering warm-ups on coffee and mints. The exercise room and business room were well-kept and open 24 hours a day. In short, all the family was extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_McQ
Reviews.Content: A great location just off the Magnificent Mile on Illinois, almost at the dividing line between The Loop and the Magnificent Mile. My wife and I stayed here and could walk to the northernmost tip of The Mile and as far south Millennium Park. All staff including front desk, valet, breakfast staff and cleaning staff were outstanding. Our room was a king suite with seperate dining area, living room and bedroom. In wall safe was an appreciated item. I requested an inside room, not fronting Illinois, to reduce exposure to the fire trucks screaming out of the fire hall next door. Noise was not a problem. Rate was around the $100 a night mark, great value for this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get the room I booked :-(”
Reviews.Author: kmcvig
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the awesome reviews on this site! I booked a King suite. Upon check-in, I was notified the suite I booked was not available. They ended up giving us two adjoining rooms. Traveling with two toddlers, I was looking forward to the extra open space and a living room area, but didn't have time to object nor had time to dispute. The customer service was great, but booking rooms that aren't available is unacceptable. Pros: good customer service, comfortable beds, nice breakfast included, location, relatively cheap for a downtown hotel. Cons: VERY loud (I slept with the TV on though which tuned out all the noise), dirty hot tub, "heated" pool was too cold for my kids to even want to be in, booked room wasn't available, expensive parking (although all hotels are like this downtown)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2 nights King room - $90US/night Pros - Location north of the river very close to Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile). One street away from Grand Subway on the red line. - Spacious and clean room with microwave and fridge. Modern Decor - Complementary wifi - Complementary hot breakfast - Great selection of scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, fruits. - Pool and fitness centre were available. - Large flatscreen TV with cable channels. Cons - We were in room 715 which was close to the lift. Room door a little thin and you can hear people in the hallway a little. Also hotel across the road from a fire station - a little loud at times (the hotel does offer earplugs if you wish). Overall great hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: Finally! A great place to stay in Downtown Chicago that is affordable, clean, in a great location and with a superior staff! I couldn't believe the state rate was such a bargain, and even though the valet parking wasn't cheap, the service provided made it a good value. The front desk staff on check-in was exceptional. Very polite, professional and friendly. We asked for directions and recommendations several times for restaurants, the lakefront, museums, and a local bar - all of their assistance was spot on. The guys at the valet stand were so helpful. We decided to go around the corner to get a bite to eat and asked them to keep the car close by so that we could use it afterward. They made the arrangements and did it all without skipping a beat. Though I would allow 15-20 minutes lead time when you call for the car from the garage. As a Hilton Honors gold member, they upgraded me to a spacious suite with a king size bed in the bedroom, a full living room, and a kitchenette with a mini-fridge and microwave. The decor looked new and everything in the room worked great and was spotless. I loved the cabinetry they used (looked custom) and the granite countertops throughout. The breakfast service was one of the best I've had at a Hampton. Lots of choices, including different selections for fresh fruit, and good hot entrees. Plus it's located on the second floor with great views of the street below. They had breakfast attendants who were responsive and helpful. The doors to the rooms are not sound-proof however. But since I had a suite, the noise didn't make it through to the bedroom. All in all, one of the best Hamptons I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed For Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: XVEGASGIRL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a warm January weekend, the hotel lives up to most reviews. The front desk was so helpful, polite, and went above what you could expect. Housekeeping kept us 4 girls, in the King Suite supplied with all we needed. Everyone, including the breakfast staff, which all the girls loved the HUGE selections. Like others have said, arrange to have a quiet room, away from the Fire Station, this plus my usually t raveling ear plugs gave me no noise zone. Only minus, the 2 girls on the hideaway not too comfy.. Go and enjoy the location and comfy clean warm beds.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: RobC614
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from the 4th to the 8th of January and, from top to bottom, it was one of the most pleasant hotel experiences of my life. Though not a businessman I have had the good fortune to travel all across the US and Europe and have stayed in a fair number of different hotels and, with the benefit of all of that experience, I can honestly say this hotel bested them all. I wish I could catalog everything that I thought worked well but among many thoughts: 1) The hotel was always clean and didn't feel "tired" at all. 2) The staff was exceedingly pleasant and went out of their way (from front desk to cleaning staff) to be courteous and helpful to guests. 3) The "little things" such as being provided complementary mints after breakfast on Sunday or having the cleaning staff not only clean my room but leave my things better organized than how I had left them. 4) User-friendly business center and a great complementary breakfast (quite a contrast with the more expensive hotels right near it) 5) No spotty internet (which is sometimes the case with "complementary wi-fi" in large cities) 6) Exceptional location at a great price. Honestly, I was pained to leave it was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton...Youre outdoing yourself!!!”
Reviews.Author: ceegee3
Reviews.Content: One block from the CTA red line, eyes shot from several very good restaurants and about a 4 block city walk to the magnificent mile, this hotel shines brightly. The Hampton Downtown Chicago is a great option for any stay in the city!!! I can not point out one thing I disliked about staying at this hotelâ€¦except having to leave. Upon arrival, it was a great personable check in at the front desk. We arrived into Chicago almost 3 hours before check in time and the greeter insisted she would check to see if our room was ready, and in the case that it was not she would be able to hold onto our bags for us. Fortunately though, our room was ready and we were ushered to an 8th floor suite that was a prime example of fantastic city living; all for a fraction of the cost of similar hotels in the area (some of which Iâ€™ve experienced very bad service). BTW I did mention SUITE with two rooms, including a kitchenette and a â€œliving area," complimentary breakfast in the morning, a pool, workout room and business center and yet still cheaper than a single room in many hotels nearbyâ€¦YES PLEASE!!!!! Our suite was located behind the building (highly recommend, 802 to be exact). Iâ€™m a sucker for tall buildings so I enjoyed having views of tall buildings near the hotel, even if they were not the more famous ones. The windows could be opened slightly to let in a quick breeze or perhaps to hear some city noise if youâ€™re like me :) The doormen always opened the door upon arrival and departure from the building and altogether it felt like my hard earned money had been spent in a great place and I was appreciated for doing so. Will definitely be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: funkymusic
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 year old son and myself stayed at this property the week after Christmas through New Year's. Staff here is extremely nice and helpful. They really go overboard to take care of you. We were upgraded to a suite which I highly recommend. We had a full living room and terrific kitchen with microwave plus a full bathroom and additional sink in the bedroom. Very handy when juggling the morning routine for 3 people. The location is outstanding. Great restaurants within easy walking distance. Our favorite was across the street and new since September of 2011 - Cantina Laredo. Absolutely outstanding modern Mexican. See my review under restaurants. Also the Italian Rosebud Trattoria restaurant located off the hotel lobby is terrific. Wonderful staff and large portions you can share. Highly recommended. The only negatives for us was the overcrowding of the breakfast room with large families and unruly children. The Hampton Inns do cater to families so if loud noise and children grabbing food (not using the tongs provided), coughing on the food, etc. concerns you this might not be the place for you. We found if we visited the breakfast room between 6-730 am took our choices to our room it worked better. Families need a nice hotel to stay at as well so I'm not begrudging them the experience but the hotel might be wise to post signs instructing parents to assist their small children with food choices rather than letting them grab at will. The hotel has a nice pool, sauna and hot tub as well. Prices are reasonable here. A good choice for a moderately prices vacation to a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at Hampton!”
Reviews.Author: Illinois1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I returned for our annual Chicago Christmas visit. We booked using my Hilton points, a 2 bed suite, but it was not ready when we arrived and after going for lunch, it still wasn't ready, but Ronnie (?) offered us a King suite as it was available. The room was very nice - spacious. Ronnie was nice enough to call our room to check if the room was suitable. We have stayed here many times, including before the refurbishing of rooms. The bathroom was not as clean as it could have been. Hair on the floor and mold around the tub. I did mention it to the staff. It was disappointing as we have always had exceptionally clean rooms and service while staying here. The breakfast is always plentiful and fresh! The staff are always friendly and helpful. I have never encountered rudeness in a Hampton staff member until this visit. I stopped at the front desk after calling numerous times with no answer. I asked if coffee would be replenished as all of the pots were empty, including hot water. The desk clerk was polite and offered to check. A gentleman unloading boxes in the gift shop, angrily told us that he had just filled the coffee. He went on angrily telling me that all I had to do was check. Well, my daughter and I had been there 10 minutes prior and there wasn't coffee or hot water. Other than this employee, everyone was wonderful. The location can't be beat. We took the redline to see It's a Wonderful Life at the Biograph. It's literally around the corner from the hotel. We used the free passes to go to Howl at The Moon which is always a fun time. We were not disturbed by any outside noises, but our room was on the opposite side of the fire station. We look forward to staying here next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great value”
Reviews.Author: William F
Reviews.Content: Very clean and large room. The pool and hot tub area is great. The front desk staff is very courteous and friendly, especially Janita. Only downside is that the views aren't as exciting as some other locations we've stayed at. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: wmichgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around Thanksgiving and were very satisfied with the hotel overall and especially with customer service and cleanliness. The corner suite that we stayed in was recently renovated with an attractive kitchenette, new furniture, carpeting, etc. The breakfast offered a good variety of choices and friendly, helpful staff. The coffee and hot water for tea and hot chocolate were made available at all times. The room and lobby areas were clean and the bedding is thoroughly washed between guests. We loved it...it is really a great bargain in downtown Chicago. The walk to the main shopping areas doesn't seem far at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown location”
Reviews.Author: MJFULTON
Reviews.Content: Yes, close to fire station but a good central location for shopping and good eats. Room was clean and staff were friendly and helpful. Good free breakfast on 2nd floor. Parking is $40+ but they were prompt in getting our car. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - walking distance from everything”
Reviews.Author: StehmanPhotography
Reviews.Content: During a four day business meeting in Chicago I stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago - Downtown. I was there in early May 2011 and stayed in one of the smaller king size bed rooms. We were on the outside part of the building. The Hampton Inn, as many others have mentioned, is right next to the Chicago Fire Department District 1 Headquarters. It's a very active fire station, and the windows at the Hampton Inn are not thick enough to muffle the sound of the sirens, squawks, and other nioses of the District 1 Headquarters. During my stay even though the bed was comfortable, I did not get a good nights sleep due to the noise factor. I was woken up 3 or more times each night as the fire department left their station. In fact, even noisy people on the street and traffic can easily be heard from my 7th floor room. They do provide ear plugs near the elevators and that should have been the tip off how noisy the rooms do get. The breakfast provided by the hotel was quite good. They had a nice variety, making it easy to find something to eat. I also appreciated that coffee and tea are available all day. We used their conference space, which was quite comfortable. The hotel did a nice job providing water, soda, and afternoon snacks. The room was spacious and worked great for the training I was part of. It was nice to actually have windows in the room as so many conference rooms are completely windowless. The best part about this hotel is the location. It is walking distance to just about everything you might want to do within the city. I loved walking around the city during the evenings and really seeing what Chicago has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: ederose
Reviews.Content: stayed from 12/12 - 12/14 on last minute trip with 2 girlfriends. got a double bed- 2 room suite for $111/night thru hotel website, special 7 day advance purchase...what an incredible value! (Was in Chicago in July with my husband and stayed at the Ritz-Carlton...while this was not as luxurious, the service and cleanliness was on par!) The room was very nicely decorated, the kitchenette had granite countertops, there was nice furniture, love that they wash the duvet covers...everything seemed fresh and clean. Had trouble with safe (didn't recognize code I had previously entered), and maintenance came to fix within 5 minutes and it worked perfectly after that. Doormen were very friendly and helpful getting cabs, Janita at front desk was super-- saved last complementary umbrella for us on a rainy day! The location is perfect...just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. so really convenient for shopping/restaurants. Beds were comfortable and cozy...and we had no trouble with noise from fire engines (read that in previous reviews). Overall, we were very happy with this hotel, and will definitely return in the future! It would also be great for a family with the kitchenette and extra living space (sofa pulls out to bed).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in December. The staff were very friendly and helpful, always greating us with a smile and warm welcome as we entered and left. Janita, the manager, really stood out as being very customer-service oriented and made our stay even more enjoyable. The staff helped recommend restaurants, shopping, transportation, definitely full service! Breakfast was very good for being a free breakfast, and the breakfast room view is spectacular. The room was very nice, beds were very comfortable, and they offer ear plugs if needed to drown out the sound of the fire trucks (hotel right next to the fire station, and the fire trucks go out with sirens blarring frequently in the night). Fire trucks didn't bother me. It was an amazing location and absolutely delightful staff who made our stay very enjoyable. I'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dpuck1998
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner sweet and it was huge. Worth the extra money to have a nice spacious room. The room was a little worn and dated, but overall very comfortable. Try to get a high floor as the traffic noise at night can be disturbing, but still a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PHurley
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while visiting Chicago. Walking distance to shopping and theaters. Lots of places to eat close by. The staff was helpful and friendly. Nice breakfast and comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...this hotel and staff are GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: Pleased800
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky enough to have a weekend event at the Hampton Inn and Suites three times a year for the past several years. We continue to be impressed with the accomodations, both clean and comfortable, and the location can't be beat! In planning for the group, Ruth, Jenna, John and Juan have been a pleasure to work with; but all the staff, including the front desk staff, the valet and the porters have made the weekends enjoyable and made the families we work with feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Great Hotel- Great People”
Reviews.Author: hkramer1011
Reviews.Content: I knew the location of this hotel was great, and I stay in Hamptons frequently for business and pleasure, because it's always a great value. But I was amazed at the folks managing and working at this hotel. It's only a few blocks from Michigan Ave. and the Miracle Mile, and great restaurants are walking distance ( Gene and Georgetti's for example, and Rosebud Trattoria is connected to the hotel) The hotel is extremely clean and well appointed. Concierge , Rhondalyn Buckhanon (Ronnie) was amazing at the level of service she provided. When I go back to Chicago, I'll be at this hotel. You cannot go wrong.,

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: mccallja1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located three blocks from Michigan Ave and all the shops. Skybridge to Ruth Chris Steakhouse, or many more restaurants within walking distance. As far as the room, it was a typical Hampton Inn room.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn and Suites Chicago...nice.”
Reviews.Author: manateechillville
Reviews.Content: We found the accommodations to be clean and well appointed. Great location in Chicago downtown. We were particularly impressed with the VERY helpful and pleasant staff at the front desk, valet parking services, and luggage services. Janita at the front desk helped us correct a reservation error without any problem. We enjoyed our stay very much and will return ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago experience”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler2001
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a four day get away in June 2011.The Hampton Inn was a great place to stay and well within walking distance of it all.The staff at the hotel from the valet when we stepped out of the car,to being welcomed back everytime we returned this is one of the best Hampton Inns or any other hotels we have stayed at.We had a corner suite on the 10th floor and the view was great.There were more great restuarants within walking distance then a person can go to in four days for sure.The room was very comfortable and this is one of the only downtown hotels with a pool.We will definitely choose this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: sshannon
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay here, and overall I give it a big thumbs up. The location is just perfect for checking out the great Chicago food scene, the amazing Millenium Park, and really all points of interest in Chicago. The staff, especially the front desk staff, was really really friendly and accommodating. We had read about the fire station across the street and our room looked right down onto it. Maybe its just because we're city folks, but we barely noticed it. The sirens only go for a few seconds when it happens, and from the 9th floor, you could hear it but it wasn't, well, alarming. My only complaint was the breakfast wasn't as good as I've come to expect from Hampton Inn. Usually several dishes are rotated but we got scrambled eggs (which I don't love in general and were only okay in specific here) every single morning (that's four mornings in a row). Sometimes the only other hot entree (besides the oatmeal) was spiced potatoes, once there was the biscuits and gravy that is always only okay and one morning we got sausage patties. If they had served those little mini-omelettes just one morning I'd have been happy. On the last morning, even the oatmeal was sad and undercooked. We feasted on dinner leftovers that morning. But I can't emphasize enough how wonderful the location is - we explored far and wide but so many things were within walking distance or a short cab ride. And if you can catch any of the front desk staff in a bad mood, I'll pay you money. On our last day, we wanted to stash our luggage because our train wasn't leaving for another 6 hours and we wanted to kick around the neighborhood. The porter had just gone on break and the lovely lady behind the desk came and checked our baggage herself, even though it weighed a ton (I'm hoping she was able to keep from moving it into the baggage room until she had help, but she checked it and had us on our way right away). We'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: beachesIndiana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three night get away. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible breakfast provided”
Reviews.Author: gfreeswisco
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a great location for shopping, restaurants and bars. The breakfast that was provided with your stay was incredible. Very convenient location to use the subway - Red line - to get down to the theatre district, Art Institute, etc. The only reason I did not give it a five was because we found a dirty tube sock from a previous guest on the floor of our room and the hotel was next to one of the Chicago Fire Stations, thus, sirens throughout the night. Glad I had may earplugs! Despite, I would stay here again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Girl's weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mel h
Reviews.Content: What an awesome hotel! Everything was perfect, from the location to the accommodations. The hotel staff, particularly Janita Walton, was very helpful with suggestions of things to do in Chicago and getting us there! The location is within walking distance to many wonderful restaurants, shows, and shopping. Two restaurants are connected to the hotel...Ruth Chris and Rosebud Trattoria...both were excellent! Superior guest service and cleanliness of the rooms/hotel - A+. A definite return trip to the Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown is in order! Ask for Janita...she was awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: dom4travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated a couple of blocks off the Magnificent (or is it Miracle) Mile! There are countless restaurants within easy walking distance and it is about 5 short blocks to the L Station. The rooms are spotless and comfortable. The decor was simple and modern. While this is not the Ritz or Waldorf, the price is very reasonable for the quality of this property. The front desk staff is awesome and so helpful. The gym was small but had decent and well-maintained equipment. If you are looking for a clean, nice hotel in a great location-this is it! I would definitely stay here again. A special thanks to Kristin and Ronnie at the front desk, as they were so friendly and helpful throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Where's the Fire?"”
Reviews.Author: 0Christie0
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was very centrally located so that we were able to see all the sites without too much trouble. With that said... location isn't everything. The rooms were nothing spectacular, in dire need of updating(ie; peeling wallpaper and icky grout) and very very dry! If looking to stay here bring your humidifier! Not only did we have trouble sleeping with sore throats due to the arrid conditions but the constant serenade of fire sirens from across the street kept us on edge all night... even with earplugs! Our mistake...we should have investigated the location better. Had we known upon reserving our room what we know now, we would have made a better choice. On the plus side, the staff was friendly the complimentary breakfast was as good as always.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, amenities and price”
Reviews.Author: pretty-lady44118
Reviews.Content: We (five girlfriends) wanted a hotel that was close to art, food and shopping. We chose Hampton Suites downtown Chicago because of the features showcased on their website, the ratings on tripadvisor, and price. We reserved a two-bed room plus a three person suite with a pullout sofa for three nights. We got a spacious corner suite with an adjoining room - perfect. Everyone was very comfortable, even with the pullout sofa. The complementary breakfast was especially nice with real eggs, sausage, potatoes, waffles, oatmeal, muffins, fresh fruit, coffee and tea. The entire hotel was extremely well kept, including the front entrance; the swimming pool and sauna were clean and inviting. The staff was particularly friendly and helpful, especially Yaneli at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but beware of sirens”
Reviews.Author: mimi1228
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my cousin and our two 11 year old granddaughters to the Windy City. We stayed in a corner suite which was fabulous! The room was quite large with a full kitchen! There was a grocery store within walking distance which worked out great. The hotel is totally non-smoking and had an indoor pool, hot tub and sauna. The bedroom had to queen size rooms and the living room had a sleeper sofa. Each room had their own TV and there was a dining room table as well. The draw back to the corner room was that we were across the street from the rescue/fire department so there were lots of sirens at night. We wondered why there was a jar of ear plugs available upon check in. The hotel is within walking distance of the theater district, many great restaurants as well as the trolley line. The free breakfast at the hotel was delicious and varied each day. Free wifi and other amenities made this a great place to stay. Even with the noise, we would stay here again. The staff was exceptional and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: bmford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton downtown Chicago for a mini family reuinion in November 2011. I had origionally booked a suite and then upgraded to a corner suite with my Hilton points. We have stayed at a lot of high end properties, and I wasn't expecting luxury, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The check-in was quick (less than 2 minutes). The front desk person was exceptionally friendly and informative and gave me a map of the city and all of the nearby restaurants. The room was on the 8th floor and was sparkling clean, and surprisingly hip. It had a full kitchen with a full size refrigerator and granite tops. The suite had panoramic windows with privacy shades and then full black out shades. The suite had 2 plasma tv's and free wi-fi. The morning breakfast was delicious right down to the coffee, of which I imbibed 2 cups every morning!! The indoor pool was nice. The hot tub was warm. The work out room was adequate and clean. The business center computers worked and I even printed my boarding pass. The only negative, which has been stated by other reviewers, was the noise. Chicago is a bustling city 24 hours a day, but being right next to the Chicago fire station does not help. We weren't in town to sleep anyway, so who cares? I have to say the the Hampton ticks all the boxes that a business traveler or casual traveler would want for a stay in downtown Chicago. What I hate most about hotels is when they nickel and dime you to death for wifi, breakfast, or use of the amenities. At this Hampton, all of this is included, which makes this hotel a great value in the heart of the city. I would stay here again without hesitation. Thank you Hampton!!

Reviews.Title: “A whirlwind trip...”
Reviews.Author: spidrman
Reviews.Content: .... as I entered the hotel, Tracee greeted me with respect and professionalism. After driving 5 hours in stop and go traffic, it was just what I needed. She was courtious and professional. The hotel is all non-smoking and we love it! The room was clean. A little dated, but keeping in the Downtown theme, was exceptional. They have valet parking on site, and the porter was very helpful. The wifi worked as expected. We would recommend it to anyone traveling, or stuck, in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great location,great staff,great value......”
Reviews.Author: 2011Niamh
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we felt at home here.The reception staff were so helpfull especially tracie, but really all were great. Room was clean, had a fridge,sink and coffee maker. Yes the Chicago Fire Dept is right be side hotel, our room was at front but we had no issue with noise. We love food and trying new things so the location is brillant for resturants within walking distance or a few stops on the red line which is right around the corner, it was also great for connection to the train to and from airport. Our trip was for the Chicago marathon, best day every...... Great to have a breakfast room(very clean, excellent staff here too) with hot food, breads and cakes, fruit and even hot waffles that you make your self yummie, all hot drinks are availible till 10pm free. Used the gym small but was great for us, pool small too but we had it to ourselves. Lovely Italian resturant with enterance from hotel. Been to Chicago many times but now we will onlly book here. thanks to every one for making it a trip to remember.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: barbi62
Reviews.Content: My sister & I chose this hotel because of the location, it had 2 beds, and was a suite with a kitchen. The staff was absolutely wonderful. We were on the 8th floor in a corner suite. The room needed to be updated in my opinion, but it was clean. The nice thing was the separate bathroom, in addition to the 2nd sink which was in the bedroom area. There were 2 TVs, plenty of dresser drawer storage, climate control, granite countertops, a magnified mirror in the bathroom, full kitchen with dishes (we didn't use anything other than refrig & coffeepot). Other than the occasional siren (fire station across the street), the room was quiet. We brought earplugs, and only heard the sirens once each night right after going to bed. The breakfast was very good - quiet a nice variety. The staff was the best part. Everyone was so helpful & friendly. It was in a great location for us - within walking distance to Navy Pier & restaurants & shops. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the midst of higher priced options”
Reviews.Author: krandy21784
Reviews.Content: This place is just as nice as the much higher priced options that are around it. It is within easy walking distance of many major attractions at aroun4100 dollars less than the Marriott, hyatt etc. The rooms have everything else they have plus the convenience of being close to Weber Grill and other great choices. They have a really nice Italian restaurant off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: romancewriterTN
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt the best hotel we've ever stayed at. From the moment we walked in the door we were treated like welcome guests. Tracee and Brandon, especially, were outstanding. We were upgraded to a better suite without extra charge because they'd overbooked the one we reserved, and it was magnificent. The room was huge, clean, and comfortable. We were in the corner overlooking Dearborn on one side and West Illinois Avenue on the other, and I adored it. Everything we needed was right there without having to ask twice or wait. They helped us find our way around Chicago, pointed out fantastic restaurants and places to see, even booked us a river tour. All with smiles, lively conversation, and the sincere joy of doing a job they obviously love. We are definitely coming back to Chicago, and we are definitely staying at this hotel when we do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: drakkar91
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided for a quick weekend getaway over the busy Memorial Day Weekend in Chicago. Searching multiple hotels online, the Hampton Inn & Suites offered a great rate package that included Free Parking. In addition, the hotel also offers Free Breakfast, Free Internet, and a nice pool, hot tub and sauna! That all adds up to a lot of value in the heart of downtown. Our room was very nice and stylish, clean and featured a single cup coffee maker. Our room didn't have a microwave or refrigerator, but I wasn't expecting either. I'm not sure if this is true of all rooms. The bathroom was modern and fresh and Hampton Inn (this is my 2nd stay) have really soft bath towels! The softest of any chain actually. The only 'miss' for the hotel is the valet didn't understand our reservation, and instead directed us to self park. His directions included making a left turn which required breaking the law in order to do so. Upon check-in, we were advised that the valet should have parked the car. The front desk agent at check-in was exceptional, and apologized repeatedly. She really did her best to make up for the mistake, and was extremely professional. In the end however, I had to ride with the valet, to the ramp to locate my car so they could park it properly. Not the best solution. We indulged in the pool, hot tub and sauna, which were all very lovely on a rainy Sunday. Like any hotel, the only downside in this area are parents who are too busy texting to watch their young children run around. One nice feature is the hotel is connected through interior access to two restaurants, including Ruth Chris Steakhouse. Granted, Chicago is home to great restaurants on every corner, but this was a nice amenity. As was the complimentary umbrella, which we scored before they ran out. Complimentary breakfast was as expected, and as always, very busy in a family friendly hotel on a holiday weekend. The staff managed this chaos well, keeping most food well stocked. If I was on business, this would have proved less than pleasant. At check-out, we were genuinely asked how our stay was, and with the exception of the parking dilemma, everything was excellent. I would recommend and return to the Hampton inn & Suites for a leisure visit, or midweek business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, EXCELLENT customer service!”
Reviews.Author: knarte
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Chicago Marathon and the hotel was SOLD OUT. That fact though did not at all impact the level of service, cleanliness or enjoyment of our stay which I think says something. Any requests that we had or situations that came up every person we interacted with was nothing but accommodating and not only willing, but INTERESTED in doing whatever they could to make our stay perfect. The continental breakfast was DELICIOUS and had a great variety - the room itself had great views and was very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect, we didn't need a car the whole weekend - took a train from the airport to the hotel and anything you could want is within walking distance. The 7-Eleven across the street was handy for little snacks or forgotten toiletries. The gym is great as is the pool. After our stay here I am looking into joining the Hilton Honors program - if all their hotels are like this I don't know why I would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Half Marathon Stay”
Reviews.Author: etrimble
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was great, the staff was exceptional

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SumBeach_1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice but I was not as excited as some on here are. Not dirty, just not spectacular. However, location was great. Able to walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, won't be back”
Reviews.Author: beverly1_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend to see sights and visit family. We stayed in a corner suite that faced the fire station. It was a very noisy not only because of the sirens, but also because our furnace fan was loud and ineffective at heating our corner suite.(I would have hated to stay in that room when it gets below freezing outside.) The maintenance man came and turned the furnace on after our first night without heat. Old unused baseboard furnace vents outlined the outside walls of our rooms and were falling off with some of the metal parts just laying on the floor. The windows were thin and opened without screening to the outside street below. There was much confusion over our booked room through out our stay. Thankfully, Ronnie was very helpful and straightened our charges out. The cleaning staff did a great job of cleaning our room over our three day stay. The complimentary breakfast was good. The hot tub was a warm tub our first night, but on the second night, it finally did get hot. The sauna did not work. The pool was clean and had plenty of towels for guests. The afternoon front desk was the same workers all three days we were there. At times we found them to be unprofessional and rude. There are several choices of hotels in Chicago, therefore next stay to visit our family, we will look for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Courteous Staff and Comfortable, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bobmolnar
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago fit my needs perfectly on a recent stay for a mid-week conference (We-Fr). When I booked, I didn't expect a luxorious full suite for the price I paid -- I expected merely a bed and television. Instead, I got a kitchenette, a living/dining room, and a separate master bedroom. The best feature of this location is the staff. From the minute I arrived at valet until checkout, I encountered nothing but courteous and attentive staff members who offered assistance every step of the way. The bed was so comfortable that I asked the front desk clerk what brand of mattress they used when I checked out. She emailed it to me later that morning. The ONLY drawback is something the hotel cannot control -- it's located across the street from a very active firehouse. The common sirens of ambulances and fire engines was a minor annoyance, but nothing too bad. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any business traveller who wants a reasonably-priced hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago with an outstanding staff and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn007
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again based on the cleanliness of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff, and the location. I felt good knowing no bed bugs had been reported and that no pets are allowed on the property. I have only two reservations. I question the security measures, and we stayed in a suite which was very nice, but it had no kitchen equipment except for paper towels. We could have used utensils and a corkscrew, for example. I agree with DavidHBerkshire_UK, a recent reviewer, regarding staying here again on a revisit. I think this Hampton is definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly decent, well featured hotel a few minutes walk from the action”
Reviews.Author: DavidHBerkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a massive corner suite . The room was fine and had everything you'd expect including very large TVs , coffee makers and so on. It provided a comfortable base. The staff were friendly and gave some spot-on restaurant recommendations. You're a 5-10 minute walk from the Chicago River and the Magnificent Mile with a subway station a block away, so its a convenient place to stay even if it isn't itself in a particularly interesting neighbourhood. The one criticism I'd make here is that the "free" breakfast just isn't very interesting. its calories not enjoyment in other words. We had breakfast out after the first day, at "Eggsperience" two blocks away and that was much better. I'd stay here again on a revisit, though I'd probably check out any deals available at one of the grander riverside hotels as well. For everyday good value and middle-range comfort and amenities, you'll find this Hampton hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff and breakfast, Noisy location”
Reviews.Author: cds02
Reviews.Content: The Staff at Hampton Inn were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good with a lot of variety, hot food, fresh fruit and plenty of tables/space. Unfortunately, the hotel is located across the street from the fire station. About 3-5 times a night the fire engines go out on calls with the sirens on. If you can sleep through the noise, it's a nice place to stay. There a lot of good restaurants within a few blocks walk. The Red Line station is about a very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lori L
Reviews.Content: My 10 year-old daughter and I just spent a wonderful long weekend in Chicago. I chose the hotel because of the location and the fact that breakfast is included...and I get Hilton Honors points. The whole experience exceeded my expectations, which were pretty high. The staff (especially Janita) made us feel so welcome and that they cared about our experience in Chicago. They always were ready and willing to help. The room was very clean and spacious for a large city. The fire trucks from the nearby station were definitely on the go most of the time but that really didn't bother us much. Would recommend the hotel to others and will definitely stay there again if we get back there anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TXHillCountry10
Reviews.Content: Five friends met in Chicago and chose this hotel because of its location and price. Having a full breakfast was an added lure. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Huberm
Reviews.Content: I'm in total agreement with other satisfied travellers for this property. Rooms are spacious, clean, and service here is great. Location is great for shopping. I will definately stay here in the future. If you are a light sleeper, be warned that the hotel is right next door to a Fire Station - which might be a concern for some. They have complimentary ear plugs available at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: smsg10
Reviews.Content: This was a great spot to call home base for a long weekend. I love the Hampton Inns, they never disappoint. The concierge desk was friendly and helpful - they gave us directions and recommendations for attractions and dining. I do not, however, recommend renting a car! The hotel does not offer free or even discounted parking for their garage and street parking is a pain. You have to keep feeding meters. There is no place in the vicinity to park it and leave it. We didn't need it anyway. Chicago is a great walking city. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Chicago”
Reviews.Author: J_S_W729
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at Hampton Inn. It was close to a lot of great restaurants, clubs and bars. The only downside for some people might be that there is a fire station, next door. We did hear sirens in the night. The rooms were very nice, well decorated, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: happytravelller10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 days in Chicago at the Hampton Inn on West Illinois. It was the perfect location. We walked everywhere. Easy to walk to the Navy Pier, Millenium Park and nice and close to Magnificent Mile. We even walked to the Buckingham Fountain in Grant Park without a problem. Once again Hampton Inn comes through. The front desk staff were welcoming and helpful from the get go. We were on the 10th floor looking down at the "Fire Station" that people referred to. They offer ear plugs at the front desk, but noise was never an issue for us at all. At breakfast there were plenty of choices to pick from. There was everything from fruit and yogurt to waffles, eggs, cereals and various breads and bagels. No worries about unhealthy eating. We would walk all day and then come back and use the pool and the hot tub which we pretty much had to ourselves. We used the business centre which conveniently was open 24 hours, to check up on e-mails and check in for our flights. Our airport shuttle was picking us up at 1:20 and there was no problem arranging a late check-out. This was a great trip and the best location!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended stay”
Reviews.Author: cgerk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business the week of 9/27. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and attentive. The breakfast is absolutely wonderful and has many options offered including fresh fruit, eggs and waffles. The exercise facility is small with only two treadmills and two eliptical machines but I never saw it crowded (I used it in the mornings). There are only three elevators and I never waited long. My room was on the 9th floor and was away from the elevators. The hotel lobby is small but all of the other amenities make it worth the stay. I highly recommend this hotel. The location is wonderful and a close walk to all of the highlights in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Best Hampton I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Botnang
Reviews.Content: Great location and great service, overall one of the best Hampton Inns that I have stayed at. Arrived at 7:00am and found one of the most friendly and competent front-desk personnel at any hotel I have ever been at who quickly got us our room (no problem with the early check-in), offered to help with sightseeing or restaurants, but in a manner that actually seemed to be helpful as opposed to the often apparent attempt to "guide" business to particular vendor. The rooms were typical of a Hampton Inn which is reasonably sized, comfortable beds, fairly well-appointed, clean with everything working, but still kind of boring. The breakfast was a little better than most Hampton Inns with a better selection of bread and fresh fruit and a daily hot item. I personally can't stomach any kind of pre-cooked buffet style eggs, but my son must have downed 6 of the mini-cheese omelets they had one morning, so can't be too bad. The breakfast area really excelled in that it is very nice location on the 2nd floor. Even though it was somewhat of a zoo with all the people in the morning, the staff did an outstanding job of keeping the area well stocked and clean and there were always tables available, all things that are common problems that I have experienced at other Hampton Inns. I think the biggest difference with this Hampton is the staff which was without exception friendly and helpful. One example was seeing another gentleman carrying a couple of drinks and some food from breakfast back to his room, as he was walking out a staff member grabbed a tray and caught up with him so that it would be easier to carry back to his room. You don't see staff very often go out of their way to help a customer without being asked and it seemed to be common occurrence here. Very well done!

Reviews.Title: “AGC Meeting on 9/27/2011”
Reviews.Author: chris p
Reviews.Content: I have planned several meetings over the years, and this was by far the easiest and best experience. It was a small group, but Ruth set us up with exactly what was needed. I called several hotels in the Chicago area before calling the Hampton Inn. Got the run-around from the rest (passed to different departments, voicemail system, etc.) Ruth Garcia answered and had the meeting room and guest room confirmations done within a few hours. The front desk staff at the hotel was great. I don't remember everyone's names (Tracee, Andy, Janita?), but it doesn't matter because they were all enthusiastic and helpful. The out of town guests all said the same thing. Great hotel, will be the choice for all future meetings. Chris Paas

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: suevee
Reviews.Content: This is a hybrid between the typical Hampton (dry scrambled eggs) and a full-service hotel. It has a competent front-desk staff who can help you find restaurants, CTA stations, buses, etc. Staff is almost excessively friendly and cheerful, responded quickly to requests (e.g. more hangers, please). Rooms are reasonable size, decor very uninspired, but it's clean and everything worked well. The wide-screen, HDTV received limited channels, none of them HD. WiFi had no problems. One of the things I like best about Hamptons is the adjustable real office chair at the desk. Facility had relatively little night-time noise, at least where we were.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: pascale38
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located near bus and underground. Staff very friendly and helpful. Big room very clean and with all facilities. Add free wifi, pop corn and 24 hour free coffee service. Nice pool and jacuzzi. Fitness center available. It is in walking distance of 2 of the greatest blues and jazz clubs in Chicago. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: captainsimos
Reviews.Content: First trip to Chicago as tourists. Found the location perfect and the staff was great. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: 2bluewater
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was great. The room was clean and comfortable, the free breakfast was good. Outstanding location !! It was a 2 block walk to the Grand red line stop and this made it very convenient for me to get to work each day (and it saved me $18 per day parking at my job site). Tons of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. My fav restaurant was Bandera. The only thing that I didn't like about this property was the $42 per day for valet parking. I think this is on par with other hotels in the downtown area, but that still doesn't make me like it. I parked at the public lot next door to the hotel for $30 per night (another steep price for parking) - this lot doesn't allow in/out. I walked everywhere or caught the train, so next time I probably wouldn't even rent a car. As mentioned in other posts for this hotel, the Fire Station is right next door and I heard the fire trucks every day. They were loud, but luckily they weren't going out frequently. I have to give a shout out to Andrew who was very helpful with getting an AAA room rate assigned to my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend in chi-town”
Reviews.Author: frosty8832
Reviews.Content: Wow, flew into chicago on a sunday morning and went to hotel, way too early to check in. However, they lets us change our clothes, store out bags and even enjoy their outstanding breakfast. We could not have asked for a better staff-will most certainly do it again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: doc8reg
Reviews.Content: I have been to a lot of hotels around the world, but by far this place tops in service. The staff are so friendly, they go out of their way to make your stay great... Add free wifi, pop corn and 24 hour free coffee service, and nice breakfast. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay”
Reviews.Author: CubFan10
Reviews.Content: Elevators were quick not much waiting. Breakfast was average. Making your own waffle is always good. Everyone working there was very courteous including the repairmen. Had a couple minor issues with the room and they took care of it and was very professional and friendly about it. Walking distance to Baskin-Robins for ice cream. Parking attends were quick and very friendly. We had a Suite and had plenty of space. The exterior of the windows need to be washed. I like looking out the window and my only complaint is the windows were really dirty. Can't think of any reason why we wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I love the hotel, the restaurant attached and the location near blues and jazz”
Reviews.Author: Belle16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Not one complaint.Really comfortable. I love Hampton Inns always. This one Has a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse which is simply sublime. The bar is wonderful. The Pool in the hotel is Ok and best of all, it is in walking distance of 2 of the greatest blues and jazz clubs in chicago., I does't get better. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: MsBevy
Reviews.Content: If you're ever staying with your children in downtown Chicago, you must stay here. We always like to stay at a Hampton Inn as they have a great hot breakfast, beds and pools. This hotel was unlike any Hampton Inn we had stayed in. Very modern and chic. The front desk staff made our trip to Chicago even better. Janita and Tracee not only were helpful and friendly but made our reservations for restaurants and tourist attractions so easy. Our room was upgraded to a suite and we loved it. The dining area is huge and room for everyone. The pool and outdoor terrace has a great view of the city too. The only thing about this location is the close proximity of the firehall to the hotel. You do hear alot of sirens however we were only on the 3rd floor and facing the street so it may be better on other floors. They also provide free earplugs. However, if you want to stay in one of the country's most vibrant cities then don't expect a silent night!

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the Hampton if you are looking for mid-range accommodations in a central location. As stated elsewhere, the Hampton is close to many dining options and attractions. The hotel is also a short walk from the Red Line Grand stop (and several blocks from the Blue Line Clark/Lake stop) so getting around the city is very easy. The property seems to be recently renovated and our room was modern with light green hues. There was enough space for two people and our room contained a sink, microwave and fridge. The bathroom was simple and very clean with adequate counter space. Don't expect spectacular views from most rooms as there are surrounding buildings that obstruct the sight lines. There is a decent looking fitness center, pool and outdoor deck in the hotel. The free breakfast was typical for a Hampton with a nice assortment of hot & cold choices but the dining area was very crowded both days we visited. Similarly,as the hotel seemed to be at high occupancy, there were frequently long waits for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the front desk people”
Reviews.Author: Diane F
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently visited Chicago for the first time (9/3 - 9/7/11). Ronnie was a young lady working the front desk at the Hampton Inn during the mornings. She was always extremely friendly and very helpful when it came to assisting with directions to various attractions in town. We would have (literally) been lost without her. The hotel is lucky to have such a great spokesman representing it! Also, we called the front desk one night when TNT would not come in clearly on our TV. We had lots of "snow." They sent up a wonderful young guy to see if he could fix it. He was having trouble with it and even went up on the roof (during a wind storm) to make some adjustments. Problem solved -- thanks to good employees. Thank you Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago - Downtown! D. Farrell, Spokane, WA

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and generally always stay at Hamptons. They are consistent - no surprises - ever (well, almost never). (I almost wish they'd surprise me with a better breakfast and better coffee - but no complaints - I know what I am getting and am rarely disappointed.) This Hampton was no exception - we've stayed there before - clean and comfortable, good service - this hotel being downtown actually has better than average service for a Hampton as there is a "conceirge" in the lobby who does a great job. He went out of his way to assist. For tourists, the location is great - close to Navy Pier, the river walk, etc. We got two adjoining rooms for our party of four and I think the rooms were remodeled lately - the rooms were really nice and we all had a great stay. There are other Hamptons in Downtown Chicago that are also good, I'd recommend any of them including this one although of course it pays to shop around..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsvanduyn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Labor Day weekend with three children and found the location to be very good - near lots of family friendly restaurants, including Rain Forest Cafe. The rooms were on the small side, but normal for Chicago, and were clean and comfortable. Bathroom was nice and clean, although the sink and vanity were in the bathroom with the shower and toilet--I prefer to have the vanity outside of the bathroom because it's easier for everyone to get ready in the morning. Very nice, well-run breakfast room with a good selection of hot and cold food. Staff is very friendly and went out of there way to help us enjoy our stay in Chicago. As other readers have mentioned, it is located right next to the fire station so you do hear sirens occasionally, but we have found you always hear sirens when staying downtown in a large city. The sirens really did not effect our sleep at all and we would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “perfect relation between what you get and what you pay”
Reviews.Author: joedi2
Reviews.Content: we used the hampton inn and suites downtown chicago based on tripadvisors recommendations. attending a conference at jw marriot, this hotel seems to a goid choice. the hotel is closely related to downtown sightseeing events, as well as to the red line grant station (just 1.5 blocks from the station). using public transport in chicago with a cta 3 or 7 days pass you can easily reach to hotel from o'hare (blue line to jackson, change to redline and then go to grant. the rooms are not perfect new, but are also not old. it is a 4star hotel, therefore everything necessary is given. i booked one class better than standard an got a romm with additional kitchen-like tabel, without anything you need for cooking or eating. also the microwave was not working (i do not need the microwave during this stay). the other stuff works well. a very good recommendation should be given to the breakfast: more or less complete, everythink fresh and enough: congratulations. not clear is, why people are allowed to eat there who are not able to eat and who do not pay. the breakfast room is in the 2nd floor and i can not believe that this was not detection by the personal. however this person is just eating (i hope enough for the next 3 days). the wifi works well. the hotel is not loud, the location guarantees that you can sleep. also the 200 mtr. the the firefighters headquater is not a problem, you have this in the same manner in alle cities. if you want to avoid this go out (and drive 30 min. car plus time for parking). the personal is friendly and always asking ... >>> a very good choice. the price in combination mit booking portals (in my case 119/night) makes it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Rjdainty1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, spacious, good location and good value for money. Only criticism I would say is that it's right next to the fire department, therefore can be a little noisy at times, certainly not enough to stop me coming back. Overall, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: ANNIEGEEWHIZ
Reviews.Content: EVERY staff member at this hotel was friendly and helpful EVERY time I encountered one of them. Restaurancts and attractions are within walking distance. The breakfast area was very clian and well-stocked each morning. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS A PLEASURE AND I AM SURE WE WILL RETURN”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth V
Reviews.Content: It was our first time bringing a tour to your fair city and I must say that all of our passengers had a great time exploring the many sites. Our job was made much easier by courteous and helpful staff who manned the front desk. It was refreshing to find people who were willing to go out of their way to assist us in providing the best we could for our tour group. The front desk staff at this hotel are a credit to your organization and in particular at this location. It was a pleasure and I am sure we will return. Malcolm & Elizabeth Vizer, Pathway Tours

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and the Nicest Hotel Staff I've Ever Met”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoChuck
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is a great value with lots of space, the free breakfast & 24-hour free coffee. As you enter it may seem a tad darker and not as modern as other suite hotels, but that feeling goes away as soon as you approach the front desk. I have never encountered such a fabulous front desk staff. We stayed for 5 nights so we encountered different people on different shifts & they were all wonderful - as are all of the other staff people - from the chamber maids to the kitchen staff in the breakfast area - everyone was SO nice & seemed to genuinely enjoy working there. What a breath of fresh air!
