Others have commented on the fire station - it is noisy at times (we were on 11th floor overlooking the station), but earplugs help a lot and it wasn't loud enough to keep any of us awake. If there's one negative it would have to be the elevators - while 3 would seem to be enough, they are very slow (even in "off" hours) and one of them is shared with repair/staff/cleaning crews, but it wasn't enough of an issue to keep us from coming back. This will now be our Go To hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good value, great trip”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my daughter from London for a short visit to Chicago. Lovely friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean room, free wifi, breakfast and constant supply of tea/coffee all at excellent value for money price. Loved the city, would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: KoloheSanJose
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June 2011. Upon entering we were welcomed by doormen, then it took only a few minutes for the front desk to hook us up with our room & keys. We were exposed to alot of good humor from people around the lobby with Brewer fans and Cub fans bantering back and forth. Felt like a family reunion. Our room faced Illinois St. but the windows are dual paned so even with some sirens from the firehouse on the corner; it wasn't that bad. We were not awaken by sirens at all. The beds are really comfortable! Breakfast on the 3rd floor gets really crowded by 9-10am (since your stay includes a free breakfast) so I recommend you get there early enough to make your waffles. The little kitchen and the breakfast staff provide hot food like eggs and sausages, or whatever pick of the day. The food is plentiful and even when it was crowded we weren't deprived of anything. Bonus is, as soon as you walk to the entrance of the breakfast room, you hit the coffee bar 1st! At least they had me in mind when they positioned that spot. Love it. The only thing we were frustrated with are the elevators, (slow- not enough running) but they were working on them so you just have to be patient and understand that with any mechanical trouble, it's not frickin personal. Get over the little irritations or annoyances and enjoy Chicago. The staff work hard to make it enjoyable for you. I think the H I & S do their best considering their not the "Trump Tower" priced hotel, but they treated me like I was Trump so... I'd stay there again for THEIR price. Got a good deal from Hilton Honors & AAA combo anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, clean, and organized.”
Reviews.Author: Wonderwomon
Reviews.Content: Stay here when you go to Chicago. I have been to many, and this one rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious enough for families, and they wash their comforters with every guest!”
Reviews.Author: gol19
Reviews.Content: Very central location for most downtown activities. We went to the House of Blues, and the Hampton Inn was just a few blocks away. It was just a short walk to Navy Pier. The restaurants nearby are great! The walk to the Shed Aquarium was a bit more than we bargained for, but that could have been solved by taking one of the many forms of public transportation. The Hampton Inn is very clean. It's one of the few hotels that washes their comforters with every guest. The continental breakfast had great variety! We stayed in a suite, which was perfect for families who need their space sometimes. My brother had his own TV and couch in the living area and my mom and I each had separate beds and a TV in the bedroom area. If you have a car, the valet parking is pretty expensive so I'd suggest finding a lot nearby. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs!!”
Reviews.Author: Brad J
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice hotel with a good complimentary breakfast, location and a very accommodating staff that is willing to go the extra mile to make sure your stay is desirable. The only downfall and it is a big one is the NOISE! The walls in this hotel are paper thin and you can hear everything the tenants next to you are saying/doing, this isnâ€™t the worst of it either as right door to the hotel is a Chicago Fire Station. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and got maybe 4 hours of sleep each night with ambulance or fire trucks running their sirens several times each evening. Nice hotel but if you are looking for a place to get a good night sleep I wouldnâ€™t recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: slwNewcastle_UK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel as part of a tour of Eastern USA. It is a very nice hotel within an excellent location (just a few blocks from Michigan Avenue and the river). The hotel is very clean and the rooms are furnished to a high standard. We were on the side looking onto Illinois Street and you do hear the sirens from the fire station but it was so infrequent that it did not bother us at all. In fact, we hardly heard the noise, so it isn't a problem. The included breakfast is plentiful and to a good quality and tea/coffee is available all day from the breakfast room, as well as free internet access from the business centre. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JoeDudley
Reviews.Content: This Hotel knows that Customer Service can be a competitive advantage and it shows. The staff are knowledgeable , friendly and show a genuine interest in you. The guys at the front door took the time each day to make sure we knew what was the best train/bus to get to our destination. The breakfast was very nice and plenty of options. The little added extras is what makes this Hotel from the popcorn machine and cookies in the reception area to the pool / whirl pool. A special note on the Hotels location, there is an outstanding choice of restaurants and bars within 5 minutes of the place Only down side was shower was in need of an update

Reviews.Title: “Help Wanted: Maintenance Manager !”
Reviews.Author: hotglueman
Reviews.Content: The Hampton continues to live up to its reputation of poor maintenance and physical condition of basic things such as closet doors and shower curtain rods. This room's closet door handle was coming off, the shower curtain rod was almost falling off creating an issue with the shower curtain sliding into the center - allowing water to escape onto the floor. The iron water fill cap was broken off so it would splash on clothing when moving it. All plumbing was extremely loud. Positive side - your air conditioning was low on noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: gsmyles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after a 2 month long trip through Europe with 2 small kids aged 2 & 6. The hotel staff is the most service oriented who I have met in ages and the newly renovated rooms, large free breakfast, and terrific pool right in the heart of the city was refreshing and surprising. I would definitely come back and suggest it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo hotel downtown con un buon rapporto qualitÃ /prezzo”
Reviews.Author: StefanoRimini
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a leisure trip with family. The hotel is a classic hotel chain Holiday, good quality and good services. The location is its greatest value, we stayed in a room on a high floor, of course, the view was not great, the building being one of the lowest, however, we had a good view of the second skyscraper in Chicago. The service was very good, room very clean, very expensive valet parking, was necessary because the conceptual Lollapalooza and public car parks were all full

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler61856
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here as I write this review. The staff is wonderful, the breakfast is delicious (with great variety each day), the rooms are so comfortable, the pool lovely, the showers are hot, the bed's and pillows are comfy, and the location is PERFECT! Our only issue was with our a/c and the engineers were up to the room in about 2 minutes and very accomodating and offered to switch us to a different room which we didn't feel was necessary. In the end I think it was just the exhast fan in the bathroom that wasn't working right which meant the humidity level was high. We upgraded to a suite for the second half of our stay and it is wonderful too. I would reccomend spending a bit more for the suite especially if you are traveling with your family. Lots of space, bigger kitchen area with a bar to sit at, larger fridge and counter area. We will stay here again anytime we come back to Chicago! I can't comment on the restaurant because we haven't eaten there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Diane2424
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights downtown to celebrate my husband's birthday. We were very, very satisfied with our choice of hotel. (1) the price was reasonable (2) breakfast each morning was included (there was a nice variety to choice from), my favorite was making our own waffles & (3) which was the most important, the king size beds were huge and very, very comfortable. I believe their beds are the most comfortable that I've every slept on in a hotel. For that reason alone, I give them and excellent rating. We will definetely be back and share our experience with friends and family. Hampton Inn keep up the good work -- who needs the Donald Trump Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very central and fit-for-purpose”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripper1965
Reviews.Content: Clean and reasonably organised hotel. Breakfast offers something for everyone and does the job. Chicago is quite expensive so for downtown, this is fair value. Pool and amenities are clean and serviceable. We had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel....would pick it again”
Reviews.Author: ReadHeadMom2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for downtown Chicago. Close to the "L" stop, Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, the lobby was nice and the free breakfast was good. We had the 2 bedroom suite and were very happy with it. The living area was large and comfortable. The sofa converted to a bed which was good for us traveling w/ 2 boys. THe bedroom was very spacious and the beds were comfortable. Parking was valet and I thought pretty pricey --$42 a night. It was next to a fire station so request the free earplugs at the desk if that would bother you. My boys loved the free popcorn in the lobby one afternoon. We'd definitely pick this location and hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay on Business while in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mulazzia
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the country on business and stay specfically at Hilton branded hotels. The Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown is one of my favorite palces to stay in all of the US. We have hosted several sales meetings at this hotel. The staff is top notch. The facilites are terrifc and the rooms are as comfortable as can be. It is located in walking distance to unlimited dining and entertainment options. Hampton Inn's don't get any better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff! I felt at home!”
Reviews.Author: missnorthside
Reviews.Content: I travel in 7 states for work so I know a great place to stay and this Hampton Inn and Suites is one! The staff (Ronnie, and another lady, forgot her name) was extremely helpful and made me feel as if they had welcomed me into their own homes. I even had freshly popped popcorn in the lobby while laughing with Janita and Tracee! The room was clean with great decor. Breakfast was busy but hot and fresh! I failed to complete a "Catch me at my best" card because everyone was so GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to everything in River North”
Reviews.Author: memparrot
Reviews.Content: Typical Hampton Inn, close to all things in River North area. Only 1 block from Navy Pier trolley stop. Short cab ride to Water Tower Place. Hotel is clean. Front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Housekeeper put our dolls on the bed so cute. I liked the outdoor patio next to the indoor pool. Breakfast area could be bigger. We had a difficult time getting a table in the morning. Surprised by the $42/day parking. Please note that the hotel is next to a fire station so you will hear sirens.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Absolutely Recommend and Will Return!!”
Reviews.Author: gutnick
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with the service at this hotel. From the front desk staff offering travel advice, to the car valets, to the cleaning staff - wonderful! The room (1101) was terrific. Fresh duvet covet with really comfortable bed (may have been new?) with fluffy towels, and plenty of space. A relatively small kitchen, but their breakfast on the second floor certainly was what we used every day. A bit busy at 9:30am for finding a table, but the food and cleanliness was 100%. The pool is pretty good. Bring down the larger towels as the small ones are not the best. The spa was pretty hot, which some people may not find suitable. I enjoyed it. As for the person who gave a negative review because they allow kids in the spa, that person needs to learn how to travel and not sweat the small stuff. The parking is somewhat costly at $42, but that is the same price as every hotel. There is a lot down the street for $30. Attendants are friendly. It takes about 10 minutes to get your car. No issues. The location is perfect. Close to too many restaurants to mention, and about a mile walk to Michigan Avenue or $6 cab. The only negative: It is near a firestation as many other hotels in the area. So there were sirens on occasion. It did not bother us on the 11th floor. You may want to bring ear plugs. But that applies to the whole city with people honking horns. Just plan for it. But all in all, this hotel scores a 5/5 without a doubt. I will definitely return. The staff and management are outstanding to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay near the heart of Chicago, but not the best Hilton stay we've had”
Reviews.Author: JJLD
Reviews.Content: This hotel served its purposes reasonably well. My wife and I were just taking a short get away to relax, check out Chicago, and do some shopping. Good price for its location. Although not right on the magnificant mile, it is only a couple blocks away, has a nearby stop for a free trolley to Navy Pier, and it is a short walk South to the Theatre district and associated shopping down there. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel, hor did it get high recommendations from the front desk staff. The "free" breakfast provided elsewhere in the hotel was fantastic.... fresh fruit, waffles, eggs, bagels, cereals, coffee, juice, etc. The front desk and bell staff were also very firendly and very helpful at all times. Now onto some of the minor issues we experienced. While the room we chose (king bed suite) was very large and spacious and was very tastefully decorated and realtively clean, there is a bit of lack of upkeep evident. Our closet door did not work properly, our shower curtain had a tear in it, the towel hook behind the door fell off when habning one towel on it, and the microwave looked like it hadn't been cleaned for weeks (and likely still hasn't). I probably could have brought all this "nitpicky" stuff to the front desk, but I really didn't want the hassle of having to explain it. To me, that is stuff that a hotel (especially a Hilton chain hotel) should be on the lookout on a daily basis and dealing with. The one big shortcoming of this hotel's location, as referenced by many other reviewers, is that it is across the street from a major downtown Chicago Fire and Ambulance Station. In my opinion, most normal large cities, this wouldn't be an issue, but for some reason in Chicago, there are ALOT of emergency calls. A it would appear from what we saw, they send a lot of emergency vehicles to even just minor fender benders. The only thing the Hampton Inn should be looking to spend money upgrading is in some noise proofing of thier North and West facing hotel room windows. All in all, not a bad visit, they just missed crossing the t's and dotting the i's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Julie49036
Reviews.Content: I was with two friends who stayed four nights in one of the suites. I can't say enough about the excellent service we received. Everyone, but especially Yanelli and Tracee at the front desk and the bell captain, Abraham, went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. The room was spacious, the beds (even the sofa bed) were comfortable, and the free breakfast buffet was great. The hotel is located very conveniently, close to shopping and a short bus or taxi ride to the museums and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jlynn41
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while taking the bar exam and was very impressed with the service at this hotel. It was a really nice surprise to come back to the room and find that the maid had not just made my bed, but had organized my piles of books and notecards, found my missing key, and folded my clothes. It was above and beyond, and much appreciated! Also, the rest of the staff was always courteous and eager to help. Also, the hotel was very quiet, and I was surprised in the morning to see that there actually were quiet a few families staying there with children, even though I never heard them. Other perks: a block from the L, free hot breakfast, nice pool & gym Only suggestion: if you stay here and quiet is essential, ask to stay on a higher level and away from the Dearborn intersection. I had trouble sleeping (for reasons other than noise), but the 24 hour bus going by my window was a big noisy. It's by the fire station, but the sirens seemed to stop between 10pm and 7 am, and even during the day were infrequent.

Reviews.Title: “The staff alone is why you should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: HeySco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for three nights in July. We had a room on the fourth floor that overlooked a hotel patio and nearby buildings. This hotel is located near an Elevated Train Grand/Red) stop and a Navy Pier tram stop. Like most every hotel chain, everything is within walking distance from the hotel. The room rate was comparable to other hotels in the area. This place offered the free breakfast which was a great help when starting the day with the family. One note for management on your free breakfast â€“ we overheard other people who were staying at nearby hotels who were enjoying your free breakfast. Maybe this is part of your marketing strategy though. I never heard the fire truck sirens that other reviewers reported, however, this hotel is in the heart of the city, so traffic noise is almost expected although did not hear much. The fire station offers a free tour depending on their call schedule, so you can always visit the sound of the sirens if you want. The staff was great. From the moment they greeted us when we checked in, to answering any questions that we may have had. They were always cheerful and best of all, they left us do our thing without getting in the way. Every time we entered or left the hotel, the staff would greet us or wish us the best on our adventures for the day. We did not have a room with a kitchenette, but there are rooms offer those options. We did not use the pool or fitness center, but plenty of other guests were using the facilities. If you do stay here, make sure you eat at the Star of Siam restaurant down the street. This restaurant had great food and good prices and less than a block from the hotel's front door. All in all this was a good place to stay for us and we would stay here again if and when we return to the Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk is the best!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulone08
Reviews.Content: There is no better feeling than leaving a hotel knowing (as well as remembering) the names of those who helped make your stay that much more enjoyable. Tracy, Ronnie and Janita were by far, the best front desk employees I have ever come across in my travels. They are extremely knowledgeable about the area, gave great places to see, eat and visit, and just made the stay at this hotel fabulous! This is how great they were â€“ when we were at the front desk, guest leaving would stop by and thank them for their invaluable service. Now that is what customer service should be about! About the hotel: I would say the rooms are typical. Nothing really stood out about the them. The continental breakfast buffet was cool, but I was longing for bacon, which never happened. This hotel is only 3 blocks from Michigan Ave., and the stop for the free Navy Pier trolley is a block or two away. The post office is right around the corner and it's well within walking distance to great eats. The main negative would be it's located across the street from a fire station; however, the hotel provides ear plugs in the lobby. Overall, will definitely stay at this hotel on my next visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, close to lots of attractions...Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanAmphibians
Reviews.Content: We spent the 4th of July weekend at this hotel with the intention of going to Wrigley Field to see the Cubs game and to do a bit of exploring in Chicago. We stayed in a 1 bedroom kind suite using the "Park and Stay" package, which included valet parking. From the moment we stepped up to the desk until we left, the staff we encountered were nothing but friendly and helpful. The gentleman at the front desk provided us with a map to find places to see and answered all of our questions. The valet service was prompt and polite. The room itself was nicely appointed, clean and spacious. We only had two issues with our stay. One is that we never had hot water to take a shower and this was not resolved. The other is that the hotel is close to the fire station and you will hear sirens throughout the night. I'm a heavy sleeper and was fine and the hotel does offer ear plugs for free. If that's the only thing that goes wrong on a mini-vacation, that's not too bad! The hotel is close to a lot of fun attractions. Michigan Avenue is within walking distance if you like to shop and the free trolley to Navy Pier (also within walking distance, but a bit of a stretch for those not used to walking a lot) has a pick up station a block away from the hotel. The Red Line station is two blocks away and provides easy transport to where you would like to go. The desk clerk was most helpful in getting us on the right trains. :) Overall, a great stay for the money. Central location, great service....we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: triplover555
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was somewhat worried about the noise issues mentioned in other reviews, but we needed a two bed suite for our family and this hotel was one a few that could offer us that situation. We stayed five nights at this location. I was impressed with the customer service we received from arrival to check out. We were greeted with waters and snacks for everyone. They placed us in a suite in the rear of the building because we were worried about the noise. Our housekeeper Alicia provided us with service we didn't even get at the Walforf properties- she actually folded our laundry, arranged our shoes on the floor, cleaned out kitchen floor and gave us extra towels and toiletries WITHOUT ASKING! The breakfast was great, and the refilled food as soon as it ran out. WE were granted late check out and our trip was one of the best we have ever had! The location is a plus as well. It is in the River North section of Chicago loaded with top restaurants and shopping. Triple loved this Hampton Inn and Suites!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right on”
Reviews.Author: WiBusyM0m
Reviews.Content: Another consistently pleasing stay at a Hampton. It is our preferred hotel with our kids in tow and was easy to get to, near our destination for a birthday dinner and pleasantly off Michigan Avenue. Only downsides were that it is located next to a busy (sometimes noisy) fire station, but all part of a city stay and the staff forgot our hypoallergenic pillows (Cubs home game weekend, hotel was very busy). Breakfast was hot but eggs were dry, overall a good variety and the room was very clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Hampton starts with an H but it's not Hilton quality”
Reviews.Author: prissySanDiego
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and usually stay in their 4 star properties. I chose this 3 star Hotel because of the tripadvisor good reviews and raves about customer service. I also needed one bedroom suites with 2 beds, as I was booking multiple rooms for a college sorority reunion. Many of the Hilton properties in Chicago had a lot of suites with King bed, but limited number of suites with 2 beds even though I was booking 4 months in advance. When booking on line through the Hilton Group Event planner proved unsuccessful, I was forced to contact the Hotel directly to assist me with my reservations. This hotel can not be reached through a toll free number. I was directed to sales manager, Jenna Haymond. Let's just say, you don't want to deal with her. I won't go in to details. I would recommend Asst. Mgr, Ross (can't remember last name) if you need some help. If you have excellent sense of hearing and smell this Hotel is not for you. When I arrived, I was sent to a one bedroom suite that smelled so bad, the front desk staff decided to have it "sanitized". I was not permitted in the room until after 8:30 pm. I arrived about 6:00 pm. The room seemed ok that evening, but the next morning all of the bad smell had returned. I stayed for 2 more nights, but felt sick each evening I returned to the room. Each time a friend came in the room (1101), they commented on the bad smell. After 3 nights ( I stayed a week total), a broken toilet handle, a slow shower drain (the engineer and I became friends), I got the asst. mgr., Ross involved. He moved me across the hall (1102) to a good room and helped coordinate all the rooms for my friends. The fire trucks could be heard in the first room, but not the second. The housekeeping was wonderful. They did a great job. Others have commented on the smell of the elevators. It was terrible. On my 4th day some attempt was made to add a deodorizer to them. I feel bad about my somewhat negative review, as this is not usually my tone or experience with Hilton properties.. I end on a positive note- the beds are great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STherese05
Reviews.Content: From the moment my family and I walked into this lovely hotel we were treated as welcome guests. The front desk was friendly and informative. The room was pretty and clean. We had a wonderful view outside our window. The bed was extremely comfortable. There was a large indoor pool and an outside seating area on the second floor. The breakfast room overlooked the street and was spacious and sunny. The breakfast was excellent and the staff accommodating. We loved the hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations and awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: red59head
Reviews.Content: For a family of 4 vacationing in Chicago, this Hampton was in a good location and the service was perfect. Very helpful staff in assisting with directions, ideas for restaurants, helping with obtaining taxis and more. Our room was very clean and the suite we had was roomy and nicely furnished. Highly recommend this hotel and we would absolutely stay there again. The price was reasonable considering we were in a big city where rates are just higher overall. Breakfast was fantastic and filling. Only downside was it got very crowded at times. And, the USA today newspaper was only provided at the doors of some of the rooms - perhaps members?, seeing as how we were there 5 nights - think the newspaper should have been provided at our door. Instead, we had to pick up at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: leahmichelle5
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown last week on a mother/daughter trip to the city. I am an employee at a Hampton in Arizona so I am more picky than most travelers as I know what to look out for. From the moment we walked in, everything was FANTASTIC! From the gentelman offering us fresh popped popcorn to James, the front desk associate, everyone was so friendly and helpful. You can tell that this staff is very well trained and enjoys what they are doing. It is very refreshing to see this as there are so many places you go where the employees could care less about their job or what their customers think. Thank you to all of the wonderful people at the Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown and keep up the great work and positive attitudes! :) Leah-Scottsdale, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PJO90
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in this hotel last week on business. It is a standard Hampton with friendly, efficient staff and all the extras you would expect (gym, business centre, free wi-fi). Best thing about hotel is its location. A few minutes walk from most major attractions and surrounded by excellent restaurants. Despite good location it is also a comparatively quiet area and there are no problems with external noise. Enormous breakfasts served - although most of it seems to be re-hydrated although this didn't seem to bother those of us eating there every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: GottagetawayMO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the weekend of the 4th of July with two sons, aged 20 and 11. We were welcomed by the great gals at the front desk who seemed genuinely to care about our stay and our family. They gave terrific advice on what to do and how to get there in the downtown area - even a referral to the BEST local barbership so our 20-year-old could get a haircut. The hotel is clean, newly redecorated, modern furnishings, but remember this is a HAMPTON, so a long way from a luxury hotel. Free breakfast was great, although the staff seemed a little overwhelmed by the large crowd. Regular Hampton fare, nothing fancy, but ideal for the boys. I did overhear one guest omplaining about the lack of breakfast meat, but there were hot scrambled eggs for a protein, yogurt, waffles, biscuits and gravy, etc. Used the pool/hottub daily and the exercise room. Across the street my husband and I walked to Sullivan's steak house and enjoyed a fantastic martini and some piano music in their bar. VERY NICE, and I would highly recommend. We were able to walk to everything we needed, and took a trolley down to the Navy Pier. Be sure to walk to Portillo's, about 5 blockes away, and get an Italian beef sandwich. Yummy! And Giordano's stuffed pizza was to die for. We had a suite at the Hampton, so the boys had the second TV and foldout couch to have some "downtime" and play their video games. I highly recommend the Hampton., Even our 11-year-old commented about how friendly and helpful everyone was. We will be back! Honestly, the complaints about the fire station noise were overblown, or perhaps our room was on a different side of the property, but we only heard them on a couple of occasions. Be sure you get a free set of earplugs out of the dispenser in the lobby. They were a lifesaver and helped ensure a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanbreeze22
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We were in Chicago during the weekend of the 4th of July. When we arrived, around 12:30 p.m., a room was available for us to check into, so we didn't have to wait for our room. We thought this was WONDERFUL and very convenient. From the moment we got to the hotel, everyone was VERY friendly, professional and helpful. We LOVED our two-room suite. It was very, very nice, and came with a stainless steel microwave, refrigerator and sink. It also had beautiful granite counter tops. The beds were really comfortable too. Since my two teenagers were with me, it was nice to have two 42" flat screen televisions; however, the picture quality could have been a little clearer. One TV was in the bedroom and the other in the living room area. It was also extremely nice to have free wireless internet (which my daughter and son can't live without). The breakfast buffet was good. It's always nice to be able to make your own waffles, and they had plenty of waffle irons, making the wait not so long. The breakfast dining room had an ample number of seats for all guests. I had the opportunity to have a nice conversation with a very nice lady working the buffet area. As I stated before, the hotel staff were all VERY nice. My son had left his binder in the room, and we didn't discover it until after we had checked out and headed home. I called the hotel the next day, and housekeeping told me that they had found it and would ship it back to me. We checked out of the hotel on July 5, and my son received his binder on July 7, and was very happy to get back. We will definitely stay at this hotel again; however, the next time I will ask for a room far away from the exit doors. I am a very light sleeper and could here the door everytime it opened and closed. The location of the hotel was perfect and within just a few blocks of walking distance of all our destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, Great place”
Reviews.Author: JohnC0227
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in downtown Chicago. The building is older but the hotel is new looking inside. We had a suite which was awesome. The fire station is half a block away but we never heard it. Staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagicFlute
Reviews.Content: We had a suite which was very spacious and had good soft furnishings, also had a good kitchen. Hotel was in a convenient location and staff were helpful. Would stay here again. Plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: gisgurl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over 4th of July weekend and we loved it. We booked a King Room w/ wetbar (a studio sutie that included wet bar, mini-fridge and microwave). Upon arrival we were greeted quickly and politely even though the lobby was full. The room was clean and orderly - looked just like the pictures on the hotel site. We were informed that complimentary breakfast was served on the 2nd floor alone with other hotel amenities and that there were ear plugs available across from the elevator. I booked this hotel after reading several reviews on this site, so we knew the hotel was near a very busy fire station. We were on the side of the hotel facing the fire house and it was indeed busy, but it wasn't anything we couldn't tolerate. I only heard it go off 2x one night, and i didn't hear it over night any other times. If you're concerened about the noise level, just ask for a room on the side of the building away from it. I'm glad we booked it despite the fire house. It's close to several great places to eat: Ginos, Al's Italian Beef, Weber Grill. Also close to several public transit areas. We bought day passes and traveled the city by bus. There is a valet parking fee of 42/night. I found that on par with other hotels in the area. You can also self park for a discounted rate of $25/night right next to the hotel and about a block away. The lot right next to the hotel is small and fills up quickly. We found the valet service to be prompt and courteous, they provide in and out service when you need it. We had breakfast and found it to have variety. You can make your own waffles (although it takes a while when busy, b/c there's a line) , there were sausage, bagels, yogurt, oatmeal, fruit cocktail, cereal, coffee and juice. All of which we thought were good choices for a complimentary breakfast. The breakfast staff was attentive, refilling everything immediately as it ran out. Overall, I would stay again and again at this hotel. We've found our place for when we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Service”
Reviews.Author: Amy7654
Reviews.Content: Tracy and James were so nice. They went out of there way to help us. Very Patient and Friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, decor, location but needs improving”
Reviews.Author: Parentsof2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the king bed suite and separate living room with kitchenette. The room looked exactly like the photos on the website - neutral, modern colors. The friendly front desk ladies were awesome, the cleaning staff and greeters were great, the bed linens and duvet always smelled clean everyday. Some cons: When the A/C was on, very strong smell of cigarette smoke from other rooms would enter our room (although it was advertised as a non-smoking hotel). Two of the 3 elevators smelled like urine. The eggs from the free breakfast were nasty (not real eggs) but the self-service waffles, bagels, muffins, yogurts made up for this. Lastly, the heated indoor pool felt too crowded with more than 12-15 people in it.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: JudyMartin1966
Reviews.Content: Every time we plan a trip to Chicago, we like to stay at the Hampton Inn on Illinois Street. The staff is fantastic and friendly. Everything is clean and the breakfast is excellent. The Bell Hop and front desk help were fantastic. Keep up the great work. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Aussieswife2222
Reviews.Content: What a great location this hotel has....easy walk to tons of restaurants, Michigan Ave., State Street, the river, etc. One block from the Red Line at Grand for further trips to Chinatown, Wrigley Field, or the Willis Tower. I knew from TA that there would be some issues with noise as there is a Fire Station across the street. The hotel does provide earplugs in the lobby. It wasn't the Fire Station though that was the problem. We had a suite on the back alley side of the hotel, and there was a great deal of noise VERY early almost every morning from a trash truck or some other service vehicle! Since we had a suite with 2 Doubles, a sofa bed, and a kitchenette, there was plenty of room for my family with 2 teenagers to spread out. The kitchenette even had granite and stainless steel appliances! There was a nice island type seating area in it for quick snacks too! The hotel is one of the few with this great location that provides free wi-fi, complementary hot breakfast, and a USA Today or Wall Street Journal daily. We appreciated all these extras especially since the parking was $42 a night. We definitely would stay here again, but would ask for a street side higher up room if it was available as a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: leannmunoz
Reviews.Content: This was a trip that I took my 6 and 8 year on and met my friend with her 2 children. We had a one bedroom suite and they even upgraded us to a corner suie - awesome!! The breakfast spread was wonderful - everything from eggs, sausage, pastries, waffles, fresh fruit, cereal/bagels, etc... Well worth it and the next block is the red line subway or the other block you can catch the bus or trolley to Navy Pier. It made it easy to get around and the staff was so helpful! I would totally stay there again!! Beds were so comfy too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and cozy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JRPradilla
Reviews.Content: Everybody on the front desk went our of their way to help. Everybody was very professional! Definitely will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, but beware of the fire station.”
Reviews.Author: alligeek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 15 month old and had a reasonably good stay. We opted for a suite with a "kitchenette" and found that our room was more than adequate. Here's the lowdown, though: The good: - Location, location, location! This is within walking distance of the El and Michigan Avenue. It's a great central spot. - Our suite was very roomy and comfortable. - The free breakfast was a nice touch--we saved some $$$ and had a variety of things to choose from. The not-so-good: - The hotel is right across the street from a fire station. They don't try to hide this and do supply earplugs, but even if your room isn't facing the fire station, YOU WILL HEAR IT MULTIPLE TIMES through the night. Fortunately our toddler didn't seem to notice it, even if I did. - The "kitchenette" is no more than a sink, counters, extra chairs and mini-fridge. They don't supply any utensils or dish soap. Don't think you're going to nuke a Lean Cuisine, let alone fix a real dinner here. I'd stay here again for the incredible location and value, but do not recommend for light sleepers who hate restaurant food.

Reviews.Title: “8 nights - every one fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cancalpal
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, very safe, outstanding service. It is located by the fire station, which can be noisy, but there are ear plugs to assist... and let's face it....it is the big city - so no matter where you are that kind of noise is prevalent. Lots of families with kids seem to stay here. Breakfast is nice, good variety and selection. Served 6-10 and an extra hour on sunday. Make your own waffles, eggs, toaster for bagles, toast or engilsh muffins, yougrt, cereal. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate are available 24 hours a day. So many great restaurants so close by - Vermilion (indian latin fusion was by far the favorite - ask for the vegetarian menu).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: keeo66
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago, so we weren't sure what to expect. The Hampton Inn & Suites was a lucky choice for us! From the moment we stepped into the lobby, the service was top notch. We have to mention Yaneli, the young lady who handled our check-in and check-out--outstanding customer service Yaneli! The hotel is clean, safe, comfortable, affordable, and centrally located to many downtown sites. The subway/El stations are within a few blocks. There is a free trolley that takes you to the Navy Pier--the trolley stop is 1 block from the hotel. There is an authentic Irish bar called Fado within walking distance. Needless to say, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Great Service, Clean, Comfortable Beds, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Fun_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying downtown for the evening and selected this hotel based on its location. This Hampton Inn is attached to Ruth Chris' Steakhouse and a block or so away from Harry Caray's (And many fun late night destinations). The room was very clean, newly remodeled and the bed was so comfortable it was easy to fall asleep. The check in process was a good experience as well we were greated by Ronnie and she was very efficient and pleasant (good start to our fun evening). What I liked the best...Rosebud Trattoria and the 24hr store to grab some snacks and what I liked the least (at least I thought I would not like was the offer of ear plugs-hotel near fire department). I did take them up on this offer but I assure you there was no need and I was in the hotel on a Saturday. Overall a great experience and one that I will surely share with my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Winnipegmelody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2011 and chose it based on price, location and reviews read here on TripAdvisor. I would say it has been fairly recently refurbished and so the rooms are nice and clean with nice relaxing colors. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the backside of the building and didn't really notice any noise from the firehall down the street. It is on a bus route plus it is only a few blocks walk to Michigan Avenue. We walked a lot, used the buses and used the subway and found it a very easy city to get around. There is a subway station 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again. There were lots of choices of things to eat at breakfast. Be sure you look around the corner just past the breakfast bar because there was always cut fruit salad plus fresh apples or bananas there. There are four waffle machines plus eggs of some sort and sausages or some other hot items. The coffee/tea/hot chocolate station is open all day. Attached to the hotel is a Ruth's Christ Steakhouse and we enjoyed dinner there our first night. There are loads of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amr_62
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a meeting and I was staying in Hampton Inn and Suites for one week. It it very close to Michigan Ave (Magnificent miles) less than 5-10 min walking, very close to the subway. Everything was perfect. So If I come back to Chicago I'll stay there

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality was excellent”
Reviews.Author: ohio_11
Reviews.Content: We experienced excellent customer service while on this trip. Especially from the assistance of Janita. She was so friendly and helpful and genuine. I only had to ask and the staff provided. The breakfast was very good and a good variety of choices.

Reviews.Title: “The bests group-service hotel thus far!”
Reviews.Author: illinoisian
Reviews.Content: I brought my choir to stay at the hotel while on tour in the "windy city". The hotel was not only lovely and comfortable, but the rooms were spacious, clean, and welcoming. The staff was excellent and well prepared for our large group. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of all of the exciting events (including a short walk or bus ride to Navy Pier).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great place and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: cygloev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2011, family with 2 small children. Luckily we avoided the blizzard. Location is hard to beat if you want to be near Magnificent Mile etc, room was excellent for the price we paid, even allowing for the fact that prices are low at this time of year. It is next to a fire station which the kids loved, and the firefighters were almost as friendly as the hotel staff. Daily free breakfast was excellent, for us and the children. The staff at the front desk and the door were very friendly, they made themselves very popular with the children (helped by various candy bars, popcorn and cookies) and were most helpful when we needed a quick repair job on a toy car!! The maid service was good. Pool was COLD!! (in Feb though...). But seriously we have no complaints and shall stay here again when we next visit this great city (in summer).

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!!”
Reviews.Author: suegleek
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great - clean, attractive, comfortable. It's in a terrific location. The staff went above and beyond - friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable, and just very very nice. They were all wonderful - we particularly enjoyed speaking with Janita Walton. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smells bad”
Reviews.Author: Eyedoc84
Reviews.Content: Here for 1week, usually stay at Hilton Garden Inn 2 blocks away. Check in was about a hour late & were to have corner suite, they gave us a standard room,went down to front desk and showed our copy of reservation for suite & price that was less, got corner room after another hour wait. All 3 elevators smell like urine entire stay, so did our rooms bathroom. Room was very spacious but decorated like something a cross out of the 60s and The Jettsons. Upon checkout was build higher rate than told ,will now have to go to front desk and shoe them reserved rate. Make sure you bring a copy of reservation If you don't want to get screwed. No more stays here, Hilton owns both, sure hope Garden Inn hasn't went down in care like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nplowman
Reviews.Content: location was good. Parking is very expensive. Breakfast and staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Allenjudon
Reviews.Content: Hotels always look nice in photos, and then they are trash when you show up. This hotel is a steal in downtown Chicago - and I mean the real downtown! The bed felt as if nobody had ever slept in it and the minibar was nice to have. I strongly recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Hchmani
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located if you want to enjoy Chicago without having to use your car. Parking in/out privilege was a must, though pricy fee a little bit. Service was great, 2 complaints: breakfast lack some imagination, it was average. Swimming pool was dirty the first night we got there and our eyes and skin suffered. The rest of days, they changed filters and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE BEST SERVICE EVER RECEIVED AT A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LAP1973
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a vacation in Chicago to celebrate our anniversary. I spent hours on-line looking for the perfect hotel downtown, close to attractions, with a swimming pool and reasonably priced. Look no further- Not only do you get all of that at this hotel- you also get the best staff I have ever encountered in my many travels. I have been to many countries, cities and resorts and have experienced all types of customer service- good and bad-This hotel was outstanding! From the minute we checked in they went above and beyond- We were delayed getting to Chicago for 2 days due to airline problems and had a very horrible experience with the airline company. I spoke to the General Manager a few times as well as the front desk staff about our delays and we never new exactly when we would arrive- they held the reservation and extended our stay- no questions asked. They were all fantastic, but Tracey greeted us when we arrived and did everything possible to make our stay wonderful- from calling us when our room was ready, prior to check in-conceriege services, booking reservations, and noticing that my husband was un-well and needed to rest from the 2 day delay that we encountered. The trip started out awful, but ended wonderfully, thanks to the staff at the Hampton Inn- This hotel is extremely clean, beautiful rooms, a fabulous free breakfast and great ammenities. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time spent in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Battyhal
Reviews.Content: On April 2011 my mother and me spent 5 nights in Chicago in Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown.The Hotel is in the city center,so close to The Magnificent Mile you can go taking a beautiful walk,and is very clean and peaceful.All the staff was absolutely kind and friendly,specially a recepcionist called Yaneli,who gave us all the information about buses,metro,taxis and places to visit in the town,always with the biggest smile and amability.Breakast was very good and included in the price.So ,i recommend this hotel and i will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was a very good value; it was clean, the staff was very friendly and the room was in very good condition”
Reviews.Author: triprecall
Reviews.Content: We received very good and very attentive service upon our arrival. The bell person was very accomodating and helpful. The person at the reception desk (both upon arrival and at departure) was very friendly and responsive to our needs. The hotel was very clean as the floor we were on (4th) had recently been remodeled. The rooms were quiet and sleeping both nights was good. The breakfast each day was probably the best I had experienced at a Hampton property. Again, hotel staff were very friendly and helpful The location of the hotel was very good. It was close to the Loop and also to Michigan Ave. There were a multitude of restaurants in the area so dining out was no problem. The best attribute of our stay was the cost; I felt that it provided very good value given the area and the proximity to downtown. While parking our car was costly, it was very convenient for us. The housekeeping service was good but it was not what we are used to. It did not seem that the staff took much time in preparing our room after the first night...as far as cleaning, fresh towels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: buonc2006
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. This is my fifth time staying at this location and you just can't beat it. I am very picky about cleanliness and they have every time exceeded my expectations. My first time in town the staff was helpful in giving me tips on where to go to eat and they were right on each time. You can't beat the beds either, I slept like a rock. The only downfall is the fire station next door, however, the insulation made it very tolerable. The staff are so thoughful they even have ear plugs (which I have not had to use) in the lobby. Don't forget to bring swimming and work out gear. Our daily meetings were right there at the Inn and the accommodations were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cvandenbraak
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Hampton Inn Downtown Chicago. Booked online with no issues. Easy for my shuttle to find. Reservations were no issue. Each person was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in rate. Also fitness center, pool and computer inlcuding in rate. Area was safe and had great Itialian place to eat next door. Many shops and bars, etc nearby. Would stay again. I found the downtown was noisy with many cars honking and nearby firehouse was not as noisy as traffic beeping.

Reviews.Title: “Fine family place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelinggrandma186
Reviews.Content: Terrific room, nice pool, nice staff, good location

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and GREAT staff!!”
Reviews.Author: jnsmith1007
Reviews.Content: This Hampton was located within a block of the Red Line which made it easy to get to from the airport. We were greeted with a smile as we walked through the door and check in couldn't have been easier! We stayed three nights and each night we came back from the game the front desk greeted us (even at 11pm!). Highly recommend this hotel - close to many great restaurants and 15 minute walk to Navy Pier. We stayed in the King Suite which was very spacious and had a micro/fridge along with eating area.

Reviews.Title: “I was blown away by the quality & service of this property!!!”
Reviews.Author: badtaco
Reviews.Content: I held a business meeting here at the Hampton Inn-Downtown, I needed a nice professional meeting space, good location, and quality sleeping rooms for my guests who were brought in for 2 days of intensive training. The Hampton Inn-Downtown met all of these needs and more. First, the sleeping rooms, beds are phenomenal, everyone slept well. Meeting Space, also phenomenal, windows let in natural light and the beverage service is perfect for meetings. The breakfast in the morning is perfect and included with the stay. And everyone said the coffee was good ( i don't drink coffee). Second, the professionalism of the staff from Salespeople who we contracted the meeting space and sleeping rooms, to the valet parkers. EVERYONE was super courteous and treated us like we were at a 4 star hotel. Third. Pricing. Im a small business person who owns a real estate company here in Chicago, costs are always a big deal for me, The deal they have for hosting a meeting is a "NO FRILLS" package. No body does this!!!!!! There was no extra fees, taxes, costs other than what I was quoted. They have a ALL INCLUSIVE rate and its a good one. Finally: Location. It's close everything. It was easy for our group to hit some of the best that Chicago offers within walking distance or cab. I will definetly be scheduling our next meeting at the Hampton inn - Downtown George Cuevas Real Estate Broker Exit Realty ------ ------

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: NatPus11
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was very clean, looked newly decorated, spacious and quiet. The staff was constantly going above and beyond even with the smallest of requests. The location is great for walking to restaurants, etc. Next time in Chicago, we will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: haley_joann
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and extremely courteous and friendly. The beds were very comfortable and everything was in convenient walking distance. James and Janita were especially helpful. Rooms by the street were noisy from sirens. Excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jrsmall
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for us! A few blocks from most of everything we wanted. Wonderful restaurants within walking distance. We always walk wherever we need to go, from Willis Tower to Millenium Park to Navy Pier and north to Mag Mile, Hancock Tower (must have a cocktail in the Signature Lounge on top at nite-beautiful view). Breakfast buffet was good, well stocked. Lots of fresh fruit, breads, bagles, english muffins, cereals. The earlier you get there the less crowded. By 9:00am, it is very busy with a line for the waffle maker and toaster. Rooms were very clean (I am picky on cleanliness). We had a king room (all kings face the firehouse) and noticed the sirens more during the day than at night. The few nightly runs didn't really interupt our sleep. They do provide earplugs if needed. The front desk staff, consierge, and valet service were all wonderful and very friendly. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delphi11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at Hampton Inn with our family of two teens - had a one bedroom suite. The whole visit from start to finish was lovely. We were welcomed at check in, and a restaurant (Grand Lux) was recommended to our daughters. We did have lunch there, and they really did enjoy it. The room was clean, quiet, and extremely comfortable beds. How often to you go to a hotel and actually like the beds as much as yours at home? Sure we heard a few fire engines, but the hotel supplied ear plugs, and it really wasn't an issue. The buffet breakfast was a perfect start to a day of sightseeing. The hotel was conveniently located a short distance from many attractions, and when we did require our car, the valet parking was quick and friendly. We loved this hotel, and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Chata1290
Reviews.Content: PROS: In Chicago to attend a taping of the Oprah show and visit family. We were Welcomed with open arms and warm smiles. We were allowed to check in early. Mentioned to the clerk that I read a review about not getting a room facing the fire station (across the street), he was so attentive and placed us on the opposite end on the top floor. In addtion, he recommended a tour and called and made reservations for us. The room was nice; clean and spacious. The accomodations were great ; hot breakfast, fitness room, valet parking, and complimentary paper. CONS: No microwave or refrigerator in room.

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Breeze1955
Reviews.Content: I was here one year ago in February ...for a period of 12 days. I loved it then, as it was more of an apartment setting (from other Hampton Inns). The service was outstanding. I was only going to be there for a few days and things changed ...they allowed me to negotiate a better rate (since more thna 10 days). So service was great even back then ...I loved the room! So I get htere this year, and things have been remodeled significantly ..and I love it even more ...the room is more contemporary ...very comfortable ..and the service outstanding. You can't beat the location, with proximity to anything you would want, whether restaurant type/choice, grocery store close, and the proximity to many popular attractions (e.g. Navy Pier, shopping, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: fourKs
Reviews.Content: Staff service was excellent. The valet staff was courteous and helpful. At the front desk Yaneli was very welcoming - always had a big smile and very enthusiastic. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. No issue with the nearby fire station noise as noted by other reviews; our room was on the backside of the hotel. The hotel is about 4 blocks off Michigan Ave - a very easy and safe walk. Breakfast was good and tasty (good danishes and muffins).

Reviews.Title: “Super nice people and place.”
Reviews.Author: Mecheleyhomas17
Reviews.Content: I'm from the south and expected to meet very blunt and unfriendly people, wow was I wrong. Every one was so nice and helpful,I will definitely will return!

Reviews.Title: “VERY Accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: slkocher
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than "Check In" time with (3) tired children. They got us right in to our room immediately. The room (a suite) was Wonderful and very clean. The people at the desk helped us with maps, taxis, and buses to our attractions. We had a small glitch with the door lock on our room.....not to worry.....they fixed it right away and gave us the cab fare to get to the Shedd Aquarium! We arrived back at the hotel to popcorn popping in the hotel lobby. The kids loved this place. Very kid friendly.......we will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay!”
Reviews.Author: meganbeth4
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and I stayed here for 1 night during Spring Break. It was a very easy hotel to get to from the highway, easy to valet, easy to check in to. The hotel staff was very, very friendly. Our rooom, which was on the 4th floor, was very clean, had comfortable beds and quiet. Each room had a plaque with a photo of something from the chicago area which was neat. The breakfast in the morning was plentiful and there were several places within the breakfast room to get breakfast, so you never had to wait. We got the Blue Man group package which included the following: room for 2, $10 off valet parking, 2 Blue Man group tickets (we were in row H; seats 5, 6); $50 food credit to Jack's on Halstead; free breakfast at the hotel. The total was $350 without tax. Great deal! Jack's was a great restaurant to in as well-right down the street from Blue Man Group and an easy subway ride on the red line.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service to Date”
Reviews.Author: chrisgroce2002
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Hampton Inn on Illinios St. in Chicago. This was about the second or third time we have stayed at this particular hotel and there are several reasons for this: The staff are quite helpful and friendly. They know the city well and can always give good advice as to where to visit to eat and have fun. Yaneli (spelling?) was very nice and helpful to me and my family during our stay. We will continue to stay at this location when we return to Chicago. Hopefully next year we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Excellent Staff - Wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: H46Driver
Reviews.Content: By far the best Hampton Inn I've stayed at and I travel a bit. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. We are foodies and the breakfast really exceeded expectations. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the pool was nice too. The location is 1.5 blocks from Grand on the Red Line. The only two downsides were that it is next to a fire station. We could see the station from our window but it didn't bother us. I heard another guest comment on it. Second was that our suite had a sink, microwave and refrig but no flatware or cups (defeats the purpose of a kitchenette).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momofboys1181
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel was wonderful. The rooms were nice and very clean. The free breakfast was awesome. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect on location and on services”
Reviews.Author: HeleneAlmaCosima
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 2 children 8 nights in this hotel, great location in Chicago, we can walk easily to main attractions (Hancock Tower, Downtown, restaurants, shops...). Free internet in business center. There is a food store almost beside. Rooms were big, good bed, microwave and coffee maker in rooms, great warm whirlpool, very nice swimming pool with sauna and fitness center. Daily breakfast was excellent, a lot of choice (cold, hot, eggs, cereals, fruits...) and all day around we can have for free cup of tea or coffee. I was very happy to find this hotel at very good price, definitely I'd stay there if I'd come again to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing customer service and clean/modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: cookiemonster1908
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I truly enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn in downtown Chicago. We were in town for one night for a concert at the House of Blues and this hotel was incredibly close to the concert venue. This hotel didn't disappoint. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a larger room and the front desk employee recommended a few seafood restaurants within walking distance (my fiance only eats seafood). They recommended a nearby crab house and even made the reservation for us. We felt very taken care of. Upon seeing our room, we were pleasantly surprised - Hampton Inn always has nice rooms, but this looked more like an upscale, modern hotel. Very nice color scheme and a large living space area/kitchen. The bed was comfortable, every employee we ran into was friendly, the complimentary breakfast was superb and we will absolutely stay here again when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mkreus01
Reviews.Content: This was the only nice hotel that met my budget for my team meeting. Everything worked out very well. I had no issues whatsoever. Rosebud was great and ther is a Ruths Chris attached also. Great location for sightseeing and bus routes. Kim Miller was a pleasure to coordinate with.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the BEST Hampton Inn we ever resided in for a "get-a-way"!! REALLY!!”
Reviews.Author: TravJX3
Reviews.Content: I was in the hotel business and so I carry with me a "higher standard" and probably the reason I usually stay in Hilton branded hotels i.e. Hilton Garden Inns, Embassy Suites, Hilton, Conrad, The Palmer House, but this time for my birthday and with my spouse and my three boys (ages 14, 12, & 7) we decided to stay at this hotel due to its amenities, pool (of course), its location being only two short blocks from the House of Blues restaurant with live music, and the very fair rate with upgraded I requested and was bestowed upon by the very capable and accommodating General Manager, Mr. Andrew Scarlett. Thank you for everything and more. After the ease of e-check-in prior to arrival around 7 PM, we were very properly greeted by Paul (?). Our double - double suite on the 10th floor was very well appointed, updated, modern, furnished, and contained two NICE surprises....three windows on a corner for two views and two large flat screen LCD TV's, one in each the sleeping room and the parlor. (Two TV's are NOT listed on the Hilton web site room description for this hotel.) After getting settled with the kitchenette including the mid-size refrigerator to chill the spouse's and my beverages, we attended the very clean and well designed indoor swimming pool, large hot tub, and hot sauna located on the second floor. The pool is located very close to the restrooms, business center with four large (working!!) monitors all with free printing capabilities, and the breakfast area / dining room. I then printed the needed dining certificate and menu with ease before preparing ourselves for dinner. And, again, it was a simple, easy, safe, and comfortable walk to the House of Blues, when we passed a number of acclaimed restaurants within just two blocks! (Rosebuds, Sullivan's, Harry Carry's, Mother Hubbards Sports Bar, and, of course, with St. Patricks Day being the next day, a number of quiant Irish Pubs and Cafes. After our short return, we settled into the very comfortable and well-appointed beds. The breakfast on a weekday, Thursday, is open from 6 AM to 10 AM, and offers a full array of hot and cold items with about four (yes, 4) servers / attendants clearing trays, replenishing food and beverages, and geberally keeping all happy. (Our family felt so good and comfortable on the St. Pats Day morning, we started sharing and giving away green beads / necklaces to the servers, guests, children, and adults, to lighten the mood and create an even happier climate.) The staff was already handing out complimentary little green boxes of mints! The staff was very appreciative and thankful for the green beads we gave to all. After another dip in the wonderful pool, walk on the outdoor patio, and walkout in the great fitness center, we packed, checked our bags, and walked just four blocks to the Rock n Roll McDonalds, Portellos, Hard Rock Cafe, and the Rain Forest Cafe!! What a wonderful stay and day in the city we had!! Thank you Andrew and the entire staff at this great and wonderful Hampton Inn for making our one night get-a-way for a birthday, St. Pats, and the opening of Body Worlds at the MSI so memorable!! And my I add, we stay in many Hampton Inns with our travels to members of my rather large family and this is one of the BEST HILTON brand stays we have ever experienced. Thank you as I believe we found a home away from our home which is just west of Chicago one hour in St. Charles, IL. My whole family "tips our hat" to all of you!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the friendliest hotel in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: frau55
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Hampton Inn & Suites in Chicago. The hotel has been completely renovated in the past six months, and the rooms are tasteful and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast offers a good variety of offerings. The staff, however, is what makes this hotel truly exceptional. They are very professional, yet warm and welcoming. They went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very friendly and funny, room was very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sdeegan3
Reviews.Content: Went for a bachelorette party with a few girlfriends. The staff was very friendly and funny. They made us feel very comfortable. After arriving back at the hotel the concierge Mohamed was so accommodating. He new we had probably drank too much and gave the few of us that stayed up a free pizza and bottled water. After making us feel so welcome and at home, he moved our check out time to 2p.m. instead of 11 so the bride-to-be didn't have to wake so early. Great staff, very comfortable beds, clean and the BEST continental breakfast I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “No Communication - Wasted Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mao007
Reviews.Content: Wife and I booked this hotel in connection with the "American Beauty Show" being held at McCormick Place. We received a good rate at $99 and it appeared to be located in a very convenient location to other activities in the city. My wife has a very serious food allergy and requires an in-room micro and fridge to prepare all meals. When I called to book this room I was connected to reservations and was told this room would have these amenities (leading me to believe that all rooms there had the same as a standard item). Since this was such a necessary item for our stay I called a second time, a day before the reservation, to confirm and once again was told there would definitely be a micro/fridge located in our room. (No need for a specialrequest) After driving four hours to arrive, we checked in and discovered no micro / no fridge. We called the desk and was told there were none available (even at a charge). We were offered an option to possibly work out a solution the following day ...but this was no help as we had to prepare and store meals beginning that evening. In their defense the offered to store her food in a fridge at the desk but her allergy is so severe that it is risky not to isolate her items. Initially they had mentioned a suite option (which had micro/fridge) but was told this would come at the increased price. I told them I would accept this solution but after checking was told it would not be available for my length of stay. After an hour conversation with someone from Hampton Inn guest services (1-800) we were left with no alternative but to check out and return home. There were no other alternatives offered by the Hampton Inn personnel. We had to make the four hour return home that night, missing the 3 day conference (pre-paid). My wife also lost pay for the 3 day conference which she was to receive. Guess that $99 special rate at Hampton Inn was not so good afer all. My main complaint here is that first of all ..when booking or checking a reservation at this location you are transferred to a general reservations person that apparently has erroneous information about this property since I spoke to different personnel each time I called and was given the same information. Also, I was never offered an alternative hotel, something I later thought about and wondered why this was never offered. Although not familiar with downtown Chicago they could have offered to help relocate us ..I would have thought anyway. A complaint has been filed in my behalf with Hampton/Hilton but as of yet no comment from their manangement staff. If this is an example of Hampton/Hilton customer service, I will most definitely look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nicely updated decor, family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Natky
Reviews.Content: We traveled with two young children and were anxious to find a family-friendly city hotel. We were not disappointed-spacious two room suite, a clean indoor pool with huge skylight overhead allowing a view of the nearby skyscrapers, great complimentary breakfast in an ample-sized dining room with wrap-around windows overlooking city streets. Free popcorn as you check in-a nice little treat for car weary kids. The decor is modern and updated, with a spa-like feel. The staff was superb, especially Mustaque. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted. Drawbacks? The fire station across the street. The bad news is, we were up all night Friday. The good news is, we were so

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great room, GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingProdigy
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip to Chicago for a couple months now. After researching every hotel I could afford, I decided to book the Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Chicago, and I sure don't regret that. Once I finally got through the crazy amounts of traffic, I arrived at the hotel. I was worried about where I would park (it's downtown Chicago, barely any parking), but they had a swerve in where we could park our car until the valet got it. We went into the lobby and checked in. The lobby is very nice and comforting, and you could tell just by the looks of it that the hotel was either recently built or recently renovated; it had a modern feel to it. The lady that checked us in was very friendly and even made some small talk with us. It was nice that the customer service there didn't act like robots, they made you feel welcome. After we got checked in, we were given a card with the access codes for the complimentary Wifi, and we were given a card for the valet service which we would need with us when we wanted to get our car obviously. The valet took our car and brought it to wherever the dedicated parking was, and we went up to our room. The room was very nice. It was $89 a night; the standard room with double queen beds. Very modern and cozy. I was a bit disappointed that there wasn't a mini-fridge or a microwave, but they had complimentary breakfast so I guess we wouldn't have had much of a need for that. I guess I would've liked to see a bit more in it, but I guess that's what I get for picking a standard room, eh? Anyway, the beds were very comfortable, and the room was very clean. It had a nice flatscreen TV and a desk, chair, etc. The bathroom was clean and had a nice big shower. Getting to sleep wasn't difficult at all. Others have complained about the fire station nearby, but the sirens didn't go off during the night (if they did, then I slept right through them). The bedding was clean, but I slept on my own blanket and pillows anyway. Leaving the hotel and getting my car from the valet was painless. All you do is call down to the front desk about 15 minutes in advance of your departure of the hotel, then the valet will go and get your car and have it ready in the swerve in. The valet people were very careful and we didn't see a scratch on our car (yes, we carefully examined it after every time we got the car like the sign outside says). At first I was skeptical about the valet service. $42 a night? Seems like a lot, but it was well worth it. Not having to worry about finding a parking space and the risk of your car getting stolen was great. Because the hotel is right in downtown Chicago, you can basically go anywhere in just walking distance, and it was quite entertaining to walk around for a couple hours and just look at all of the buildings, skyscrapers, etc. There were plenty restaurants near the hotel, and a large variety too. There's an excellent restaurant that you can access from inside the Hampton Inn called the Rosebud Trattoria. It's an Italian restaurant, and the food was great. A little pricey, but I got Cheese Ravioli for $14 (I believe), and that was great. More than enough to fill me up. There were also several bars, BBQ places, even a McDonalds, all in walking distance. The hotel had many great features. They had a nice pool and hot tub which was nice to wind down in in the evening. The complimentary Wifi was great I was expecting to have to pay for it, so I was more than happy with it. The complimentary breakfast was also great too. Not your typical cold cereal breakfast. They had fresh omelets, hot meat, make-your-own-waffles, muffins, bagels, toast, various fresh pastries, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, and many other things which was delicious. I think I've covered about everything. If you're looking for an affordable yet modern hotel in Downtown Chicago, this is DEFINITELY for you. If I go back to Chicago (which I plan on) I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: swede52
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my daughter and two young grandchildren. The staff couldn't of been any nicer and helpful. They also had a breakfast buffet that was great. They had biscuits and gravy one morning which made my grandchildren VERY happy! The staff was helpful with any questions I had from hotel services to getting around Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, but a Little Loud”
Reviews.Author: Double_A_71
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn in downtown Chicago is a very nice hotel and I paid a great rate for my room. My room felt quite new and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was acceptable and included. The attached Rosebud restaurant serves wonderful food and wine.
