My only caution to Trip Advisor readers is that this hotel is located across the street from a fire station. I can sleep through almost anything, so I would not hesitate to stay here again. However, I might consider another hotel if I was a very light sleeper. I offer one tip if driving to the hotel. Valet parking at the hotel was $42 and included unlimited in and out access. However, there is a surface lot just east of the hotel that charges $25 for 24 hours if you do not need to drive while staying at the hotel. This hotel has many, many good qualities in a nice location at a great price with only one small downside. I still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Downtown Hampton Inn is ideal in price, location, and service”
Reviews.Author: DennieG
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Downtown Hampton Inn on West Illinois. The location is perfect. Easy walks (within 3-4 blocks) to all kinds of restaurants, bars, Michigan Ave, etc. I hosted a group of 15 and the entire group was complimentary. The meeting rooms, food service, sleeping rooms, lobby, etc., are a pinch nicer than the usual Hampton Inn. There is a next door restaurant that has a decent bar. They will deliver both food and drink to your room. I found the staff's recommendations to restaurants, pizzarias, bars, music scene, etc to be dead on. I will use this Hampton Inn for family and business travel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: slwm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hampton Inn and Suites in June 2010 and I never wrote a review as I had intended to do. We are a family of five and stayed in a corner suite with two double beds and a pull out sofa. The corner suite was spacious and worth the small amount extra we paid to book it. It appeared renovations on other floors were taking place during our stay, and our room was newly renovated. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality and space for the price. It was nice having a full size refrigerator rather than a mini fridge. The location seemed safe, even in the evenings. The breakfast area was nicer than your normal Hampton Inn, and the offerings were pretty good for a complimentary hotel breakfast. The choices varied each of our three days. We had no problems with housekeeping or front desk service. Valet parking is pricey, as it is everywhere in the city. We actually parked in the lot across the street for $25 a day instead of $40-45 a day and had no problems. We did happen to be right next to the fire department, although this was not a problem for our family. I was the only one in my family who even woke up a few times due to the sirens, and luckily fell right back asleep; but if you have light sleepers in your party I would suggest a location away from the fire department or ear plugs. The location of this hotel is good. We parked our car when we arrived and did not use it again until we left Chicago. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance as well as a grocery store. The hotel is only a few blocks from Michigan Avenue, but a bit of a hike to the John Hancock Center and Water Tower Place. My youngest child was five and handled it okay, however. One day we went to the Field Museum and Planetarium and caught a bus just a few blocks away on Michigan Ave that took us directly to that area. Overall we had a great stay and would stay at this Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT CHANGE A THING!”
Reviews.Author: MJBEE
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the Hampton Inn and Suites for their outstanding hospitality. I expected to have a great time in Chicago, but with the help of the hotel staff, it superseded my expectations. The staff, from the concierge to housekeeping, was very professional and friendly. When we arrived for check- in, Ronnie (front desk attendant) made sure we felt at home and had everything we needed. She asked us what we were doing for dinner, gave us a list of local restaurants as well as her personal favorites. Whatever we needed, she was there to assist without hesitation. Another staff that made our stay enjoyable was Janita W. She informed us of local events, looked up things to do and was there for just general conversation. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. From the amenities to the excellent service, I would not change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great all around Hampton....very, very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: thecablegirl
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 night stay at this Hampton Inn. The room, 701, was awesome. It was a king 1bdrm suite. It had a kitchen, full fridge, micro and dishwasher with a pull out couch and big flat screen tv. We didn't need the kitchen at all but it was very nice. The bedroom was very nice, comfortable king bed, great blackout curtains and another flat screen tv. This hotel was very clean and modern. The sink area is out in the open with the tub/toilet area having a door...I'm not a huge fan of that. The one thing that wasn't so great is that the hotel seems to be on the ambulance route and they were pretty frequently passing right outside the hotel, sirens blasting. Earplugs were available in the lobby but they didn't bother me. Perhaps if you're a light sleeper this isn't the hotel for you. The breakfast area was beautiful, good breakfast selection as well. Pool and hot tub area also nice and clean. Small fitness area which we didn't use but looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Warm during the 2011 Blizzard”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraKreuzer
Reviews.Content: Staff was very accommodating to my need to first extend my stay, and then to shorten my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: mmcclellan30
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. It is close to shopping and the Merchandise Mart with a great pool, hot tub, sauna, and fitness center. The also offer a great breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: travelingkeiki
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this awesome hotel in February 2011 for our visit to The Oprah Show. Everything was PERFECT! Pros: Price-$85 for weeknight with AAA Location-one block from redline and a few blocks from Michigan Ave, Starbucks and 7-11 (with wine, beer, liquor!) a block away, attached to an Italian restaurant and Ruth's Chris (Happy Hour food for $6 from 3-6), MANY bars and restaurants within two blocks. Rockit Bar & Grill was very good and reasonably priced ($16-25 entrees, $9-12 drinks). Clean Friendly staff Breakfast was awesome! Waffles, eggs, sausage, cereals, fruits, yogurt. Very good selection Open 6-10. Very comfortable beds Pool/hot tub but we didn't use Cons (neither are that bad, but just to make you aware): Valet parking was $42. There is a garage next door which ranged from $25-30 but we didn't really check it out. Noisy-Duh!! Right next to a fire station but they provide ear plugs. This why I rated sleep quality a 4. I am planning on back in the spring when there is not 18 inches of snow on the ground!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Blues Trip”
Reviews.Author: emmer1961
Reviews.Content: From the moment arrived at the Hampton Downtown Chicago, the valets were helpful, the front desk was courteous a helpful, and we were able to get our rooms in minutes. We were given maps, some suggestions of where to go downtown. And the location was perfect, you can walk pretty much anywhere -- Magnificent Mile, House of Blues, Rush St, State St., ...., was all walkable with many resteraunts and night spots nearby. We had a blast. Plus FREE BREAKFAST. And Ronnie from the front desk even help take a picture of our group. I don't think you can beat this hotel for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “You made our days in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: flolansing
Reviews.Content: i got a incredible cheap offer for this hotel on expedia and it is more luxures than i really thought before. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean and nice and huge. Also the staff is very very helpful and friendly! All in all: Two days all included (breakfast, internet, tv....) for 200 Dollars in direct downtown area. Great, thank you i'm very pleased!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: kash07
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was very convenient for our business trip to the Chicago Merchandise Mart. We were able to walk to the Mart as well as enjoy Michigan Avenue for personal shopping and restaurants. We stayed on the 9th floor and had a very nice updated, clean room. The hot breakfast buffet was fabulous! Staff were very pleasant and welcoming. We opted to valet park our car which was a bit more than an open lot next door. However, the hotel allows you to take your car in an out without a limit or addition charge. It was also the weekend of the NFC playoffs so it was much more convenient to valet park. They also have free high speed internet which was a plus as other hotel charge up to $10 a day. A Chicago fire station was across the street, but it was never an issue regarding noise as some others have stated in other reviews. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small town friendliness in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: MichianaFamilyYMCA
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a cold day to the warmest greeting. From the valet to the front desk to the sales staff, we felt we received the royal treatment. But watch for just a short while and you will discover that this is how everyone is treated at Hampton Inn Chicago! The staff was super helpful. The decor of the hotel was modern. Sort of the best of both worlds, with old-fashioned service and all the luxuries of today's technology. The breakfast was delicious and I really appreciated the bowls of fresh apples for an afternoon pick-me-up. Hampton Inn & Suites Chicago really is doing it RIGHT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bshaw23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in perfect spot for visiting Chicago. The staff is very friendly and the hotel itself is very clean and well kept. The kids loved the pool and great breakfast. We stayed with my parents as well as my sister and her family. It is very affordable for a Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A truly comferting stay, a must for all visitors”
Reviews.Author: avilugassy
Reviews.Content: Hi, My line of work requires that I travel a lot- meaning I have to hotel almost every night of my working week, every week of my life. I stayed at the hamptons last week and enjoyed my visit so much I decided to come back when I returned to Chicago the following week (this week). The room was simple (I booked it that way) but spacious, it was warm when I arrived, super clean and tidy and homely. The Hotel staff are amongst the friendliest I have come across, from (yaneli) at the front desk today, to Jennifer (who was working "complimentary breakfast"). Jennifer at breakfast today went out of her way to find the manufacturer of the drink in the drinks machine- which served my orange juice this morning. She was really helpful and polite and put a smile on my face at 8am, which can some times be hard to do. The hotel gives you complimentary wifi which is really fast, and of course available in room! The hotel has a pool (which I have not used) and gym (which I have not used) and available room service from the restaurant downstairs. I ate at the restaurant last week and the fish there was really delicious- you should try it. Over all, the reason I love the hamptons so much is by the far because of all the staff. Both times I have been the staff have been so so friendly and helpful. It really makes you feel at home, welcome. This place is spotless and hotel cleanliness is must to me. Near by is every thing you could want or need, including shops (the magnificent mile), stores, bars and restaurants. It is literally situated moments from shopping north of the river, and moments from crossing the river. If you are traveling for leisure, i would totally recommend the stay! I travel for business, it has every thing there you need! I will be staying there again, so I hope to bump it to you some day! A top shout to every one at the hamptons, please keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: manpak
Reviews.Content: All staff were very welcoming and accommodating. Wonderful breakfast choices for kids through adults. Nice pool. Rooms very clean and recently refurbished. 3 block walk to Michgan Ave bus route. City noises may offend some, since fire station is nearby. Earplugs available at front desk. Our "country grandkids" slept through it all on the 2nd and 3rd nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best business stay!”
Reviews.Author: saraanne213
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn& Suites in Chicago for a business trip. The double bed rooms that we stayed in were fantastic! Very roomy, had a nice TV, great view of town out of our window, and the bathroom was perfect size. It was nice to have an area to bring my laptop and desk work too in the room as well. We used the pool, hot tub, and sauna. They were all very clean and perfect temps. As well as the rooms being very nice we liked the location of the hotel. We were close to everything, within walking distance we never even used a Taxi. The complimentary breakfast had so many options and all the food was warm and didn't seem to be sitting out for long. The staff was great with all of our questions and directed us to where we needed to go. I am planning a trip with my fiance to come down here and we will defiantly be using the Hampton Inn & Suites as our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: conmac94
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the Hampton concept and this is one of the best Hamptons I've ever stayed in! Centrally located with Rosebud Trattoria connected (entrance off lobby), I would receommnd this hotel to anyone visitng Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem of a hotel! 5 out of 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: aviebaby
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, recently remodeled and an amazing staff who actually smiled and helped with any questions! This was my second stay at this hotel and this stay was even better than the first! Very clean hotel, trendy modern decor, superb complimentary breakfast (staffer Sonia was so accommodating and friendly! ) and well kept rooms make this hotel an excellent choice! Close to Michigan Ave shopping, House of Blues and great restaurants. 'Rosebuds' (actually attached to the hotel) is an excellent Italian restaurant and only steps away. This hotel is also centrally located to subways and 'els'. The hotel rate was extrememly reasonable and even the parking fees were below "Chicago average rates". I would totally recommend a stay at this hotel as I know that I will definitely come back for another stay! This hotel makes you want to say "thank you back" for such an enjoyable, safe and pleasant stay! Thank you Hampton Inn for an incredible & fun stay!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: BLUEDRAGON0718
Reviews.Content: I feel that the employees and the service were great. The Rosebud restaurant had great food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend ever!”
Reviews.Author: twang5441
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the 2nd week of December, 2010 which will be a December I will always remember. The sudden snow storm extended our stay for an additional two days which the hotel graciously extended our stay at the same price. The hotel is a stone's throw away from the Magnificent Mile (ten minutes at best). There is Valet parking, easy access to some of Chicago's finest eateries, world renown restaurants, clubs,curb-side taxi service, sights etc. within a few mile radius of the hotel as well, a nice plus. For other places of interest, the hotel gave us maps, handouts and directions to wherever we wanted to go. The staff even supplied us with an umbrella to brave through the windy snows of Chicago (a definite plus). Check in was a breeze and our fifth floor suite was nice and clean. The bed was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was fantastic and they all did a GREAT job. The high- speed Internet was free, fast and worked well. The breakfast was good enough to get you off to a good start. The staff kept the items well stock which made for a good presentation. The hotel, the decor, the room were all first class but I must say that the entire staff is what made it all happen. The staff is truly to be commended and for that I will recommend to others and look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant comfort in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: nsutton57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on several occasions and have always been very pleased. With a full breakfast included, it's a great value. It's in a perfect location in downtown Chicago. Walking is a great option, but the "L" is located a block away and cabs are readily available. I highly recommend this property for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch spot, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: krafty1212
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property numerous times and am so impressed I just had to write a review. The location is perfectly located to all the hot spots of River North nearby, and also easy access to the Mag Mile with all the great shopping. It's connected to Rosebud restaurant which is phenom! Need a cab? Covered circle drive and valet there for easy convenience. Service was great too, easy check in, room was clean. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Rosebud291
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, especially the doorman. He was very helpful with directions and hailing cabs. The location is perfect, all the great shops and restaurants are within walking distance. Our room was large and comfy, and very clean. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cocorizo
Reviews.Content: I had an absolute blast and the Hampton Inn and Suites made it all the more Memorable. Janita Walton was extremely helpful in finding places to eat and hang out she was friendly and cheerful and made staying at this hotel memorable, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “My Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: shaylakm
Reviews.Content: As so as we enter the lot the employees at Hampton Suites were very attentive. We were greeted and given the option of valet parking or street parking which we chose parking as we entered the hotel we were greeted by the friendly upbeat staff. One person in particular by the name of Janita Walton was very helpful in helping us find places to spend time and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AROUNDTHEWORLD216
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for 4 nights. Sunday's weather was ugly. Plenty of snow, strong winds, and very cold. The hotel staff was very helpful. They kept the hot water going so there was always hot tea and coffee available when we returned from the cold outside. The desk always asked if we needed help with where we were going in light of the weather. Even the valet person was very helpful. We read other reviews. Yes, we heard the fire trucks and ambulances. But, it was bearly noticeable and it would not prevent me from staying at this location again. The room was very comfortable. The jacuzzi was great feature of the hotel after returning from the cold. Property is centrally located near the train stations, which made getting to and from the airport easy. There are plenty of great places to eat within a few blocks in any direction of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service for Business”
Reviews.Author: blewis312
Reviews.Content: I had a special request for a quick board room conference call need and it was set up quickly, efficiently and in a friendly fashion. Everything was in order without any hassles and ready to go. Perfect and easy...just the way it should be but often is not at some hotels. They did a SUPER job for me!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, great service ... be aware of the fire station!”
Reviews.Author: Drarig
Reviews.Content: Stayed two night at the Hampton Inn over the weekend and, if you can live with the fire station as your neighbor, appreciated the convenient location in downtown Chicago, close to restaurants, bars and shopping. The personnel was very helpful throughout the weekend. Although the room may be small by some standards, it was clean and the bed was comfortable, which amply meets my standards. This hotel is simply a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: travlin42
Reviews.Content: The hotel was impressive, all-around. We got a very good rate on a two-room suite (comparable to a small room at another hotel I'd stayed in a few weeks earlier). Rooms were clean, comfortable, well stocked/appointed. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful (my son was playing with the room safe and locked it and someone came up to open it within 15 minutes or so -- on a Sunday! We also made several requests for pillows and extra blankets for our kids and the staff always responded quickly.). We also used the pool, which was great. Location was convenient to all of downtown and public transportation. The restaurant in the building (Italian) was good, and there were many to choose from nearby. The only recommendation I would make is to request a room away from the fire house across the street. Our room immediately overlooked it and while it wasn't as disruptive/noisy as you'd think it could be, there was a lot of activity (sirens) (which the kids loved watching but could get noisy).

Reviews.Title: “Needed more time”
Reviews.Author: romanrivas
Reviews.Content: My wif eand I drove from Dayton Ohio and was caught up in a traffic accident that closed the freeway for several hours and did not arrive until 1:30 am and check out was at 2:00pm that same day and even though the room was available we still had to check out at 2 pm which made our Chicago trip very rushed even though we had a wonderful time we felt very rushed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service at a Hampton -- Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Vicster7
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was absolutely excellent,. Reminded me of Ritz/Carlson type service. Every single person was friendly and genuinely seemed happy to have the chance to meet my needs. Newly remodeled - amenities were perfect. Only a block from a fire station, so street noise was above average. Wouldn't keep me from coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A RESTFUL RETREAT, LIKE BEING AT A SPA.”
Reviews.Author: drewliz
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed out trip, the locaion was great, the room very comfortable with great amenities. Will definately come and stay again. The breakfast was great and the staff was ever so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: glstraveling
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a reasonable price in downtown Chicago. The rooms are not too small and seem up to date. The breakfast has a lot of options and is a nice plus to save money on a meal. The only down side is the sirens from the fire station nearby, however we didn't hear them after 10 or 11pm, so it didn't disrupt our sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great”
Reviews.Author: Chemamy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great. It has an excellent location--within walking distance of lots of great restaurants, shops and nightclubs. Staff is very friendly. Parking is a little steep, even for Chicago. Taxis are always easy to find. Everything delivers here, in case you want to stay in for a night. Wifi is free, room is spacious, and beds are extremely comfortable. Full breakfast is a real plus! The only drawback to this hotel is the fire station right outside. Chicago is a busy town, and the firemen have calls throughout the day and night. I'm a sound sleeper, so it didn't bother me too much, but it's there, so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: grizz9
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here. Excellent downtown location. All staff were very nice and helpful. Room was very quiet. There was a fire station nearby but I did not hear it. The Hampton Inn breakfast has improved since my last stay at one of the hotels in this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, good value”
Reviews.Author: Hanna6070
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel with full of nice staffs. You can feel true welcome from their greeting and services. I spent 5 days at Hilton Chicago for business, and my experience with Hilton Chicago wasn't good (due to strike and unfriendliness of hotel staffs).

Reviews.Title: “Five Star hotel on a Three Star budget”
Reviews.Author: iwasjustwandering
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights using Hilton Honors points. We were trying to use as few points as possible and only this hotel and Doubletree were level 5 hotels, all the others downtown were 6. We chose this one because of the free breakfast, and because it seemed a slightly better location. WOW! I've stayed at Hampton Inns before, but never like this. From the moment the doorman with a big smile opens the front door for you, you think you are staying at a 5 star hotel. And it just keeps on coming with the outstanding check in desk staff (thank you Stephanie, you are the BEST!), to the bell desk, to the housekeeping, to the breakfast room. Talking of breakfast, the room is great. On the second level with glass all around for city views, food all pretty good (except fro the liquid eggs used for the scrambled eggs, not so good): Activia yoghurt, Thomas's English muffins, decent bagels, great waffles!, fruit, name brand cereals, etc. all in a clean, well managed room. Bed was VERY comfortable with a sponge pillow and a down/feather one to suit all tastes. Hotel lobby is great, with afternoon freshly popped popcorn, all corridors are clean and very well kept. This really feels like a much fancier hotel than a regular Hampton Inn. The only bad news is the SIRENS. Loud and several times during the day and night, coming from the fire station next door, which also dispatches ambulances so it's not just the occasional fire. We were in a king bed room. I think all kings are on the fire station side, so the doubles on the other side might not be as bad. But we use a sound machine (those things that make white noise) and it did a great job of drowning out the noise at night so we were never woken up. The hotel also offers free earplugs. Even without the sound machine, after a short while we didn't even really notice the sirens, and I would definitely not let the noise be a deal breaker to this otherwise perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy bathroom/entryway floors.”
Reviews.Author: Scott_L42
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel started with great promise. The checkin was extremely friendly, the location is better than I expected for the price. And, if the room were hygenic - it would have been a good value, with the free breakfast and all. Unfortunately, the entryway and bathroom are done in white tile. And it looked like they hadn't mopped in weeks. I called down that morning to ask them to mop the floor. Okay - perhaps a maid made a mistake, and the last folks in the room were messy. That would be forgivable. At that point, I would have been happy with a cleaned floor. Came back after an afternoon of museum-going and shopping - and the floor looked exactly the same. I called the manager, who said "We've got new floor tiles - I've got 3 complaints about this so far today. It's part of the tile pattern, it's not dirty." (Do most people buy white tile that LOOKS dirty? Or skillfully installs so that bootprints line up on multiple tiles?) I asked her to come up. She wiped her dry finger against some of the stains, and pointed out that no dirt was on her finger - and that was "proof" to her. They told me that they'd try to mop it again - even though they kept saying that the floor was not filthy-dirty. I waited for a half hour, just to see what they did when they mopped the floor - but I had to leave. I never saw the maid again. She may have come when I was away - I don't know. But the floor looked the same when I returned. My first call to Hilton to complain was met with a telephone operator who insisted that, if the manager wouldn't help me, there's nothing she could do, and refused to register my complaint. I called the special "Silver member" line (which I am), who at least took my complaint seriously - but would not offer anything other than to email management. I really didn't feel like I could take a shower in the morning and touch that tile floor. So much for my weekend trip. I cut my weekend trip short and drove home that night. The funny thing? This was a "rewards" stay. Intended as a special gift for loyal frequent business clients. This is a reward that I would rather not have had.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Could be great but for Fire Station”
Reviews.Author: topgun151
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a Great hotel but for the fact that there is a fire station right across the street. The Pros: Very Clean, Modern, Great Rooms & Services, Friendly staff, Location is outstanding and the value is great. Also the free breakfast which is pretty decent in a big room on the 2nd floor is a nice perk. The only con is the fire station next door. I was on the top floor not facing the station and I woke in the middle of the night to the sirens. This wasn't a big deal to me as I was able to fall back to sleep again, but I am sure other people might not have it so easily. But for the fire station, this would be a great hotel. If I am ever in Chicago again, I will stay here because the Pros outweigh the 1 con.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: The good: Comfortable room and bedding Great location in Chicago (except for noise) Friendly, helpful staff Free internet The bad: The fire station next door answers 4-6 calls per night. If you are a light sleeper you will be awakened. The free breakfast is atrocious. Dry scrambled eggs, toast and cereal in an overcrowded and dirty room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfect place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: KMWLakeWales_FL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, easy to walk to shopping and restaurants. The front desk is exceptionally helpful. They can direct you to wherever you want to go. We especially enjoyed the Museum of Natural History (Field Museum), the Lincoln Park Zoo and the boat tour. Don't miss Shaw's Crab House and D4 Pub. The best shopping is at Water Tower Place.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: PatDotThis
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our choice of hotel for the conference we attended. We had over 30 rooms booked and not a problem to be found! The location was central to our conference venue (McCormick Place) and in a safe environment in the city. The rooms were clean and updated, the breakfast was great with plentiful choices. The best part of the stay were the wonderful attentive staff on hand - it was more like concierge service! With the many changes/additions that were made to our group's stay, the staff was professional, courteous and more than helpful. When we come back to Chicago - we will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kranders12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a hidden gem. It is in a great location, just a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue. Many great restaurants, in all price ranges, are just a few steps away. Hotel staff was absolutely amazing. Every one of them greeted us with a smile and a "how can I help you attitiude" each day. The complimentary breakfast was amazing, you really could not ask for a better breakfast and the fact that it is included with the room rate is huge. The free internet, in the room, was a bonus also. I spent a lot of time doing comparison shopping for hotels on and off the Magnificent Mile before our trip and was not a bit disappointed in my choice. We have paid much for hotel rooms on the mile during previous visits. Were they nicer? No, not really. Did they cost more? absolutely!! Many of the other hotels were twice as much and DID NOT include breakfast for the enitre family or wi-fi IN THE ROOM. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn in the Country”
Reviews.Author: dgran33
Reviews.Content: I spend 60-90 nights a year in hotels across the country and around the world and have preferred Hampton Inn properties for over 10 years. So I try to book a room in one if possible. This hotel is without a doubt the best one I've ever stayed in. It's quiet, the rooms are very well furnished for a business traveler and the staff were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service and Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: GottaRunandFly
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago over the weekend because I was running the marathon and I really enjoyed my stay at the Hampton Inn. The staff was amazing and did everything they could to accommodate the runners and their families over one of the busiest weekends in Chicago. They even had water and bananas sitting out for the runners the day of the race. The location is great and I can say this because I used to live there and I'm not just a tourist. I knocked a star on the Sleep Quality because it's across the street from a fire station and the sirens were loud at night. I can honestly say Hampton Inn has done a great job as a chain to modernize their hotels and I would gladly stay at one again. Comfy beds, great staff and FREE breakfast every morning and FREE wireless.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in River North”
Reviews.Author: 2freespiritsToronto
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a weekend in Chicaco after being satisfied with a previous stay at another Hampton Inn. The room and public areas were clean and nicely decorated, and the staff friendly and helpful. We were accomodated with a late check-out when requested. The breakfast buffet is convenient and a time-saver. We found the location convenient to shopping, restaurants, blues clubs and transit lines.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a full suite”
Reviews.Author: the_faceman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Presidential Suite just prior to the Chicago Marathon. The room was very clean, rather spacious (for a hotel room in the city), and had a full, modern kitchenette (including a dishwasher and a full-sized refrigerator). The included breakfast provided at the hotel was more than the usual continental breakfast. Fresh waffles, scrambled eggs, hard-boiled eggs, and two types of fresh fruit salad were offered every day we were there. We'd stay here again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brubs23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over Columbus Day weekend. Room was large with refrigerator, sink, and microwave; very clean, nicely decorated. Hotel was in a perfect location with many restaurants/bars/shopping/attractions within short walking distance. Breakfast room was very nice, well-maintained, and always stocked with new food, even as breakfast hours came to an end. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: Choosy-Guy
Reviews.Content: The location is great - right in the middle of the action with easy walking to several nearby attractions like Michigan Ave. (shopping), Navy Pier, Millenium Park, Willis Tower, and a juggernaut of restaurants - ranging from fine dining to fast food. The staff are also fabulous - friendly and helpful. There were only two significant downsides - the woefully over-subscribed free Internet connection, and the noise. The (wireless) free Internet connection worked great when few guests were in the hotel / off peak, and was pretty much unusable when many guests returned/were using it / on peak. I do networking and such for a living, and my read is that the connection capacity is insufficient. The hotel should really consider buying a bigger pipe, or even better - buying something burstable that would scale-up with the demand. In our case, we'd have MUCH rather paid for Internet service and had something consistently usable, as we had to complete some business remotely. Reagarding the noise - we were on the 12th floor, and the noise from the street and the fire station next door was substantial (it is downtown, after all). Additionally, the slamming of other guests room doors was a bit disturbing. That said, the hotel is fully aware of the noise issues and kindly offers earplugs (which made us laugh at first, but then we recognized the wisdom). If you're visiting and up for some 'alternative/intellectual' shopping, I highly recommend Mables at 55 E. Grand Ave. I bought some spatial puzzles for people at work and they love them!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Glassmeyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 months. During that time every room was clean and nicely appointed. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The location is perfect - near lots of chain and local restaurants, convenient to various parking options, near all the shopping of Michigan Avenue, and one block from the Grand stop on the Red Line. There is a fire station on the next block but this is a downtown hotel. With Hilton points and a free breakfast I am not sure what else a traveler could want.

Reviews.Title: “Professional in every way”
Reviews.Author: havenwashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Cassandra and Tomekin in your main office were great. Each one came to my rescue on audio eqpt. rental from a local company. Both did a great job of interfacing with my client, JAG. All other staff I came in contact with were of the highers caliber, from parking, bellmen, house keeping and the front desk staff. THANK YOU for having a well trained staff. Best regards, Haven McKinney Whitaker Technologies 301-474-6748

Reviews.Title: “Out Standing Personalized Customer Care!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie1085
Reviews.Content: My colleagues & I stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites, over a 10 day period, while preparing & exhibiting at IMTS2010. I would highly recommend this property for its convenient location, clean & comfortable rooms, above average complimentary breakfast and courteous & helpful front desk staff. While this alone merits my praise, it was the outstanding personalized customer care that I received from Hampton Sales Manager, Kim Miller that was truly beyond reproach. I worked with Kim 11 tiring months preparing for our stay in Chicago. Always patient & courteous, Kim helped me reserve 21 rooms to accommodate my companies ever changing needs. She was an absolute delight to work with & I cannot thank her enough for turning what could have been a nightmare into an effortless dream. In a city full of exceptional hotels, this is what will bring us back to the Hampton in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Go For It!”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from August 20 to August 31, 2010. I have no complaints other than that one of three elevators was down for the last day or so of our visit, making it a bit of a wait to go up or down. That's it! Pictures of the room are posted for your review. The room and bathroom were kept very clean, to me the most important thing of all! Toiletries (shampoo, conditioner and moisturizer) were replaced daily as needed - never had to ask. Nothing was lacking - we had a fridge which we used a lot, a microwave and coffee maker which we didn't use at all, a chair with ottoman for reading and a great T.V. The bed was so comfortable I slept through the night - most unusual for me. I loved the duvet and pillows. Despite previous postings of noise from the fire station down the block we weren't bothered, maybe because we live downtown and are used to City noises. All the staff were friendly and helpful and we encountered no "attitudes". The breakfast was adequate and we were able to get seats the times we did go down. You can get coffee anytime. There is a business centre with free internet so you can Google or print off your boarding pass. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that. The cost of the room was $149.00 per night plus tax. One of the things I liked best about this hotel was the location. It is about a 4-5 minute walk from the Grand stop on the red line. We were even able to use the transit system to take the El from the Airport to the hotel by taking the blue line to Jackson, and then transferring to the red line to go north to Grand. It worked with no complications other than that I have to get a lighter suitcase for myself...a younger, stronger person would have no problems. We bought a weekly pass for the El and used it to go everywhere - Andersonville, Chinatown, Oak Park, Bucktown, etc. etc. The hotel is also an easy walk to the Magnificent Mile and the Loop. As for restaurants and cafes, there are many in the immediate area. Some I would recommend are Lou Malnati's, Portillo's and Ed Debevic's. The place we enjoyed eating at the most was Ann Sather's (Swedish) in Andersonville. In the end result, there's no shortage of things to do in Chicago and I would go again anytime, booking at this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service by the entire staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hose1
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Hilton properties and are seldome disappointed. My stay at this Hampton was exceptional. The staff in particular were all excellent. Everyone including the Housekeepers were friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to any traveler as it is extremely clean, safe and convenient. For my next trip to Chicago, I will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Labor Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel this past Labor Day Weekend. Convenient location with restaurants nearby. Only downside with location was a fire station across the street. I was on the opposite side of the building so a distraction at first but eventually got used to it and was able to sleep without any issues. I imagine my opinion would be different if on the same side of the street as the fire station. Room comfortable and convenient. A microwave and refrigerator would have been a nice touch. Free breakfast and internet were great. Hotel staff was excellent. Any request was taken serious with thought going into any response. The staff was friendly and customer service oriented yet very real at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Business Meeting Successful”
Reviews.Author: brianbcc
Reviews.Content: We used the Hampton Inn Chicago for a business meeting place for my national / international colleagues. As the meeting was somewhat last minute, we were looking for assistance to execute the meeting with no hassles. Further, in this environment, we needed something at a reasonable cost. All of this was accomplished...and the thanks is owed to the responsive and friendly staff at the hotel that I dealt with. As I don't live in Chicago, calls and emails were promptly returned and addressed. Further, other staff were helpful in arranging transportation on two dinner events. My colleagues were all complimentary of how the meeting turned out...and I owe a debt of gratitude to this team. Because of our success, we may now return to Chicago and this hotel to work with this staff even if we have all the time we need to plan our next meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service, but expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: mattia77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area, only a few blocks from Michigan ave and the Red Line Train. It is a very safe neighborhood...only Con: the fire station is down the block and although we heard 2 or 3 fire trucks a day, it never bothered our sleep. The rooms are pretty in muted greens and the beds are soft and clean. The hotel is very nice, with a great breakfast in the morning. The staff is just the best! Super friendly! Always ready to help. We even called down and had them bring up a fan for our room, which got there 10 minutes after we asked, at 11pm at night. One problem was the a/c in our room. We had it turned down as low as it would go, and the room never got very cool, however, with the fan, it was fine and not worth complaining about. THe room met my expectations in terms of being clean, although you can see some wear and tear. The elevators are pretty slow, but the other amentities made up for these small things. The parking was pricey: 42$ for hotel valet. Instead, I parked right up the street on the left accross from the Snickers bar. That parking lot is $25 for over night parking. If you get there after the night person has left, you can park and pay at Snickers. The pool area is also nice, and we used the hot tub on several occations after sight-seeing all day. WE would go down around 4pm for an hour, and be the only people in there. If we return to Chicago, and could get a good deal on the room like we did this time, I would totally stay here again!!! Its a great place at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roadie2010
Reviews.Content: 3 blocks from the heart of Michigan Ave., 3 blocks from the river, 4 blocks from great blues - plus a very clean, comfy hotel with friendly staff and a more than ample breakfast - make this the hotel I will always use when I'm in Chicago! The only downsides were there wasn't a fridge in the room and the fire station is on the next block. But otherwise it's a GREAT hotel and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvlr559
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel labor day weekend 2010. This hotel has the expected Hampton cleanliness and amenities, and everything is recently updated. The difference is the staff. Every single one said hello and offered to help at every opportunity. But more than just being professional, they seemed genuinely happy to be where they were. That's an attitude that you can't train - it has to be there because they enjoy the job. I highly recommend this Hampton. Convenient to both the loop for business, and magnificent mile for shopping/restaurants. This will be my choice in Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Busisness Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LWS-NYC
Reviews.Content: All the basics - comfortable clean room, free internet and breaksfast - at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, horrible sleep!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwibird63
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel in downtown Chicago just off Magnificent Mile. It is has a wonderful art deco lobby in creams and yellows with dark wood. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed in pale greens, dark wood and gorgeous bedding. Great restaurant, Ben Pao right across the street. Had a fantastic dinner after a long day of travel. Went to bed only to discover that opposite the hotel is the Fire Department. So in the middle of the night, on more than one occasion, we were woken by the sirens of the emergency vehicles heading out on calls. We won't be able to stay there again which is a shame because if it wasn't for the sirens we would rate this hotel a five star!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the River North”
Reviews.Author: struex
Reviews.Content: WE had a great stay at the hotel - I have recommended to my colleagues and others if they are headed to Chicago. The location downtown is ideal - two blocks for the subway and walking distance to everything on the north side of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Informative Staff - Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: CDgirlOcala
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my family on vacation. Had a wonderful time. From the moment we made our reservations (I had a wrong date that the desk clerk helped me fix) to check out, we saw nothing but friendly faces. They had excellent recommendations for near by dinner locations, subway directions, and their breakfast was a HUGE perk. Can't wait to visit Chicago again and visit them!! OH! The attached restaurant had fantastic $5.00 burgers. That too!

Reviews.Title: “The staff make Hampton Suites Chicago Downtown”
Reviews.Author: futurus
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. All of the staff are friendly and make every effort to make you feel welcome and to ensure you get the most of your stay in the hotel and in Chicago. Particular thanks to the Bell Captain and concierges.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: trailbiter
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business staying at theWit, but when I tried to extened my stay, because my husband was joining me, they were sold out. We worked to find a hotel to move to that was within walking distance of everything...and was reasonably priced. The Hampton Inn & Suites - Chicago River North met both of these requirements. The location is great and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I would especially like to thank the front desk clerk Yanelli, who always greeted us with a smile and helpful information. Upon check-in my husband discussed his concerns regarding the fire station being one block away...and the noise that that may cause. Yanelli brought out a map of the hotel and explained that the double-double rooms on the back-side of the hotel are the quietest, however the view is not as nice. The king rooms are on the main street where it is a bit noisier. We decided to give up our king room and take a double-double. It was a great decision for us and we appreciated that Yanelli gave us the choice. Every time we came to the front desk for guidance or information, we either saw Yanelli's happy face or the nice gentlemen that works with her. I can't forget to mention the staff working the room where the breakfast buffet is served. They took their job seriously, yet they were also very friendly, happy and accommodating. The complimentary breakfast was a nice treat that we had not expected and it really came in handy when we were in a hurry to eat and run. Oh, and speaking of food, the hotel is actually one block away from three of the restaurants run by Rick Bayless, from the Food Network. (OMG-the food is fantastic-reservations needed) Hampton Inn & Suites - Chicago River North is doing something right! From: The Gomez's

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: leales
Reviews.Content: My family had a fantastic stay at this hotel. The room was incredible, perfect for a family of three. The price was excellent which makes up for the parking. The staff was so helpful and attentive. It was convenient to everything we were doing. It is only four blocks to Michigan Avenue! This was our second stay here and Iâ€™m so very happy we found it. Bonus: it has an Arts and Crafts theme!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: cincykat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner suite, which provided plenty of room for the four of us, as well as a kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator. The hotel is right around the corner from the red-line subway. We took it north to Wrigley Field and south to US Cellular Field. It is also on the route for the Navy Pier free trolley. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the room was extremely clean. There is a fire station next door, so we heard lots of sirens, but the hotel provides free ear plugs in case you're a light sleeper. The indoor pool and hot tub were popular with our teenagers. We would definitely stay here again. The location is so convenient to public transportation. Parking costs $42.00 per day, which seems to be consistent with other hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary Breakfast was a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: keystone70
Reviews.Content: We didn't realise breakfast was included and it was a terrific buffet with make your own waffles, and hot and continental breakfast items. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The kids loved the complimentary cookies and real popcorn on weekdays in the foyer. It was only a 10min walk to the John Hancock building passing heaps of restaurants on the way. Needed a $15 cab ride for the Field Museum and the Shedd Aquarium. We enjoyed the pool and the free internet. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazyl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 different nights about a month apart. The first room was a little outdated and worn but clean, comfortable size and beds, right above the fire station but never woke us. The second room apparently had been renovated, newer furnishings, very nice, same set up as first room. Only the bathroom door handles were old and worn (not a problem). This room overlooked the pool and patio and some of the skyscrapers, nice. Service was great and the staff very friendly in all departments. Lobby decor very nice. Has a nice area in front to drive up to instead of having to double park to empty your car and register. Valet parking was expensive, I would advise self parking in a lot across the street for much less. Location can't be beat, walkable to everything. Breakfast: waffles, fruit, muffins all great. scrambled eggs were nasty. staff very friendly and dining area nice. i would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: Illinois1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a 2 night stay in a corner suite with kitchen. I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times - several years ago. We always enjoy our stays at Hamptons, but the remodeling at this hotel is spectacular! Our room was beautifully decorated and had all of the amenities one would need. We ended up eating out only twice as Trader Joe's was 2 blocks away and we stocked up on snacks, lunch items. The location of this hotel can not be beat. Many great restaurants surround the neighborhood of this hotel including Rosebud and Ruth's Chris adjacent to the hotel. We walked literally everywhere we wanted to go - including Navy Pier, Millennium Park and Ogilvie station to meet my other daughter and grandson who came to spend the day with us on Sunday. My 3 year old grandson was thrilled to see the fire department next door. The sirens at night took some getting used to, but we slept great in the plush beds provided. Our room was spotless when we arrived. Housekeeping as well as every staff member we encountered were polite, helpful and courteous. The indoor pool and outdoor sun deck were clean and well maintained. The breakfast was wonderful both mornings. The breakfast staff were cheerful and quickly cleaned tables and replenished food items. Having coffee 24/7 was much appreciated. Every staff member we encountered made us happy we were staying there. I highly recommend this hotel. We were sad to leave today, but will be returning for our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: quof
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located, and easily visible as I came out of the Grand (Red Line) station, although I don't recommend using this station if you have lots of luggage. The room was spotlessly clean, and the temperature was comfortable despite the incredible heat and humidity outside. The fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room were handy, and the lap desk made using my laptop in bed comfortable. The breakfast was plentiful, although I didn't try any of the hot options, and would have liked a few more cereal choices. While there were renovations going on, I was never disturbed by the noise or mess. There is a firestation next door, and I did hear sirens during the night (from the 11th floor) but it didn't bother me enough to go ask for the earplugs available from the front desk. My only complaint at all is that, at 8:15 in the morning, I heard what I thought was a knock at the door. As I was walking across the room to check, there was a second knock while the housekeeper was simultaneously opening the door to come in to clean. While I know I could have hung the Do Not Disturb sign, I have never had this experience in the hundred or so hotels I have visited in my lifetime. I wasn't checking out that day, so there was no need for my room to be cleaned that early. Who dispatches housekeepers at 8:00 a.m.? and if they do, surely they recognize that people may be sleeping or in the shower and need more than one quick knock before you let yourself in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed (and I love Hampton Inns)”
Reviews.Author: iluv2traveldoyou
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a short notice. I absolutely love the quality and price (and hot breakfast) that Hampton Inns offer, however I was not too impressed with this hotel. One of the major drawbacks was that there was no fridge and no microwave in the hotel. Usually Hampton Inns have this as a standard. The valet parking was a bit pricey, but what can you expect in the heart of the Windy City. I was not too impressed with the hot breakfast. The eggs and fruit had an after taste. The belgian waffle was the best attraction and that was average to say the least. My hotel card kept getting de-magnetized which became annoying after the 3rd trip to the front desk. Especially since you need to insert your card on the elevator to get to your hotel floor. One of the positives of this hotel was that it was very convenient to the nighlife, the Taste of Chicago, and shopping. Overall, I would recommend this hotel however there needs to be an upgrade in the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “the management was terrible !”
Reviews.Author: ruffracing2
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel in october 2009 and was told it would be totally remodeled by march 2010 , so I told my group they were going to be in a newly remodeled hotel and they weren't ,so needless to say I was embarassed ! If you stayed on the fourth floor you heard all of the construction . I was supposed to check in on june 25 so i went pay for my room in advance and when I got there they told me that my presidential suite I paid for in advance was not available ! No apology No explaination! The general manager of the hotel was assisting me at the front desk when I checked in and was not concerned at all ! I should have got a call telling me that the construction was not done and I feel very bad for the group , Some of them weren't even in new rooms ! Paying in advance doesn't get you what you pay for there ! Bad Experience !!! NO CUSTOMER SERVICE !!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: hockeytlc
Reviews.Content: The staff maintained exceptional customer service. The breakfast selections were satisfactory. The location was fantastic. My only complaint is that we didn't know the price of valet parking and the option to park elsewhere for a lesser cost. The hotel was actually located at 22 West Monroe in the Theatre District.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lonetravel1
Reviews.Content: The stay was great! Had to cut it short for personal reasons and they credited my account for the second night I was unable to stay! Next to the fire department, but they didn't keep me awake! Courteous and professional staff. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: shmrq17
Reviews.Content: 1. Neighborhood is great and safe. 2. Lots of local bars a couple streets over on Wells and Clark all the way up to Chicago Ave. 3. Every employee greeted us nicely, not a negative person in the place! 4. 160 a night more than I'm used to but had a free night coupon so helped 5. Breakfast included to get the day going 6. I would stay here again, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal location, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Reviewer20
Reviews.Content: I had business meetings in downtown Chicago last week, so after an extensive search, selected this hotel based primarily on the rate offered, and the decent TA reviews. It turned out to be a great stay, they were able to get me a "& Suites" room that had the kitchen area and living room - so had plenty of space. Biggest +s: The location is fantastic... Everything downtown Chicago has to offer is well within walking distance. Harry Caray's, the Billy Goat (original), the CTA ORANGE (not Blue) line are all just a few blocks away. The Blue line is about a 5- to 6-block walk. The staff are all very accommodating and friendly - willing and eager to help. Also the breakfast area had plenty of seating and food both. They did a good job of keeping it stocked and clean. Biggest -s: The rooms themselves, while kept clean, were definitely showing their age; some rust around the door frames, a bit of peeling wallpaper, etc. but not at all a big impact to the stay quality/enjoyment. But it is there, and that's why I gave it a 3* cleanliness rating. Also, the fire station is right across the street (Dearborn), so rooms on that side of the hotel are closer to the noise, but I can't imagine it's that quiet anywhere in downtown Chicago. If the sirens are on, I would think all the buildings in the block would hear the noise. Didn't impact the quality of the stay either, but may bother some people. Overall, the hotel was actually very quiet - fire station noise notwithstanding. Other comments: The first two floors have all been redecorated and look really nice. Everything from the lobby to the breakfast area, meeting rooms, fitness center, pool area, etc. all looked up-to-date and well kept. The hotel is attached (doors into) two restaurants: The Rosebud Trattoria on the lobby level and Ruth's Chris Steakhouse on the second level. That was really nice - although there are hundreds of restaurants within walking distance, if you didn't really want to go out (e.g., if the weather's bad, or you are just tired of walking) - it was great to have two really nice choices right there at the hotel. Also they have one of those "Pantry" areas right off the front desk with some snacks and sundries. The fitness center was good - 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 1 cycle, then free weights... There were always people there, but it was never overcrowded and never had to wait. It's all attached to an outdoor patio and the pool area - really nice. I didn't try the business center but it was right there on the 2nd floor as well, the standard with a couple of PCs a printer, office supplies, etc. Again, the location of the hotel is great, the prices are very competitive, the staff is very helpful (the bell captain arranged a "limo" ride back to the airport for me which was much better and cheaper than a cab), and the amenities are all there. I would most definitely stay here again if I'm in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: beavertontim
Reviews.Content: Spent one very nice night here. Good location in a nice area to walk in. Close to lots of places to eat and shop. Just a few blocks off the blue line "L" train from O'Hare. Ththe staff was outstanding. Very welcoming. Had a minor issue connecting to the internet and they went out of their way to help me get logged on. The beds were quite comfy, breakfast was good, and the entire place was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjh489o
Reviews.Content: great hotel and staff. Been here for 2 months, and will be here for another 10. Greatest location, clean

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGuy4
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with excellent friendly staff. We were upgraded to a suite when we arrived. The room was great... fantastic even. Unfortunately it shared a corner with the extremely busy firehall next door. Unless you sleep very soundly, expect to be awakened many, many times during the night. Perhaps the rooms on the other side are less noisy. I would definitely stay away in a room as far as possible from the firehall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bossbear
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in town for the International Reading Assoc. convention. My sister came along just to shop. This hotel is 3 blocks off of Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile. We were able to walk anywhere we wanted to go for shopping, eating, site seeing, etc. (A convention shuttle took us to McCormick Place.) Many good places to eat within a few blocks. Our room was on the side near the firehouse and the first night (Saturday) was VERY noisy. After that we were too tired to even notice and slept very well in the comfortable beds. Our room was a corner suite and had a full kitchen. Plenty of space for the three of us. The staff was very friendly and always greeted us, wished us a good day, offered assistance with anything we may have needed. The hot breakfast every day was delicious as well as a money saver - more $ for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: danmoran77
Reviews.Content: Just make sure you don't get a room on across the street from the firehouse! Otherwise, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: laut0022
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel, considering we paid $115 per night. The living room and bedroom were spacious. The hotel appeared to be well maintained and was very clean. The breakfast was OK, decent selection, however the eggs were consistently awful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Marvin06
Reviews.Content: Stayed there and loved every minute of it, It was home away from home!...

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the best price.”
Reviews.Author: Suntraveler007
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel early in the morning and they let us check in at aronud 9 am. It is a block away from the Grand Train Station (red line), so you can get anywhere from there. The room was so clean and comfortable. The complementary breackfast buffet is really good. The employees have excelent knowledge of the nearby good restaurants. It was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DiamondgalDianaG4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we had a bike run the BLT and they were very accomadating as far as where we could store out bikes, very nice and excellent buffet in the morning, We plan on staying there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dachshundparent
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and very nice. The staff was really friendly and were happy to help you with anything you needed. The only flaw was the hot tub. It was pretty obvious it hadn't been cleaned in a while. There were clumps of hair and body oil swishing around in it. However, I rarely see a hotel that doesn't neglect their hot tub. Breakfast was wonderful. Lot's of choices. I would stay here again. We never heard a firetruck.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great sound isolation”
Reviews.Author: DitiTervuren
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed twice in this hotel. This "luxury" hotels is perfectly located near Michigan Ave as well as subways and offers fine rooms. However: be aware of the fire department nearby and the cooling system on top of the telecom building across the street. One wished the rooms were better armed against the constant noise. Oh, breakfast is included in the rate but rather poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: plan2gosoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this weekend with my family. Had 4 King Studios and 1 Double Suite. It was great for the 10 of us. Each King had a small refrigerator, microwave and wet bar. The beds were wonderful. All commented on how comfortable they were. Liked the linens - white down. Had flat screen tvs, analog, which was kind of wierd but then we barely were in the rooms so it was no big deal. The rooms, halls and breakfast area was immaculate. I didn't use the exercise room but 5 others did and had no complaints. The breakfast was free - eggs, sausages, hash browns, muffins, breads, pastry, cereal, fruit, coffee and juice. Not like an upscale hotel but certainly good value. Also free wi-fi which most Hiltons don't give you so it is a nice plus. There is also a business center if you didn't bring your laptop. The front desk, particularly, the concierge-type person was very helpful. Parking is outrageous like all of Chicago. This was $42/day but you did get in and out service if you wanted it. Yes, some of the wood furniture is slightly worn but it is really no big deal. We paid $169 plus tax so not bad. The double suite was huge. It had a full kitchen - full size refrigerator, 2 burner stove top, sink, microwave, dishes, silverware,glasses and pots and pans. Had pull out sofa, desk with chair, 2 oversize stuffed chairs and 2 regular dining chairs so there was plenty of room for the 10 of us. It was our party room. The location is very good, especially if you are young. We are not but still there was plenty of places to eat and clubs all over. Taxi's were easy to catch or you can walk. It is on the corner of Dearborn and Illinois so you are only a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. Also, yes you are close to the fire station but it is no big deal. The place also has room service and the Rosebud Trattoria is attached. We didn't eat there but if you want convenience it is there. I highly recommend it if you are looking for good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “great location except for fire station”
Reviews.Author: aussie_travel_mum_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with two boys under 6 stayed in a one bedroom corner suite for 6 nights and enjoyed our stay. Unfortunately our room was directly opposite the Fire Station - however, the was seen as a total bonus to my boys who camped at the window the whole time watching and listening to the big red engines! It certainly didn't assist with over coming jet lag when woken up by a siren at 4am...however, the room coped with our family of 4 very well and the kitchen was very handy. The seperate lounge room gave us enough room to spread out. The breakfast was better than I've had on some other US trips (there was actually hot food and not just doughnuts) but the use of disposable crockery and cuttlery was very disturbing - way too much waste and using a plastic knife is never satisfactory. The hotel is in the middle of the restaurant district and an easy walk to everything else. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel until they renovate...”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveler100
Reviews.Content: I checked in and after seeing the room and hearing sirens from the fire station next door, checked back out and found another hotel. The room was spacious, but was in serious need of renovation. The furniture was worn, chipped and stained. The ceiling had a large water stain. The bathroom was really shabby, peeling wall paper, stains on the countertop and mirror. The only things in the room that appeared new were the bed and flat screen t.v. The manager said they will be renovating soon - I would skip this hotel until that happens. Unfortunately they cannot do anything about the proximity to the fire station, so if you are a light sleeper, you might want to avoid this one completely.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I choose this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstenz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night. We arrived in town much earlier than our check-in time. I had called ahead to ask the front desk if we may leave our luggage until check in time, and was told it would not be a problem. Upon arriving at the hotel, they let us check in ! Much earlier than check in time! We were thrilled. Our room was very spacious, and clean. The FREE breakfast is very good ! The staff in the dining area were very pleasant,and it was well stocked even when it got busy. we will plan to stay again when we return to Chicago, we love this town !

Reviews.Title: “One incident is enough to make an unpleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: HenrikRJ
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotels from a combination of location and price. The first impression was that it was an OK match between price and quality, without being impressed in any way. But the receptionist made this a very unpleasant experience when we checked out. The previous day my wife had just left her nightgown on the bed, and it was gone when we returned to the room at night. Next morning when checking out, we ask the receptionist if he could help us locate it. By telling us that it was impossible that it could dissapear from the room, he only called housekeeping to check if it was found, as we kept on insisting. It took him less that two seconds on the phone to verify that it wasn't. We tried to call the hotel a few days later to hear if it was been found, but felt we got the same attitude. Not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, includes a nice breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: fourseastravelco
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I stayed here for three nights in room 1003. It was spacious (compared to some hotels in the city), extremely clean, and well-appointed. The location was perfect for us, close to transportation, good restaurants, and shopping!! The breakfast was plentiful, and included something for everyone. The pool, while small, had a nice sun deck and whirlpool. The front desk staff and concierge were very helpful. My only complaint (and I informed management) was that the maid was cleaning our room, the door was open, and I went back to get something that I forgot. She asked me if it was my room, and when I said "yes" she let me in without me proving that. The housekeeping staff should provide more room security for their guests. We enjoyed our stay, and will use this hotel again for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great but ok”
Reviews.Author: MHOakland
Reviews.Content: The location was good for us - close to Michigan Avenue, shopping, Rainforest Cafe, cool two-story McDonald's. There is a firestation across the street but that didn't actually turn out to be significant during the night. The hotel was a bit shabbier than I expected. My only gripe was that the breakfast (free) was poorly managed and there were long periods with no coffee or milk. There was a person staffing and restocking but she didn't seem to be much planning ahead or plan ahead or have any motivation to move faster. The food was ok but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Mom1994
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother, 14 year old daughter, and myself stayed here from July 13 to July 17, 2009. We stayed in room 1029. We had a wonderful stay. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. When we left on our outings each morning, the concierge made sure we knew where we were going. The location is perfect, central to everything. For example, when walking, we were about 25 minutes to Navy Pier and 15 minutes to the John Hancock Observatory. We had a 2 room suite. The kitchenette had everything needed for cooking (if desired). The beds were extremely comfortable. My brother said the pull out couch bed was comfortable as well. We could hear the fire engines occasionally, but it didn't bother us. There was plenty to eat each morning for breakfast, there were eggs and baocn or sausage, cereals, breads, bagels, and muffins, lots to choose from. The subway was close by as well, which made it easier to get to Wrigley Field. We would deifinitely stay here again. We can't say anything negative about the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “15 Days At Hampton”
Reviews.Author: VineetSingh
Reviews.Content: I was there in Hampton for 15 Odd days.The place is nice except the fact that it rub it's shoulders with a fire station.It sometimes become annoying listening to those alarm sounds again and again. The staff was very helpful.The complimentary breakfast is good but they don't change their menu very often so i was quite bored eating the same stuff daily.As for the amenties the Internet room is good but speed is very slow.The pool area is well maintained but gym lacks quite a few essential equipments.One thing which I figured out was that one has to wait a lot(5-7 mins) for the lift & moreover it is sometimes shared by the hotel cleaning staff etc, so it's becomes quite messy sometimes. Overall experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: onedogcity07
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if you are a very heavy sleeper. My teenage children slept through all the sirens and honking from the fire engines and ambulances from the station across the street, but I always heard them leaving and returning throughout the night. The front desk will supply you with ear plugs, but that didn't make a difference. As for the room - we ended having a closet door removed because of a broken mirror. There were black scuff marks on the wall paper and the covers on the baseboard heaters were bent out of shape in several areas. We had a corner suite with a kitchen, full size fridge, dining area, microwave, 2 cooking units with dishes and utensils and a few cooking supplies. There was a flat screen TV in the living area and bedroom. It was a very large suite considering we were in the middle of downtown Chicago. Breakfast in the morning was ok. Lots of bagels, toast, muffins, juice, fruit, coffee and tea. I don't recommend the perfectly shaped round rubber eggs nor the biscuit. The staff were very friendly and helpful. 30 - 40 min. walking distance to Millenium Pk, Navy Pier and Water Tower Place.

Reviews.Title: “Suite at the Hampton was a sweet way to stay.”
Reviews.Author: playmaker16
Reviews.Content: We found a discouted rate at this hotel and really got a great rate on one of the suites. It was nice to have space in a city hotel. Sometimes you can spend so much for such a little room. One of the nicer touches is having a bedroom that you can close off from the rest of the room. Even though we had the room to ourselves, it was nice to feel like we had some addtional privacy. Also in a great locale to do some walking around Chicago on a nice summer day.

Reviews.Title: “Taste of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JRTheChief
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and competent . The hotel is clean and our room was fine. The location of the hotel is good, it's about a 2 block walk to the red line subway. Breakfast is served from 6-10AM. The breakfast bar is very popular with families. If you plan to eat after 8AM be prepared to deal with a swarm of children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, good breakfast and great price,”
Reviews.Author: jamesgraeme
Reviews.Content: Fantastic - rooms large, clean; beds comfortable; tv appropriate size for distance between screen and bed. great decor, evocative of arts and craft architecture - nice little touches such as fresh apples in bowls in lobby friendly and helpful staff - gave very good directions near to almost everything - can walk to Field Museum, short taxi ride to Wrigley Field complementary breakfast provided varied choices including hot scrambled eggs - well stocked with toast, buns, danish and other breakfast foods would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great...I can't say enough good things!”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler1969
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best experiences we've ever had on a vacation. The room was wonderful! It was a true two-room suite, complete with full-size refrigerator, stove, and microwave. It was very spacious and provided plenty of room for the four of us. The flat screen tv's and very comfortable beds were added bonuses. It was ideally located in the restaurant district of Chicago, and there were many great restaurants within walking distance. The Navy Pier and Magnificent Mile were also within walking distance.
