The Museum Campus and other locations (Lincoln Park, Hyde Park, Wrigley Field) were farther out, but we paid for a multi-day ticket on the double decker trolley with hop-on/hop-off which took us to those areas as well as providing a great tour of the downtown architecture. The only negative was the parking, which is valet only and very expensive. A friend of ours had warned us about parking fees at downtown hotels and recommended finding our own place to park, but we chose to use the hotel parking for the convenience since we did not have a clue about Chicago. The valets were very nice and helpful. Even the close proximity to the fire station (which other reviews warned us about) was not a problem during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Antigua0321
Reviews.Content: 1. Free parking. Paid 171 for double bed suite and free parking - fabulous. We had a separate bedroom, bathroom, kitchen with microwave, stove, dishwasher, fridge, 2 flat screen tvs, and a living room. 2. Location. located between State and Dearborn, it's a couple blocks to Weber Grill, Trader Joes, Michigan Ave, Rush St, Chicago Theatre. It's right in the center of everything. We saw a show at the Cadillac and it took us maybe 10 minutes leisurely walking. 3. Customer Service. The same girl that checked us in was the same girl setting up breakfast. 4. Great, free breakfast. Rolls, bread, juice, coffee, hot chocolate, milk, cereal, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, biscuits. The room is set up nice and was not crowded. In addition, we ordered midnight pizza. A security guard brought the pizza guy to our room. That is a nice, added touch of concern for your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeIn
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law had a conference at the Marriott. I came along to watch my six month granddaughter. We had a one bedroom suite and used every inch of bothrooms. Our room had a kitchen, living room and bedroom with two double beds. There was lots of room for the port-a-crib in the bedroom plus luggage. We used the refrigerator to store the baby food and breast milk. We used the microwave to heat the baby food. We had take out food for dinner the first night and used the dining table. There was plenty of room for the baby to play on the living room floor. We had free wireless for our two laptops. The breakfast was substantial. There were many restuarant choices within walking distance. There was valet parking which made life easy with all the baby stuff. The only complaint is the room was worn. Dried stuff was on the wall. The appliances were old and the kitchen area needed work. Frayed carpet in the bathroom. Right next to the firestation so heard sirens. Highly recommend the Lincoln Park Zoo which was 5-10 minutes away by car. The hotel was easy to get to by car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ragingragnar
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel and it was one of the cheaper alternatives! Chicago hotels really are at a premium I found. This one was comfortable, very central with big rooms and helpful staff. You're right in the Near North area which is full of good restaurants and bars. I recommend the nearby Mexican place, Frontera Grill. One issue though is the fire station next door. It didn't keep me awake but I can see how it would disturb some people. Reception give out free earplugs if you want them though! Breakfast was simple but decent enough, and free so even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: willmann
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a â€œlarge corner suiteâ€�. These suites a very spacious with a large bedroom with separate sink, large bathroom (with two entrances), living room area with a decent pullout coach, full kitchen and a dining area. We had ample of space for a family of four. Although the room was clean it showed signs of wear. Baseboard heater covers falling off, tiles and walls at foot level damaged, and a garbage disposal that was very out of balance and was loud as a jackhammer. The hotel was very nice and clean and has a friendly staff. The facilities are nice and the breakfast was decent. The location was great and centrally located. Considering Chicago hotel prices, for the price we paid it was a good value. Many reviews of this hotel mention the fire station noise. It is true, but the numbers of calls vary per night, and when they did leave the station they moved quickly and the siren noise faded fast. We did use earplugs and this did help. My heavy sleeping son slept on the couch next to the window nearest the fire station and he did not wake once. NOTE: All corner suites are located across from the fire station. Other categories of rooms have some locations on the opposite of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: movies3850
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better, more courteous, helpful staff. Were there for a week. Everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, fair price”
Reviews.Author: Insanefrog
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, pleasant staff, good rates, great location downtown...what else can you ask for other than reasonable parking rates, and everywhere downtown costs a bundle. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: bigosfan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We had great service from the valet parking and front desk. Room was clean and everything in order. Good breakfast in the AM. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good standards”
Reviews.Author: dfrozenshrimp
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hampton Inn is very convenient. Upon check in the staff were very friendly and helpful. The lobby was very nice and of a high quality standard. The hallway to the room did look a little dated but the room was very spacious, and decorated and furbished to a high standard for a city centre hotel. All of the staff we came into contact with were great and very hospitable. Great value, great staff, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on getting any sleep... Heaven help if you want to wash clothes!!!”
Reviews.Author: eemsdad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times, and I have to say that things are getting pretty bad. We dealt with maids not observing the "do not disturb sign" early in the morning, fire trucks blairing all hours of the night, and teenage kids in the hallways screaming and slamming doors. I'm not generally very picky when it comes to hotels. I want a clean room and sound sleep. You'll only get one of the two at this property. Also, the clothes washing situation is deplorable. There are two washers and two dryers for the whole hotel. They each require $1.50 to operate plus $1.50 for detergent. That's $4.50 per load of clothes... ALL IN QUARTERS!!! The front desk didn't have quarters, so I went to the bar -- no quarters. I walked down to the Seven11, Subway, another Seven11, and down two city blocks looking for quarters. It was absolutely ridiculous. It takes 18 quarters to do a load, and I had two loads to wash! The hotel staff couldn't have cared less. All this to say, I definitely would NOT stay in this hotel again. There are plenty of other options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be near Michigan Ave, a good choice”
Reviews.Author: blairb366
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hampton Inn in downtown Chicago with family and friends. This was mostly a shopping and dining trip, so the location was great. A few blocks from Michigan Ave and a lot of good dining choices in within 3-4 blocks. The hotel staff was efficient and pleasant at check in, check out and all requests in between. Our double bed room on the sixth floor was okay. The size of the room was average and it a refresh of the decorations would be nice, but it was clean. The beds were soft, maybe a little too soft, and a little small, but adequate. The 37" flat screen TV was a nice touch, although the remote was touchy. The bathroom was bright white and large. The fixtures and plumbing were again, a little dated, but functioned just fine. The room rate included a continental breakfast. As this was a weekend morning it was very busy and the staff had a hard time keeping up with the popular food choices, which were the eggs and sausage. Otherwise a good selection of hot and cold foods for this type of spread. Overall, the hotel is fine, in a good location if you need to be near Michigan Ave. The rate for the room was no great bargain. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Nice Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: FlyCat
Reviews.Content: Husband & I come to Chicago every Thanksgiving week. We've stayed numerous places throughout the years. And, the Hampton is a very nice hotel. It was a milestone birthday for me so I asked for a room - highest floor -- and we ended up w/ a large corner suite due to having HiltonHonor Cards. Had separate bedroom and full kitchen w/ a bar. Work area and sitting area. It was really spacious. Also Rm. 1230 looked out on the Trump Tower which is almost complete. Didn't use the onsite restaurant but it looked nice and reasonable. The Free Breakfast was efficiently handled. Robust Coffee was great! Location was perfect w/ lots of restaurants and shopping w/in a few blocks. We always hit Boston Blackies on Grand and Giordano's up on Rush St. Staff at the hotel were always pleasant. Room was ready when we got there and check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sutifeds
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in Chicago for Thanksgiving and stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites Downtown. We can't say enough good things about our visit there. The hotel staff was helpful and gracious, the decor was tasteful and soothing and the suite was spacious and immaculately clean. The location was convenient, close to the Miracle Mile as well as all forms of public transportation and restaurants. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel044
Reviews.Content: THE STAFF WAS VERY UNFRIENDLY. Room was supposed to be available at 3 p.m. but we could not get into ours until 5 p.m. AND it was not the room we reserved because our room supposedly had an odor that the previous traveler left behind from cooking something in the kitchenette! Gross. Also, found several hairs in the bathroom. How gross is that?! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone....not even my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “loved the stay”
Reviews.Author: oksushka19
Reviews.Content: It took a while to decide on the hotel in Chicago downtown. There's plenty to pick from. I've stayed at Hampton before, so I decided to give them another shot. I've checked their price on their website and a couple others, then I went on to a search engine and looked for discounts for Hampton. To my surprise i found several offers that were not mentioned on the hotel's site. The best offer was for the sports package. i didn't need a AAA membership or to be in the military and the price was less than anything else I could find. I used the code on the hotel's site and made the reservation. When I checked into my hotel 1 hour early i was very pleasantly surprised. But the biggest surprise was the suite. It was a 2 room suite with large windows, kitchen with a full size fridge and a stove. This exceeded any expectations. I had a great time visiting Chicago and since I was out late on Saturday night they allowed a late check-out on Sunday at 2pm. There was a mentioning of the fire station next to the hotel and i was offered free ear plugs, but did not need them. would stay at this hotel again for sure. the staff was very friendly and helpful. the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: des29
Reviews.Content: We just had a great time in chicago. We have been there several times and never stayed downtown. It was great. We got the blue man group package. It included two tickets to the show,a suite, transportation to and from and free valet. Hotel staff was plesant,room was exceptional,the show was good. Our driver was excellent as well.Also in this package we got dinner for there on site resturant Ballos. It was great italain food. would def reccomend this and do it again. We walked downtown no problems. there is a fire station next door and its loud but your downtown,expect it. We slept fine... Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: lswolf46
Reviews.Content: Great room - plenty of space, clean & comfy. Hotel staff was very friendly. Good location. Only drawback was the fire station across the street - a little noisy. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: Con8078
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel on 14th Aug - 18th Aug 2008. We were in room 1206 and we can honestly say that it was a nice hotel. We didn't hear any noise from a fire station which was close by. The staff were courteous and the breakfast adequate. We were hardly disturbed by any noise from the fire station. But hey what do you expect if you pick a hotel downtown. Michigan Avenue was within a couple of minutes walk, with Navy Pier only 20mins walk. A good central location to stay and if I returned to Chicago somewhere I would consider again.

Reviews.Title: “Sreet Noise Is A Problem”
Reviews.Author: mkatrack
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the other posters. The hotel is very nice, and the staff tries to be very accommodating, but one feature over which they have no control is the noise--not only from the fire station right across the street, but the general street noise. The latter may be a problem in many Chicago hotels that are adjacent to a major street, but it is certainly a problem here, accentuated by the fire station. We had to leave the hotel, and they were very pleasant and understanding of that. If this is ok for you, then a good point of their location is their proximity to Lou Malnoti, a Chicago icon for deep dish pizza--not just for tourists, but for locals. It is delicious, famous for their corn meal crust; located a short walk away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, beware of fire station”
Reviews.Author: Nospoilsjustvalue
Reviews.Content: We live in the suburbs of Chicago and decided to take a "family vacation weekend" in the city. As with most weekends anywhere, especially in Chicago, it can be hit or miss on finding a nice, last minute hotel room to accommodate a family. Fortunately, Hampton Suites had a suite available. We were pleasantly surprised with the suite and amenities - full kitchen, spacious enough to accomodate a family of 4, indoor pool, free continental breakfast and extremely clean. The staff were top-notch and professional. If you are looking for a hotel centralized in the Near North area of the city, the location is as good as any. Unfortunately, the BIG drawback that everyone needs to take into consideration is the hotel's proximity to the fire station. The station is literally 50 steps from the lobby of the hotel. Our kids are two of the soundest sleepers this side of the moon. They were both awakened at various times throughout the night. It should be noted that this fire station is one of the most active in the entire city of Chicago, which doesn't lend itself to quiet, uninterrupted sleep. Our best recommendation is to ask for a hotel room on the southeast portion of the hotel as the fire station sits across the street from the northwest corner of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the firehall!”
Reviews.Author: hilbill
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hampton Inn. The suite was very large and roomy. Location handy to everything. Staff were courteous and helpful. Continental breakfast the usual. The only con was that we were located across from a firehall. This was very annoying and I'm a sound sleeper! I asked to be moved to a room further away from the firehall but nothing was available. My experience leads me to not recommend this hotel unless you bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: LoveABeagle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from ten days traveling around the midwest and especially enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn and Suites - Downtown, Chicago. Compared to surrounding hotels, this hotel offered great value for the price. Some of the amenities included an indoor pool for the kids and indoor hot tub for adults with an adjoining outdoor deck on the hotel's second floor. There was a fitness room and business center, which we didn't use, but we did enjoy the free hot breakfast every day. The offerings changed from day to day, but included things like ham, sausage, eggs with cheese and ham, along with the usual cereal, hot cereal, bagels, toast, and warm biscuits (which my daughter loved!) Especially nice was the proximity to so much of downtown Chicago. We never took our car out of valet parking. (Incidentally, valet parking with in and out privileges at this hotel runs $38 a day; it's $25 without the in and out privileges. We opted for the higher price valet service, not realizing that we wouldn't need it.) We walked to Navy Pier (just a few blocks), Macy's (the old Marshall Fields), and even to Shedd Aquarium, although that was 2 - 3 miles away and we ended up riding the free trolleys back. We also walked to Gino's Pizza East (I highly recommend it if you have kids, but take a few extra dollars as it's pricey) and in heading this direction, discovered our hotel was also within just 3 or 4 blocks of the EL. Finally, we walked to Millenium Park (also a great place to take kids.) Wednesday evening, we discovered the hotel offered a free manager's reception with wine and hors d'oeuvres. Overall this was a great experience and we'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, and better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MarianaG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a find. Yes it is two star but it is more like a 3 star hotel. The beds are big and comfy. The hotel was quiet. There is a fridge in the room. The Bathrooms are big. Breakfast was included but can get crowded. We paid an internet rate of $134/night and had WIFI. We arrived at 5 am on a red eye, room was ready, and we even had a full breakfast before going to bed. The hotel is near the italian pizzerias (e,.g. Ginos) and hot dog places. There is a Nordstrom right across the street and a 7-11. Shopping is right there off the Magnificent Mile. You do need a taxi or transit to get to the museums (e.g. Chicago Art Museum). Lastly, washing machines on premise, what more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, too bad it's next to a firehouse”
Reviews.Author: Myradith
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate, nice little hotel in a good location in Chicago near the Magnificent Mile and the Loop. Its rooms are nice, even if they aren't fancy. Great blankets on the beds. The staff is very helpful, the pool and hot tub are nice, and the restaurants in the building are quite good as well. But it needs to be said that if you stay at this hotel you risk hearing sirens at all hours of the day due to the firehouse next door. We even requested a room change to the side of the building farthest from the firehouse (which the staff granted us as soon as they could), but we still heard sirens. I knew about the firehouse before I booked, thanks to this website. However, it didn't seem to bother most of the reviewers, and some people we talked to at the hotel also didn't seem bothered by it. After I got some earplugs it wasn't much of a problem for me either. But it's something to take into consideration. P.S. I am from New York City, so it's not like I'm not used to city noises.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: JMOOREEllsinore
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel around 4:30 P.M. parked in front of the hotel and was greated by the vallet crew. When I booked my room at the Hampton web site I pre purchased the vallet parking along with the room. I would strongley suggest this especialy if you are going to walk instead of drive in the city. The Cost for overnight parking is $38.00 per night. But what are you going to do? Checking in was quick and easy. The rooms were nice, we stayed pretty simple with a double queen. I heard nothing thru the walls the entire time I was there. Pool was very small and the Pool room would knock you down with chlorien smell. Breakfast was great, just about the best I have had at a hotel. The location of this hotel is good with a little walk to Michigan Ave. I stayed here with my wife and two children (4&7) and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mingymoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on June 5-8 2008. There is a review of my trip on the forum. I checked in around 3.45pm with no problems whatsoever. I noticed that there were free complimentary papers of the Wall Street Journal and USA Today to the left of the reception desk. I had room 1130. I opened the door and couldn't believe how big the suite was. The lounge was huge with a small but adequate kitchen with fridgefreezer, microwave, dishwasher and bar/table. The lounge had a sofa and a chair with footstool. The bed was fine as was the bathroom. The sink was outside of the bathroom and there was a wall hairdryer and toiletries. There was a tv in the lounge and in the bedroom. I received a note to say that the tv's were being replaced by 37" LCDs over the next few weeks. Breakfast was great with a varied selection. It was great to have strawberries, chopped pineapples and oranges. The scones were lovely as was the chocolate muffin. There was two items of hot food which consisted of mini-omelettes and one other item which I didn't know. The juices (cranberry, guava) and coffee/tea were fine. On the 2nd floor, there was the swimming pool and the business center with the free internet and superb consumable facilities such as fax, printer and stationary equipment. You need your room card to gain entry. The location of the hotel was great. Turning right out of the hotel, there is a 7-Eleven across the road (30 yards away). I stocked up on bottled water and the odd chocolate bar. Right on the 7-Eleven is the free trolley bus which takes people to Navy Pier. This was excellent and really convenient. On the way back, I waited about 20 minutes and the queue was long. To get to Michigan Avenue, I walked up Dearborn until I hit Ohio and then turned right. This was because I avoided any stairs going up or down and in fact, apart from Nordstrom and the shops there, there wasn't much there. The main stores are from Ohio to Water Place. In terms of eating, there are a lot of decent eateries nearby. I eat quite reasonably though not necessarily healthily! I went to Boston Blackies (164 East Grand Avenue, between Michigan and St Clair), Gino's East (633 N. Wells St. (Ontario and Wells) and Cafe Iberico (737 N La Salle Dr (Chicago and La Salle). All three places were busy and there was a good atmosphere. The food was fine and reasonably-priced. As I left the hotel on Sunday, I turned left and walked around the corner to N.Clark St. There were some people preparing a film. I asked some people there and it was a film about John Dilinger starring Johnny Depp and Christian Bale filming Public Enemies! There were going to be there on Monday. Initially, I was concerned about the distance between the River North and the Loop area but it was only about 15 minutes. I hardly caught any CTA trains and in fact, crossing the Chicago River was a great photo opportunity. I would definitely stay in the River North area compared to the Loop area mainly for the eateries and shopping. The free shuttle to Navy Pier was a bonus while shops like 7-Eleven and Walgreen nearby are always handy when staying in any U.S city.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABitSpoiled
Reviews.Content: The hotel suites are very large considering you are in downtown Chicago. Our king suite had a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave oven, and dishes. They provided free breakfast, and free coffee and tea 24 hours a day. The location is very convenient and a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. The rooms need a little remodeling, though, but are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay Here -- Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MimiTennessee
Reviews.Content: Throughout our many years of traveling, we always try to book our hotel reservations downtown in any city we plan to visit., and usually always a suite. We are just back from visiting the Amercian Girl Place in Chicago and this proved to be a great location and an easy walk to our destination. We booked a corner suite with an adjoining room. It was just perfect for the four adults and four children in our party. The rooms were spacious, very, very, clean and well kept, and had wonderful sleeping queen size beds with down comforters. The staff was so accommodating and met any request that we had promptly, and I might add, - with a smile. The personal Ambassador, Samra went out of her way with giving of her time with great suggestions on where to eat. I just can't say enough about her! I definitely plan on returning to that Hampton Inn when I return with friends for a planned Christmas trip in December. Thank you staff for a wonderful stay.! C. Gibson & L. Page Hendersonville, TN

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton Inn and Suites Downtown”
Reviews.Author: dcoughlin
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel; I have 3 boys ages 8-12 the suites were roomy and spacious to afford all five of us our comfort. The staff was pleasant and very accommodating. We stayed two nights and three days. We took the train in from Grand Rapids, MI so we arrived at 11:30 am and the room was not available, however, the bellhop checked our luggage and we went exploring. The first night I won a gift $50.00 certificate to Bellaâ€™s restaurant!! The locating was great; close the ESPN Zone and shopping. The Rock Bottom brewery was a great place for lunch- excellent food and not too pricey. We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it .... book a suite ..”
Reviews.Author: da_jm
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Chicago for six nights and I stressed over where to stay. I am so thrilled that we booked the Hampton Inn & Suites, Downtown, what an absolute gem! We booked a suite (there are about 5 on each floor) directly through the hampton site and got a variable rate (from a low of $101 for a night to a high of $150 for 3 nights) and the front desk clerk even commented on what a great deal I'd gotten! Our suite featured a living area with desk, TV, and queen size sleeper sofa (perfect for our two kids at night!) and also had a fullsize refrigerator (trader joe's is only a few blocks away on Ontario), dishwasher, microwave and cooktop (no oven). It was a breeze for snacks and leftovers and comes complete with plates & utensils! The best part was that this was a true "suite" room: the doors closed to the living area and it was like having two hotel rooms! Check-in was a smooth process; if you have a car, there is an area to pull in and unload your luggage with very attentive bellboys / valet attendees. (note, parking is an additional $38/night through the hotel, but there is also a lot right next door that "only" charges $25/night) The 2nd floor hosts the swimming pool/sauna/exercise room/whirlpool (plenty of towels available + water in the exercise area) as well as the breakfast room & there is also coffee/tea and hot cocoa available at all times. The breakfast room is very large, with plenty of seating (tables as well as couches) and the buffet itself featured two hot items daily (eggs, sausage, sausage gravy, etc.). There was also a nice selection of breads (bagels, toast, muffins, danish, biscuits), cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit (oranges, bananas, berries, apples, citrus fruit salad), oatmeal (in packets) as well as coffee,tea and juices. The employees re-freshed the foods constantly and even when there were a lot of people present, it was not difficult to get food/find a seat. There are also laundry machines available for guest use on the 3rd floor; two washers and dryers that cost $1.50/load (quarters available at the front desk). All in all, we loved our stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites, downtown. The location was perfect for all of our site-seeing needs: walking distance to the Mag Mile, the free trolley runs to Navy Pier right out front of the hotel, there are plenty of restaurant options within walking distance (weber grill, rock bottom brewery, gino's east, lou malnati's, rainforest cafe, hard rock, etc..!). A cab ride south to Shedd Aquarium/Field Museum will run you about $10 and was about the same up to Lincoln Park Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Family!”
Reviews.Author: benlotpt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our 4 year old and 7 year old at the Hampton Inn and Suites for two nights during Holy Week. I would highly recommend this hotel to families with young children who want to take advantage of a hotel with more reasonable rates. The staff was extremely pleasant on the phone. I called a few days before we arrived to ask about a roll-away bed for our youngest. I did not know one was available when I made the reservations. The first night was going to cost us $40 more than the second night, but the gentleman I talked to knocked off the $40 so both nights were at the lower rate. Needless to say I was glad I called back. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was great for us, and my only complaint about our entire stay was the eggs (or whatever they really were). They were awful! Otherise there was plenty to fill the kids up in the morning. The kids also liked the complimentary apples and cookies in the lobby. Our room was comfortable. We stayed in a room with two double beds and paid a little more for a roll-away so the kids could have separate beds. Our room, on the fourth floor, overlooked the pool area, and so the noise from the fire station was minimal. We also used a sound machine with the kids, so we did have a rather peaceful sleep. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room and bathroom were clean and sufficient for our needs. We bought two day M.T.A. passes at the Jewel 1 1/2 blocks north of the hotel on State. We used the bus stop on Illinois just east of State to get to Navy Pier. The free Navy Pier Trolley stops there too, but we did not use it since we had the passes. The red line stop is just one block north of the hotel on State/Grand. We used that to get to Shedd. Aquarium. You take the red line to Roosevelt and transfer to Bus #12. The hotel is in a great location for getting around via public transportation. We did not use valet parking but saved a little money by parking at the public parking lot just east of the hotel. It cost $25/night but make sure you have cash to pay the attendant. There are plenty of restaurants within a short walk of the hotel. We walked to the McDonalds and also to the Rainforest Cafe a few blocks north of the hotel on Ohio. We did not take advantage of the two restaurants mentioned on the hotel website. Lastly, the kids enjoyed the pool. We only went there on Saturday morning, but we pretty much had the pool and whirlpool to ourselves. I am sure that it is much busier in the evening. The shallow end is 3 feet so our 7 year old could touch bottom. The pool is not very large but the kids enjoyed it. There were plenty of clean, dry towels to use.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: DglGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Chicago Downtown for 7 nights in November. As there were four girls sharing we booked a suite which was perfect. There was a kitchenette, dining table and chairs and couch and tv area. This was a great space and we had plenty of room for four large cases. The bedroom had two doubles, tv, and a small vanity area with an adjoining en-suite bathroom. We got a very reasonable price for our week long stay and the accommodation very much exceeded our expectations for this price. The breakfast in the morning was plentyful and the staff very friendly and helpful. We had a small problem in our room and telephoned reception to report this and let them know we would be out for the day and if it could be sorted before our return. They were up to fix the problem before we got into the lift. From the hotel we walked everywhere and its in the perfect location for sightseeing and shopping - just a few blocks from mag mile. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Chicago and prices are very reasonable. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful and the doorman who organised an airport transfer for us back to O'Hare was a gentleman.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: mom4marley
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early on Thursday, 2/24, but the front desk still tried to check to see if our room was available for us. When it was not ready yet (it was only 10AM!), they stored our luggage for us and we were able to explore the city for the day. Our luggage was promptly brought up to our suite when we came back, and Willy, the bellman, was a great help to us during our stay. He always said "Welcome back" when we'd return from an outing - nice guy. The suite was great! Super clean, convienent and spacious. Some people had complained about the noise earlier, but what do you expect from a city? Quite frankly, it lulled us to sleep! Hotel is at a great location for everything, has a really good breakfast included and we didn't run into ONE staff member who wasn't polite and welcoming. I'd definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Loved every minuite”
Reviews.Author: keith_wright
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 great nights at this hotel. My wife is in a wheel chair and the room was fully accessible, the bath is even wider in the middle so you can turn round in the shower. All the staff were very friendly and the doors were always opened for us before we got there, even when it was snowing like mad - Thanks everyone. You must visit the Rock Bottom Brewery just around the corner - the burgers are great and huge, the main courses are elegant and sophisticated and the carrot cake is big enough to use as a building brick - but a lot tastier!! BUT the main attraction is the great beers available all local brews and tasting great. Again would recommend this hotel to everyone, they were still filling up the breakfast racks with 5 minutes to go (Finish -10 am weekdays, 11 am weekends), and fresh coffee is always available in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Perfect for Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: kaiverson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton the last weekend of January. We were only there for one night, but we wish it could've been longer. The moment we checked in, hotel staff was willing to find us the best room for our needs. We requested a room as far away from the fire station as possible since we had a 7 month old baby with us. We got just what we asked for. Our room was exactly as it was pictured on the websites. It was up to date with mission style furniture and 1920s style stained glass light fixtures. Nothing looked worn or dirty. The carpet was in great condition. You notice these things when you have a baby playing on the floor a lot. All the furniture was substantial and comfortable. The king bed looked inviting with a cozy duvet and crisp comfortable pillows. The bathroom was not particularly modern or special in any way, but it was clean and practical. We were surprised at how roomy the entire suite was. It was bigger than we expected with a spacious living area, kitchen with full-size appliances and lots of extra room in the bedroom. There was plenty of room for our family of 4 including a 6 yr old and infant. During our stay we especially loved the following things: The most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on--really, it was absolutely wonderful. A quality fold-out bed for kids in the living room. A decent hot breakfast with a little something for everyone. Free internet in the room, but if you don't bring your laptop, free use of the hotel computer room (with internet, printers, faxes, etc). Nice pool and work-out room. Very friendly staff. Great location to all that downtown Chicago has to offer...all within walking distance. Lastly, we loved the sense of calm and quiet you get when you step into the hotel after being on the bustling city streets. Some hotels are as busy and crowded inside as the city is outside. But every time we stepped into the Hampton, it felt like a quiet, relaxed respite from all that was happening outside. It was warm and comfortable. We will definitely stay there again. With the AAA rate, we stayed for less than $150 a night with all taxes included. Parking is $30 for the day or $38 for valet (well worth it). Downtown Chicago hotels do not have to cost a lot. This hotel had everything we needed and plenty of what we wanted in luxury and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown living”
Reviews.Author: 52_Weeks_A_Year
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my room during my week stay at the hotel... I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. I am in a corner room suite which is huge. The "suites" include a full kitchen, living room, dining table and separate bedroom with vanity and king bed. The room has nice decor and they have done a good job bringing it up to date. I am on the 10th floor (I think there are 12) and you hear the typical horns and trucks from the streets below, which is not too uncommon at downtown locations. I think some other hotels may do a better job of soundproofing the windows. Given this hotel is fairly old, the windows may allow for additional "ambiance" to creep in. The location is nice and close to some very good restaurants and a brisk (It's 12 degrees outside currently) walk to the theatre district a few long blocks away. One thing you will not see in the brochure is that there is a 5 bay fire station directly across the street on one side of the hotel. As soon as the vehicles head out of the station, they hit the horns and sirens. The room I am in is directly across form the station. It might be a little quieter on the opposite side of the hotel. I am a light sleeper, so I hear them every time (3-4 times per night), but it really hasn't deterred from the nice stay I am having.

Reviews.Title: “overnight getaway”
Reviews.Author: eab1313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Chicago for an overnight trip and stayed at Hampton Inn and went to a Second City show. Both were beyond our expectations. The staff at both places were courteous, professional, friendly and went beyond the call of duty to give us directions, hold our bags in storage while we went shopping, gave us great seats at the show and also, since we had to alter our original plans due to a blizzard, both companies were gracious in changing our reservations to accomodate our change of dates without a penalty! Can't say enough good things. The Hampton Inn was off of Michigan AVe about 4 blocks but had plenty of shopping between the blocks. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: saledMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: There were six members of our family & we had 3 rooms. The service was outstanding, the breakfast was delicious, the rooms were clean & very comfortable. The location was walkable to the theatres & shopping. Didn't have time to enjoy the pool & other amenities, but they looked very inviting. Would definitely recommend it to anyone. It deserves at least 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in a great location, for a great price”
Reviews.Author: donut44
Reviews.Content: I can only add to the great reviews already given on the site. I trashed the Best Western around the corner and it rightly deserves it. On the flip side, even with all the positive reviews, I feel compelled to give my two thumbs up as well. If you travel Hamptons already, this one is great too! I love them because there is are no surprises and this one is no different. It looks the same on the inside of the rooms, with the great mattress, the wireless internet, a good sized bathroom and a desk to work at. The price was 150/a night and that was a regular internet deal, nothing special. Breakfast was the typical Hampton meal with no surprises again. What really makes this special is that it is the typical Hampton, PLUS being in the heart of Chicago. Great restaurants all around, night spots and things to do. The hotel has like 13 floors. They even addressed me by name when I come through the front door (stayed for 3 nights). In addition, the hotel had what nice hotels downtown should have, just without the inflated price. There is a little sundry room by the reception, a pool, a workout area, and a velet and bell stand. I have stayed here twice now and it is excellent. There is no reason you should compromise comfort, location and price especially when you can get the best of all these right here. This last time I did stay in a room with my window right above the fire station. It was quite a surprise and it seems that at 6 in the morning, they start running like every 15 minutes. I knew the station was there, but didn't even think of the noise (I did in the morning though, lol). Easy fix, I just turned the AC up to high and it was all good. Downtowns are typically noisy anywhere, so this was not that big a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: brilynn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Hotel from 5th December to the 9th of December and found the Hotel to be of excellent standard. We booked a corner suite and it was hugh, well worth $199.00 dollars a night. It was spotless clean and the beds were very comfy. We did hear the fire engines at night but did not cause us any inconvenience at all. The added bonus of complimentary breakfast was great. A good selection of breads, fruit, cereals etc. The staff were very friendly and efficent and informative. The location is great only 10 minutes from shoppers Paradise of Michigan avenue. Overall a great stay in the Hamptons and would have no problem recommending this to friends and family alike. Linda N. (Dublin Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: M-P7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter recently visited Chicago on a shopping trip. We were a bit hesitant about staying in this hotel after reading some of the unfavorable reviews but this hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff were so friendly and helped us in any way possible. Our suite was absolutely fabulous, very spacious, immaculate and the beds were so comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate with both hot and cold choices. The waitresses were on hand to help with anything we needed including directions to shopping areas. Our sleep was not disrupted by the noise from the fire station on the next block. The hotel was located just a minute's walk from Grand underground station on the Red Line and it was only a short commute to the shopping areas. We would definetly recommend anyone to stay in this hotel and we will certainly be returning to stay at the Hampton Inn and Suites in the future. An excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PoppycatKent
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at this hotel on a recent shopping trip to Chicago, The staff and facilities were fanatstic. including the breakfasts! I would recommend this to any traveller staying in Chicago, the only downside was Ruths Steak house restaurant attached to the hotel, the service was poor and we asked for a non smoking table only to be sat right next to the smoking area, we didnt stay for the food! Ballo also attached to the hotel however was an excellent restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cargycroy
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews we had some concerns regarding the fire horns but having stayed for 5 nights our fears were unfounded. Yes we did hear the odd horn but we have experienced that in any city centre hotel we stayed in. The hotel was clean, the staff courteous and efficient and whilst the breakfast was not the best we have ever had it was fine taking into consideration the rates. We would however have preferred proper plates and cutlery. The location could not have been better - just round the corner from Grand subway station (Red line) and 10 minutes from Michegan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACLMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a lovely corner suite for under $170 a night. There was a kitchen, living area, separate bedroom and bathroom. The beds were super comfortable, the staff very courteous, and helpful. Even without the breakfast that is included, you couldn't get a better deal in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay visiting Chicago with a family. The breakfast is nice and the rooms were clean. Great location to utilize the public transportation to see the city. The staff was very friendly. The attached Italian restaurant Ballo was very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hell of a Toddling, Windy, Big Shouldered Town... by the Lake”
Reviews.Author: Cap'n_Crunchy
Reviews.Content: After spending a night in less than acceptable accommodations out in the suburbs, my wife (who is also my business partner) and I chose to move to cooler digs. The Hampton Inn offered us a room at pretty much the going rate for a place in town, about $260-something. We are not from Chicago, nor have we ever been before, so I canâ€™t speak to the value of the actual street address, however, we did find our way around town pretty easily (all credit to the dynamic trio of Google maps, a Treo and my navagatrix wife). The hotel was typical of the properties one finds in a world-class city. The staff, much like virtually every human being we encountered in Chicago, was delightful. The parking at the hotel, again like most other properties, was steep; $38.00 a night! But there is a lot right next door for $20 and one a across the street for $25. In and out privileges are okay at the independent lots, so donâ€™t worry about that. The rooms at the Hampton were, again, right on par for the type of property they represent; handsomely furnished, modestly sized and nicely equipped with toiletries and little extras (a bottle of water and some cookies). Thereâ€™s an Italian restaurant downstairs and a sky bridge connecting to a Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse. The property offers a â€œhot breakfastâ€� which, sadly, leaves much to be desired, like perhaps a good breakfast. The coffee was nice (and is always available) but the selection of breads lacked any whole grains, the chafing dish of eggs tasted like a science experiment gone wrong and the orange juice formula used to be restricted to astronauts. Breakfast is not the best feature of this hotel! The city itself is just terrific! We enjoyed a pair of blues bands at the packed, raucous (but cool-vibed) â€œKingston Armsâ€� blues bar the night we arrived and the next day made the most of our late flight and rented car by touring the whole city. This included a slice of authentic deep-dish pizza (Iâ€™m a New Yorker, so Iâ€™m a tough sell on pizza, but this a local tradition and it should at least be experienced) and a trip up the Sears Tower. I used to work at the top of the World Trade Center, so I was probably less thrilled than most, but it is quite a view! One thing to keep front of mind is the traffic! I live in Los Angeles and even I was freaked out by it. Give yourself an extra hour at least to get to the airport. We didnâ€™t but thanks to a flight delay still made it to our seatsâ€¦ or else we absolutely would not have.

Reviews.Title: “very good place”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: Chose this Hampton Inn on the basis of tripadvisor reviews and it was an excellent choice. When we first arrived, I was a bit disappointed, as the area seemed a bit iffy and the reception was gloomy. But that`s the end of the negative bits..... The location is great - loads of good restaurants within easy walking distance (would recommend Weber Grill and Rockbottom). There are even two restaurants on the premises which we promised ourselves we`d try when it rained - of course, it never rained! We had a king suite with a huge bed, lounge with sofabed, kitchenette with large fridge, microwave, hotplates, dishwasher etc etc. (usual tiny american bathroom - but we`re used to those!) Also - I couldn`t praise the staff highly enough. Nothing was too much trouble. The front desk guys suggested restaurants, changed travellers cheques and allowed us an extra hour on check out day (prior to us flying back to the UK) all with cheery smiles. AND - the gals running the complimentary breakfast spoiled my husband rotten. He only had to say, "no sausages this morning then?" for one of them to disappear and then come back a minute later with a plate of sausages, biscuits and country gravy! There was also a good indoor pool, spa and gym area which was generally empty (although we were there midweek) We hadn`t used Hampton before, but wouldn`t hesitate to use them in future. Oh - and yes, you can hear the fire sirens, but I reckon you can hear those anywhere in downtown Chicago. The architecture river cruise was excellent too. Great city!

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: syh75287
Reviews.Content: stayed overnight for a next day meeting. it's located in the middle of downtown and just a quick walk from the red line subway. i've never stayed at a hampton inn but thought it was quite decent. it's not a 4 star hotel or anything, but it was nice enough. i got a room w/ 2 double beds, and the room provides a computer lap desk so i could work on my laptop in bed. they have free internet which is a big plus for me. i did notice that the walls were thin as you can hear people in the hallway or the doors slamming, and the sirens from the street coming from the window. They have an automated wake up call which was prompt and on-time. they called to check if the room was okay after settling in for 5-10 mins. the bathroom was clean, nothing too fancy. there is a chinese restaurant that is zagat rated on the corner called Ben Pao. their black pepper shrimp was excellent, but not so much for the mongolian beef (i've had better). there was a line for ordering take-out, but you can also order to-go online on their website. it seemed to be a somewhat fancy restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: JohnCurle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Chicago for four days in September 2007. We stayed at the Hampton and the hotel was great. It's in a good location .. walkable to Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile shopping area. We have stayed at several Hampton Inns and this one was up to their usual standard. The room was nice, the bed comfortable and the breakfast good. Ideal. We did The Untouchables tour, which was very good and visited the Field Museum, which we really enjoyed. Chicago is a wonderful city and when we go back we'll definitely be staying at the Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherylAS
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel for a one night stay to see the Oprah show. I love Hampton Inns but the $275 price for 4 adults in one room surprised me. Maybe this is a normal rate for Chicago but this was the most expensive Hampton Inn I've stayed at, and yet the most dated. The breakfast was good as usual and the hotel is well-located near the Mag Mile. The elevators are ridiculously slow! However, the room was reasonably clean and the staff very friendly. It seems like a lot of Oprah audience members stay at this hotel. The restaurant downstairs, Bollo, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: bhoffa24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Friday night, the rooms were nice and the hotel staff was very friendly. It is also in a great location within walking distance to plenty of night life options. The only real disappointment was the breakfast that was included, unless you have a thing for cardboard waffles and bad sausage. There really wasn't much to it other then some cereal and some rolls. I know it's free but from the way the bellhop was talking it up I was expecting a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: mwood19
Reviews.Content: Rented a two bed suite for a girls weekend. The room was nice and hotel staff was very helpful - brought in rollaway, provided a complimentary key to the business center, allowed late check-out, complimentary breakfast bar was extensive if not a meal that you might pay for, and staff was friendly. Overall, they left a very good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jlc470
Reviews.Content: We had a very positive experience, thanks to attentive and helpful staff. We rather complicated needs for several rooms, which were fulfilled. The rooms were attractive and clean. Breakfast was a definite plus. The front desk staff provided suggestions and guidance throughout our 4-day stay. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service but rooms vary”
Reviews.Author: CouleeCat
Reviews.Content: Reading the past reviews, it appears people either love this hotel or hate it. If they are basing it on the rooms themselves, I can see why. When we checked into our assigned room on the 11th floor it was very nice, clean and well maintained. The only problem was that it had 2 double beds and I preferred a king. I called the front desk and they did have a king room, but it was on the 3rd floor. We chose to take it even though it was a lower floor and unbeknownest to us, directly across from the fire station. This room was in bad disrepair. The wood at the bottom of the bathroom door was rotted through and the carpets and floors were very dirty. The noise didn't seem to bother us much as the windows and blackout curtains kept out much of the sound. As usual the bed was divine, nice breakfast (not so nice woman working the breakfast though), and the location was perfect for walking. A can't say enough wonderful things about the front staff, valet and concierge they all went above and beyond to provide exceptional service. My advise when booking a room hear is to request an upper floor facing Illinois Ave. and to check it out before getting settled.

Reviews.Title: “good location, well managed, great value”
Reviews.Author: photomomHouston
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor steered us well when we selected this hotel. It is well-located, clean, attractive (even has faux-Prairie style decor!), has extended breakfast hours. Proximity to fire station takes some getting used to but hey, those sirens aren't for you! Definitlely take advantage of the Navy Pier free trolley. We got the AARP rate which was less than $200. Being a member of the Hilton frequent-stay program got us an upgrade. Terrific value for the location and quality of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: DonNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Chicago, and were very glad we choose the Hampton Inn! The Front Staff was courteous and very helpful (I had forgotten my public transportation directions to the Brookfield Zoo, and they got on the computer to help me out, etc.) The room was clean, spotlessly clean. Spacious! Bathroom clean, plenty of towels, etc. You can't beat the location, for sure! As for the much discussed fire house next door, every now and again you do hear the sirens, but since we're from NYC, we're used to that. I would think that any hotel you stay in downtown, you would hear sirens going off. If that might trouble you, ask for a room away from the fire department. Breakfast room is large and there is plenty to offer. We are single, but clearly families rule at the Hampton. They also cater to groups - we had the gang from Cincy and then St. Louis (wearing their colors) who came in to see their teams vs. the Cubs! Very positive experience and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Dub111
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Very central with plenty of good restaurants within a block or two. Hotel has very spacious suites with full size fridge freezer and dishwasher. The breakfast is great and plentiful and the staff can't seem to do enough for guests. The pool is a good size and there was hardly anyone else there everytime I went with my 9 and 6 year olds who loved it. There was also a business centre with continuous internet access for anyone not wanting to haul a laptop around with them on holiday. The free trolley car to Navy Pier is handy but save yourself the wait and take a cab - it's only 5 or 6 bucks. All in all the perfect place for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: fellfromgrace
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week over my 20th birthday and aside from checking in I had no problems. Apparently chicago has this "you must be 21 to play" rule that no one told me about. I booked my room here because the website said nothing about 21 minium check in age like almost ever other chicago area hotel I looked at. Sure enough when I got to the hotel there was a problem. Long story short the woman had to get my father on the phone and fax a signed letter giving me permission to stay there. Umm okay, strange, but I was in no position to argue. She was nice enough I guess, but that rule still made no sense to me. The location is wonderful, a block away from the el and and across the street from the trolly that goes to navy pier. I probably wouldn't stay here again, I was in chicago a few months ago and discovered The James and refuse to stay anywhere else in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rehinger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 9 and 7 year old. It was a convenient place to the sites of Chicago. The continental breakfast was really great. The pool was generally very loud but OK for a dip. Location was good and the staff was very helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hampton inns ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: honeybees28
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I was greeted by a very rude and impatient manager who had no idea how to treat customers with respect. Got to the room and was greeted with a big whiff of aged smoke, even though we picked a non smoking room. Really disgusting. It was probably the most OUTDATED hampton inn I've ever seen. They had old wood cabinets in the bathroom, a very outdated sink counter/flooring/bathtub/toilet. The wallpaper wasn't pleasant and showed its age. The room floor was dirty and I always made a point to have shoes on when walking around. This hotel needs a complete renovation and really fast. I found it absolutely insane the prices they charged to stay in such a run down place. My bill came to over 300 dollars for a weekday rate for one night/ king bedroom. BEWARE. They sneak charges onto your bill.. there is a 30 dollar hotel occupancy tax (whatever THAT is)... along with other charges. When I called to confirm my room, the rate was 219.. on my bill the rate was 229... along with the rest of the charges totaling over $300. (?!).... There is an emergency station very nearby. There were sirens going off at almost every hour of the night. I remember 4:30AM the most because I never got back to sleep after that. It takes valet 20 minutes to get your car. Why? Breakfast was subpar at best. I had some oatmeal and a biscuit. There was no fresh fruit other than some dented apples. The only pro is the closeness to the mag mile, but there are SO many other options for people wanting to be close to shopping. This hotel was absurdly a ripoff and you felt dirtier after having stayed there. Thank heavens for Hiltons 100% guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place, Perfect Price”
Reviews.Author: Hatter_Calc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hampton Inn in downtown Chicago and could not have been happier about the amenities, service and convenience of the hotel. All of this for a very reasonable price. We arrived at noon but the hotel was able to recommend a great place for lunch and have us in our two rooms by 1:00 pm. The bell captain gave us great service and directions during our stay. The pool, exercise room, business suite (with four computers and printer), and breakfast were all free and great to use. The rooms (a suite and a normal room) were big and clean. We could not have asked for a better place to stay in Chicago with many restaurants nearby, Transportation was always less than 3 blocks away. We had a wonderful stay and would stay there again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied”
Reviews.Author: momsrule
Reviews.Content: Once again, a great Hampton Inn experience, we were only in Chicago overnight and this is a great location. We were aware that the firehouse was nearby, so we asked for (and got) a room as far away from the firehouse as possible, and the noise was not a problem. We stayed in a mini suite where the king bed was in a different room from the sleeper sofa, so we grownups got a little privacy from the teenagers. We asked for a sleeper sofa and got it within just a few minutes. The hotel is a straight shot, maybe a 20 minute walk, from the Navy pier, and there are a ton of cabs if you need to go elsewhere. We also went to the original Pizza Uno which was just a few minutes away. There was some construction going on in the parking garage, so we were able to get a refund on the 10.00 parking fee (these fees are annoying, but most inner city hotels have them!!). The room was clean and the bed was awesome. We were very happy with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: writespeak
Reviews.Content: Before we chose the Hampton, we read the reviews here, and we found them to be accurate. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The amenities and location were excellent. I especially liked having an in-suite kitchen. It was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. Our main concern was its location across from a fire hall. We heard the sirens frequently, but although our suite was right across from the fire hall, they didn't wake us up at night. Being on the 9th floor might have helped. The start of the free trolley route to Navy Pier is about half a block from the hotel. The signs say that it runs every 15 minutes, but it's more like every half hour, if that. We waited twice for 25+ minutes and ended up taking a cab. But that isn't the hotel's fault. The breakfasts were good. We didn't have time to use the swimming pool, but we checked it out, and it was tempting, especially the whirlpool after a day of being on our feet. The one drawback was that the wireless Internet access worked only for the computer we brought and not for the laptop. They didn't have a tech person on site and weren't able to help us with that. They have computers for use in their business center at no charge, but most of what I needed was on the laptop. The laptop was able to pick up a wireless signal at the conference we were attending, so it didn't appear to be the problem. Unfortunately, reliable Internet access is a common problem at hotels we've stayed at. We plan on returning to the Hampton when we're in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travelers Beware”
Reviews.Author: mtntrvlr
Reviews.Content: Business travelers should avoid this hotel. The front desk service was horrible. I stood at the desk for 20 minutes before they were able to give me a room and this was after 6 pm. The hotel was full of families, so maybe this property is better suited for families. The halls were very noisy all night. The room wasn't the cleanest: the floor was dirty, the wall paper was pealing, and the room smelled of smoke (even though it was a non-smoking room). If you are traveling for business, find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: sungodes
Reviews.Content: Recently we visited Chicago and stayed at the Hampton Inn. We had a corner suite which was perfect for us. The staff friendly and accommodating and ready at a moments notice to help. The location was very convenient - right on the blue trolley line to Navy Pier and within walking distance of Michigan Avenue, the Magnificent Mile, theaters and good restaurants. Great stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelus73
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn and Suites in downtown Chicago is truly an outstanding hotel for many reasons. First the room is very clean the bed is comfortable. Second the staff is very helpful and very professional. Third the location is very good. What separates this hotel are the little things. The hotel has a spa, pool, sauna, and fitness center. In the pool area, there are ample towels so you don't have to go to the front desk to get them. In addition there are many water bottles in the fitness room saving time and money after a workout. In addition there is an excellent breakfast including breads, hot and cold cereal, fruit, hot choices which change daily, teas, and juices. Today the hot choices were sausages and French toast which I didn't like. I mentioned this to the staff and they offered to make me eggs and waffles which were great. They just find every way to go out of their way for you at this hotel. There is also a computer room with 4 terminals in case you want to connect to the internet. There is a printer as well. I would stay here again and again and recommend this for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls trip”
Reviews.Author: vfsnowbird
Reviews.Content: Recently we visited Chicago and stayed at the Hampton Inn. We couldn't have had a more delightful trip. The location was central to most activities. . shopping, tours & restaurants. The staff was attentive from the moment we stepped out of the cab to Sonya in the breakfast room. Chicago you are our kind of place!!! We loved the Millineium Park, Art Institute, Cultural center, Hancock Building, Field museum, etc. The flowers were beautiful and on every street, corner, windowbox, and even the river! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: amofam
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend for families. We stayed with our 2 girls, aged 11 and 6 and location was great for us. Is in walking distance of the theaters (saw Wicked, perfect for both girls) and walked there, got lost on way back but that is purely my fault, same thing with Am Girl. Anyone with a nominal sense of direction would be fine. Is close to many restaurants, - Frontera, Harry Caray, Rainforest , Uno's to name a few. We also hopped the free trolley, just down the street, that goes to Navy Pier. The pool area was clean with non slip mats surrounding it and a nice sun deck outside. The service was efficient and friendly, the free breakfast a big money saver, and the beds very comfy. We heard the fire trucks but didn't wake us up ever. We took a cab to catch the orange line to Midway and had a little trouble figuring that out as the cab dropped us on the corner so it took a little longer than planned but worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maverickmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in mid June 2007. The hotel was in a great location. We did hear the sirens from the next door fire station a few nights but it was tolerable. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The kitchenette was a bit tired-the cabinets were banged up. The breakfast buffet was OK. One day it was good but the other three days it was mediocre and on the weekend it was PACKED with people. But for the price this hotel was a fabulous deal in downtown Chicago and a great place to stay with kids. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay June 17-21st, 2007”
Reviews.Author: dgw9
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites at 33 West Illinois from June 17th to the 21st. We stayed in room 419, a corner suite overlooking both Illinois and Dearborn Streets. It was close to the elevators, but that didn't bother us. The hallways were very quiet at night--no wild partying going on. Our check-in was fast and error-free. The room had a bedroom with two full beds. In the living room there is a fold-out couch/bed, which was miserable and fit only for children. There is enough space in either room for a fold-out cot which were 10 dollars a night. The hotel is convenient to the free trolleys and to the buslines and many of the interesting restaurants (Ed Debevics, Gino's East, House of Blues, Harry Caray's etc). Yes, there is a fire station at Dearborn and Ilinois, but I don't think there would be any hotel around that wouldn't hear their runs. They have three ambulances and three fire apparatus, and they do go on a lot of runs. You can also go to the station and buy Chicago Fire Department t-shirts from one of the guys--just ask one of the guys sitting around outside. Nice shirts/reasonable price. Everybody wanted one. I was very impressed by the employees all the way around--they were polite and courteous and were always handing out cold water bottles! The room was clean and new enough. The beds and bedding were clean and in good condition. The bathroom lacks a powerful ceiling fan. The kitchen area was clean and it was so nice to have a fridge to keep our food in! The pool/jacuzzi/sundeck was clean and fairly underutilized while we were there. We never saw more than 8 other people anywhere around. The breakfasts were good--a different main course every day, from scrambled eggs to french toast sticks to biscuits and gravy. Add in the daily bagels, toast, fruit and juices and you easily had a meal for the family. If you have trouble getting a wireless signal on your laptop, the front desk will loan you a LAN gig, which you plug into your computer. It worked for us, although we had to keep the LAN antennas higher than the desk (on top of a lamp) to get a reliable signal. In summary, we had a very good experience at the Hampton Inn Suites. Besides that foldout couch, I can't think of a bad thing to say about the Hampton Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaninSoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 33 Illinois Avenue Hampton Suites from May 24 through May 29, 2007. What a great experience! The bed was large, clean, and comfy, with a beautiful white duvet and fluffy pillows. The room was large, had a reading chair with ottoman, a desk/desk chair, cable tv, in-room movies, free wireless internet, and a bar/counter with a built-in refrigerator, microwave, and bar sink. The bathroom had shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, and moisturizer, along with fluffy towels. The breakfast buffet, hands down, was the best I ever had in a hotel. Every day there were 2 or more hot items (varying between eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy, and french toast), along with donuts, muffins, bagels, english muffins, jams, butter/margarine, peanut butter, and honey. There were also 3 different coffees, hot chocolate mix, milk, and 4 juices. Then there was the fresh fruit, and a ton of fresh bananas (and always fresh whole apples available in the lobby). Then there was a big choice of cold cereals, packets of oatmeal and grits, and yogurt. It was just amazing - with a staff that was friendly and just kept bringing stuff out. The staff at the front desk was informative, friendly, and helpful. They were willing to help with directions, getting cabs, storing our luggage after checkout but before we had to leave for the airport, etc. All in all, at a rate of under $200 (when the surrounding properties were well over that), we felt very lucky with the location (close to the El and the free trolley to the Navy Pier and points in between), the staff, the accommodations, the cleanliness, and the breakfast. It was a marvelous stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Sherrikt
Reviews.Content: I am at the Hampton for Memorial Day weekend. We have a corner suite on the 7th floor. the beds are super comfortable. We did hear a lot of sirens, but we got used to it after the 1st night. the breakfast is ok, not great but worked very well for us. We got a tray and took the food to our suite. The suite was awesome, my girls--11 year old twins said it was the nicest room they ever had and they've stayed in a lot of hotels. We have a big living area, with a dining area, kitchen and a separate bedroom. The corner suite has windows on two sides--lots of windows all the way across the wall. The pool and hot tub are nice, we've used them every night. I asked the maid for extra towels, and they were there today. I left a tip on the coffee maker and it's still there after maid service. We'll have to leave it when we check out. I really can't say enough good things about this hotel, great service from the staff--they are all very friendly and helpful. We came here to see the Mag Mile and museums and spend the day at American Girl Place and so far we have had a wonderful stay. We paid $199 a night for a corner suite 3 blocks off Michigan Ave, a great deal at a wonderful hotel. We have stayed at several Hampton's and will continue to do so. A really nice hote for the price. Highly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drew69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in with a choice of 4 pillows. Service was excellent - check in took less than 2 minutes. XL bed and large room. Complimentry buffet breakfast and free internet access are thrown in aswell. I would stay here again if I returned to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “April 2-6 stay”
Reviews.Author: starmanWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Would have given them a 5 star rating but for the Chicago fire department. Not sure if any part of the hotel can escape the early morning sirens. Any room facing Illinois St. will definitely hear the noise (like being in a canyon). Maybe someone else can comment on rooms that don't face Illinois St. Otherwise our room was very comfortable, and pretty big. The bed made it hard to get up in the morning. The breakfast was better than continental, but not as good as some suite hotels that provide an on site chef. You do get some hot items, (eggs one day, waffles and sausage another). Otherwise, normal cold items like cereal, bagels, fresh fruit. Our cost, for downtown Chicago, was pretty good, $161 plus taxes per night. Public transportation was very convenient. Subway, 1 block. Busses 1 block. If you're visiting, try to leave the car at home and buy a CTA visitors pass. We paid for it within the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Near firefighters...”
Reviews.Author: VivaLaPlaya!
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hampton Inn, downtown Chicago, from march 25 to 31, 2007. Generally, we liked our stay. Although the hotel was clean, well located, with very comfortable rooms (the beds are awsome!) and good service, it has a few bad sides worth mentionning. First: the presence, just across the street, of a firefighter station. And let me tell you there are lots of fires in Chicago and that sirens and lights are the rule to get there. Second, the breakfasts. The concept is very convenient, the food is fresh, but unless a bad coffee and some doughnuts is a breakfast to you, you might be a little disappointed. In conclusion: not a bad choice, but bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: beft
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, but it is clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated. The price is AMAZING for what you get! We chose this hotel to stay in over the holidays because we wanted a "living room" where the kids could hang their stockings, we could open Christmas gifts, etc. We found the hotel to be perfect for our needs. The location is fantastic - close to lots of great activities and sightseeing. The complimentary breakfast was nothing special, but it was fine for two young children. We found the staff to be helpful and pleasant. If we need hotel accommodations on our next trip to Chicago, we will definitely stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: gmhaggis
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights here for an long weekend city vacation. Aside from a few minor points, great place to stay. Checkin was quick and front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Room was a large twin double and was clean and in good condition. If you travel with your laptop then you'll find the complimentary wireless internet a boon. On several mornings I found the speed to be either extremely slow or non-existent. This could be because early morning is a peak usage time. Other times it was hi-speed as advertised. The free breakfast was so so, with plenty of buns and pastries if that's your thing. Complementary coffee was also available throughout the day from the breakfast room. Note that this appears to be a popular hotel with families, so if your staying over the weekend then get to breakfast early as the room gets rather full. Location wise this hotel is great, being only a few blocks from downtown attractions and the nearest subway station. Good selection of restaurants also within a few minutes walking distance. One word of caution. On the street corner opposite is the fire department. If you're a light sleeper then you may find the frequent fire engine sirens a problem. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kferg99
Reviews.Content: We traveled over the holidays to see Chicago at Christmas - with kids. This hotel was great for a family. Probably not enough upscale atmosphere or pampering for a truly romantic visit without kids, but with the kids in tow it was perfect. We had a very clean, large, comfortable suite with a full kitchen. The staff was very helpful and nice. The location was great. We walked all over town. The pool area was nice and clean. I would recommend this property for travelers seeking an inexpensive, clean, comfortable room with good location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hamhem
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good size room. Very clean. Good front desk and reservation service. Only minor complaint is very near major downtown firehouse with lots of emergency vehicles with sirens during the night. Ok with us because we have the same near our home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: fourpines
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Hampton for a "Girls' Day(s) Out" and had a terrific experience. The hotel's Mission decor was delightful, the linens luxurious, the rooms much larger than expected and absolutely spotless, and the staff exemplary. Since we are all "of a certain age," we were a bit concerned about venturing out sans husbands, but the staff was so helpful that our concerns vanished within 15 minutes. They gave us excellent advice and were so efficient about making (and changing) dinner reservations. When we checked out, they told us they would miss us and begged us to stay another day. Believe me, we would have loved the opportunity since Chicago is such a great city and the people (and taxi drivers) so friendly. We found the area very safe and walked almost everywhere, though we did take taxis to Michigan Ave. so we could conserve our strength for shopping!
